story:
Nice of you to stop by...

Hi,

I'm Ant and against my better judgment, I am a writer. An independent one, for my sins. In other words, I am not tied to any big Publishing House nor do I have to stick to tight, nerve-wrecking deadlines to please my agent and publishers. It works for me, because that means I am pretty much the captain of my art.

However, being an Indie Author means I need to be more experimental, creative, daring and resourceful to get my work out to the wider audience.

It also means my writing does not pay my bills, which is not all that cool. For that reason I rely on a monotonous 9-to-5 to keep creditors at safe arm's length. Don't get me wrong, I am grateful for that, but it's not what I really am. Because of my creative and somewhat chaotic nature, I enjoy the freedom of working without timetable, schedules, shift, even if that means working into the silly hours of night. In addition, the idea of having a mobile office such as cafes, pubs, on a plane, on the beach, hotel, even in bed, can be liberating, although they do leave annoying reminders on my waistline. 

In the meantime, I have to resort to writing when all are asleep at home or at the office when my boss is not around, but please don’t tell him that. At least not until I become a rich author.

Damned if I don't

Now, DAMNED IF I DON'T, is the brainchild of that kind of work. Seven tales partly inspired by my travels, mishaps, mashups, and  a sometimes overindulgent imagination. But, although all the tales are work of fiction, there is an element of what life is about, and what happens when we think things too much, procrastinate, or simply feel too afraid to make a decisions - whether it's the right one or not.

I started writing them while working on my first novel, IN YOUR DREAMS. What started as an exercise to clear my writer’s block at the time morphed into some interesting, weird and why not, entertaining and outlandish stories, which I believe you will enjoy and hopefully share afterwards.

DAMNED IF I DON'T is all about life and it's absurdities. But hey, go ahead and take a brief peek at the stories by clicking here. Or here.

I’ve even created a playlist for every story with songs that I feel fit in with each tale's atmosphere. Er, yes, check them out here.

The truth is, there is no perfect time for chasing your dreams, taking that risk, kissing those lips, saying that ‘I love you’, or simply living your life. Carpe Diem. You either do it and face the consequences, good or bad, or you simply let it pass. Regrets, if any, can wait for later.  

And this is exactly what I am doing now. Carpe bloody-dieming the moment.

I am by nature a storyteller, and as such, I sprinkle my writing with elements of what I love and what surround me, so regardless of the genre, don't be surprised if you find references to music, travel and humor in my stories.

I therefore invite you to join in this carpe dieming quest and help get this book published. Not only will you help me get closer to that dream of filling the world with wonderful and absurd stories, but just as importantly, we'll also encourage other Indie Authors and more independent artists to take the risk, chase their dream and show their talent to the big, hungry audience out there.

What's more, this may even inspire you as well!

As someone very dear to me always says, 'you have the NO guaranteed, anything beyond that is a bonus'.

What we get back, is equal to what we give out.

It's the little things in life that makes the difference.  And here, my dear folks, is the reason for this campaign:

  • DAMNED IF I DON’T needs a professional content edit to make sure the flow, structure, every minute detail makes sense and is all in place. That way, you won’t be cursing me for confusing you while you attempt to make sense of what you’re reading. I'd rather you curse me for ending the stories the way I did.
  • Writers are humans. We make mistakes. Sometimes, when really inspired we can write absolute howlers, go over them 600 times and still not notice the crime to grammar we've committed. Therefore, we avail ourselves of great proofreaders to look out for them and make the corrections. They are mean, lean grammar machines. And cost a bob or two. But they’re worth it.
  • Fortunately, the cover is being lovingly designed by a very talented friend and he is happy to accept payment in liquid form. Even at the expense of his liver. I'm happy to oblige.
  • Once all the above is complete, I need to format and upload the final manuscript for it to be beautifully presented for paperback printing. In addition, there is the electronic (kindle) upload for those who prefer the techie way of reading.
  • There will also be a small element of merchandising and promotion to reach that wider audience. I do need to bribe you somehow.
  • Finally, we have the shipping costs for the paperback that will be sent to all you lovely people.

For all this I have come up with a budget of £2,000.00 to cover the above costs.

In return for your support, there will be some goodies thrown in. You will receive, once the book is published, a PDF version of the book; a [personally] signed paperback copy; a mention on my website, you may even be immortalized in the book's acknowledgment (yep, your name will be there!) and if you really go that extra penny (or cent) a mention in the dedication as well! Check out the ‘Perks’ column for exact details of what your contribution will get you.

But it's not just about me and my book, you know. Life has blessed me in many ways, but has also thrown in some pretty shitty challenges too. Cancer, stroke, dementia has touched my closest and dearest. Some have lost the battle, others still stubbornly refuse to give in. For that reason, I also plan to donate 10% of all your contributions to three charities I feel very strongly about; Macmillan's Cancer research, UK Stroke Association & Alzheimer’s Society. So, the more you give, the more that will also go into helping these awesome charities.

I appreciate this will be a bumpy ride and I am trying my damnedest (no pun intended) to see this project through, but I'm sure that with your support, some sweet-talking from my end (I was told threatening friends and family is still illegal in many countries), a bit of luck and lots of imagination, DAMNED IF YOU DON'T will be on many folks' kindles and bookshelves soon!

You can make a difference!

As with all these independent projects, you can make a huge difference, not only by contributing, but also spreading the word, so yes, do make some noise folks. And remember, this time it is yours truly, but there are others out there; writers, musicians, scientists, charity workers, or simply dreamers who don't have the resources, to realize their dream in making a positive impact to our lives. Reach out and help them too.

And what better way to do so than through Indiegogo!

Grateful to have you in this trip!

story:
Short Summary

After running the I Heart British TV website and community for 2 years now, we've noticed a couple problems common to British TV fans:

  • With so many British TV programs, it can be hard to keep track of which ones you've watched.
  • Once you've watched a lot of British TV, it can be hard to discover shows you haven't seen.

The British TV Guide contains well over 1000 British TV shows from the last 50 years. Shows are divided by category, and we provide air dates, descriptions, and a checklist of seasons and specials so you can mark off what you've seen.

 

Next time your favorite British TV service announces they're airing Series 6 of a show you like, you won't have to guess whether you've seen it - you can just check your field guide.

We'll also be creating a section on our website where you can look up the shows from the guide and see where you can watch them. As much as we'd love to include that information in the book, we don't want to print a guide that'll be outdated in a week. There will be plenty of journal space in the 8" x 10" guide so you can take notes.

 

What You Get

To make it both attractive and easy on the eyes, we're producing these 8" x 10" guides with larger-than-average text and color printing - along with plenty of journal space for jotting down notes, questions, or upcoming air dates on your favorite streaming service.

  • We're offering our Indiegogo supporters a 25% discount off the eventual retail price of $20
  • While we will be ordering extras, the Indiegogo campaign is the only way to guarantee you'll get a copy when they come out 
  • If we don't reach the full $5000 goal, we'll still go to print - but we'll print fewer copies. If you really want a copy, don't hesitate - pick your favorite option and pledge your support!

The Impact

Since we started IHeartBritishTV.com, we've heard so many great stories about how British TV has affected people's lives. We've had readers who watch on tablets during dialysis and caregivers who cherish the hours spent watching British TV with elderly loved ones. For others, including  myself, it's a shared interest between different generations of family members. 

Beyond that, a great many people have written in to say they feel better about themselves when they see all the "normal" people in British TV. British television doesn't push the older, or less conventionally attractive people to the sidelines. It's refreshing and quirky.

In short, British TV is a big deal to a lot of people - and we want to make it easier for people to discover and enjoy a wide variety of British shows. We've been doing it for 2 years with our website and Facebook group, and now's the time to take it to the next level.  We hope you'll choose to be a part of it.

Risks & Challenges

Hundreds of man hours have already been invested, so the British TV Field Guide is nearly complete. That means there's very, very little risk of not delivering on time in November. However, in the interest of being overly cautious, there's always the remote chance of minor delays with the printer.  We've arranged for a backup publisher in the event of price changes or problems with our first choice, just in case.

Mugs, towels, and tote bags will ship separately from your guide, and they'll likely arrive well  before it does. This campaign ends in mid-September, at which time the non-guide items will be produced and shipped. Those items should arrive before the end of October at the latest.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't afford to contribute, no worries - there will be chances to win a copy after the guide goes live on our website. In the meantime, we really appreciate your help in spreading the word to more British TV fans. Check out the share buttons at the top of this page - we love the extra attention :)

To everyone who's read this far, thank you - and happy watching!

While we will be ordering extras, the Indiegogo campaign is the only way to guarantee you'll get a copy when they come out 
If we don't reach the full $5000 goal, we'll still go to print - but we'll print fewer copies. If you really want a copy, don't hesitate - pick your favorite option and pledge your support!


The Impact
Since we started IHeartBritishTV.com, we've heard so many great stories about how British TV has affected people's lives. We've had readers who watch on tablets during dialysis and caregivers who cherish the hours spent watching British TV with elderly loved ones. For others, including  myself, it's a shared interest between different generations of family members. 
Beyond that, a great many people have written in to say they feel better about themselves when they see all the "normal" people in British TV. British television doesn't push the older, or less conventionally attractive people to the sidelines. It's refreshing and quirky.
In short, British TV is a big deal to a lot of people - and we want to make it easier for people to discover and enjoy a wide variety of British shows. We've been doing it for 2 years with our website and Facebook group, and now's the time to take it to the next level.  We hope you'll choose to be a part of it.

Risks & Challenges
Hundreds of man hours have already been invested, so the British TV Field Guide is nearly complete. That means there's very, very little risk of not delivering on time in November. However, in the interest of being overly cautious, there's always the remote chance of minor delays with the printer.  We've arranged for a backup publisher in the event of price changes or problems with our first choice, just in case.
Mugs, towels, and tote bags will ship separately from your guide, and they'll likely arrive well  before it does. This campaign ends in mid-September, at which time the non-guide items will be produced and shipped. Those items should arrive before the end of October at the latest.

Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't afford to contribute, no worries - there will be chances to win a copy after the guide goes live on our website. In the meantime, we really appreciate your help in spreading the word to more British TV fans. Check out the share buttons at the top of this page - we love the extra attention :)
To everyone who's read this far, thank you - and happy watching!

story:
Meet Sarai...

Sarai Mark is your everyday 7 year old with a dream. She grasps the concept of the privilege she has in the form of parental support to make her dreams a reality. When you buy this book, you buy into a cause. A cause where every book sold, will raise a dollar to help a girl in Africa get the education that she's blessed to have.

 

Our Needs & What You Get.....

  • The funding we receive will allow us to get mass production in motion and not only have this amazing book in your hands soon. It will also help us fund our cause and enable the money to be used positively, to impact young girls in Africa. 
  • We have beautiful goodies for our Indiegogo family. You have the opportunity to get some limited edition Oyiba stuff, that you will only get here. Custom Oyiba colored pencils, coloring/sticker books, Oyiba posters. Fun stuff the kids will love just in time for the holidays as well. We hope to meet our goals. But in the event we don't, we will still give 10% of whatever we raise to charity. Because like we said, we hope that beyond buying this amazing book, you buy into our cause. 

The AdaMark Foundation for Girls.....

Here are three reasons why we are giving back to them, and why you should check them out.

https://www.facebook.com/AdaMarkfoundation4girls/

  • Empower girls and women thru education and sports.
  • Advocate for girls education.
  • Empower girls to speak for themselves.
  • Give every girl a chance at life.

They stand by those words, we have seen it in action, and we stand by them...

"We know your little ones will enjoy reading this book, just as much as we have  enjoyed watching our little girl create this masterpiece. "

story:
The Brief:

The name's Gooley, Matthew H. Gooley.

I'm a New Jersey native that grew up on action and adventure stories (books & movies) and have always had an overactive imagination.  I've worked in film, television, radio, and theater for more than 20 years.

I've recently completed my debut spy novel titled, "Destiny Can Be Dangerous," an action packed espionage story about a fictional Domestic Protection Group that works within the U.S. to fight terror plots within our borders.  Primarily set throughout the Northeast United States with an exciting climax that takes our female secret agent and her team across the country in an attempt to stop a devastating plot against our government.

I'll periodically share excerpts from The Novel as I reach milestones in my fundraising, but here's a brief taste:

"[She] had still been watching the flip book of memories and emotions when she reached the bottom of the hill. Agent Billman had tossed his things in the back seat and said hello to a cold reception. He was nervous he had already started things off on the wrong foot by being late, but when he entered the vehicle he realized she was either spaced out or deep in concentration.

[She] looked at him and recognized his eyes and nose the most. The last time she had seen him, Agent Billman was at a prep meeting for a deep cover operation in New York. His hair was in a short crew cut now, but the beard she remembered was starting to grow in. Agent Robbins put the car in drive and accelerated away from the last of any relaxation or break time she'd allow herself until Agent Mitchell Howard was safely recovered from the enemy that she still knew so little about. "

What We Need & What You Get

This is probably as simple as it can get.  I'm pre-selling my book to provide you with a guaranteed perk while enabling me to print more copies for future sales and promotions.

I'm targeting a goal of $2,250.00 for this campaign

  • Every $15 "Pre-Order" Contribution adds to my marketing and advertising efforts and I can print 2 copies of The Novel and ship yours at no cost to you! (free shipping within the U.S.)  You get your copy (with a personal thank you note of course), and I get one to sell at full-cover-price or distribute in future promotions.
    • The beauty of this concept is that no matter what percentage of my goal I reach (10% or 1,000%), YOU will be making it possible for me to print copies of my novel so that I have a better chance of getting them in the hands of readers.
  • Obviously the primary perk is the $15 contribution for "Pre-Ordering" the book, but if you're feeling more generous and want to be more involved there are a few options available to you.  Check out the full list of perks. Click any perk to find out more about what you get!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute financially or do not want to pre-order a book at this time, you CAN  HELP simply by sharing this campaign across your social media networks and with friends and relatives.  That is just as much appreciated and equally helpful for my publishing escapades!

... AND if you have an extra second to "Like and Share" my Facebook page that would be awesome:

http://facebook.com/MatthewHGooley

story:
Who I am and the book history

I am Eliane Gordeeff or just Gordeeff.

I have 18 years of experience in animation, 20 years as a professor (in Brazil) and 7 years as a researcher. Now finishing my Ph.D. in Multimedia at Fine Arts Faculty of Lisbon University (sponsored by a CNPq/Brazil scholarship).

I have participated in plus than 16 academic events and have written more than 25 articles about animation. More and more, I fall in love with animation and all its manifestations.

This book project (little preview, click HERE)is based on my master’s degree in visual arts (2011), at the Federal University of Rio de Janeiro (Brazil), as I pointed out in the video. In the text, I discuss how Stop-motion visual can help the storytelling, analyzing 5 shorts:

  • Neighbours (Norman McLaren, 1952);

  • From Window to Cinema (Quiá Rodrigues, 1999);

  • The Old Man and the Sea (Alexander Petrov, 2000);

  • Adagio (Garry Bardin, 2000);

  • Aria (Piotr Sapegin, 2001).

And since then, I’m trying to publish the text, through some Publishing Companies, but without success.

Why this subject?

In this text, I analyzed the aesthetic of the technic, because I was very moved when I watched “Aria”, in 2000. And even in 2009, I still wanted to know why it moved me so deeply. That has been the reason I went for the Master degree research.

Well, all of this means that who can help me with this Project, will be helping to make true a 7 years old dream! As well she/he will help others to understand why a moving puppet moves us all.

 

About the Book Project

Of course, I launched this campaign to raise funds to support the first edition of the book. Which are divided as you can see below (for now, the values can vary up or down a little bit, it is a dynamic process):

  • Costs to print 500 copies with color images, A5 format, paper cover, and E-book (with fees) (+/-) ==============================================> 4,500.00 €
    Costs of images licensing (+/-) ===============================>     500.00 €
    Costs of linguistic revision (+/-) ==============================>   1,500.00 €
    *Production of: the campaign, the book, the graphic design, the book cover
      (the photo is from the making of a co-directed animation of mine, 2009),
      the translation and publishing  ===============================>         0.00 €
    Costs of IndieGoGo platform + Costs of credit card fees (+/-)==========>   707.40 €
    Bank fees and taxes (+/-) ===================================>     314.82 €
    Taxes on the value of mail submissions of Perks (+/-) ===============>     196.80 €
                                                                                                                        TOTAL(+/-) -----  7,719.02 €
  • As my background is in Graphic Design, I personally take care of the graphics production. All that in order to reach a lower cost.
  • You can already take a look in a little preview of the book. Just click HERE:
  • I offer perks in a total value higher than 7.700 € because I try to offer more choice possibilities to backers, and that way reach my goal.

Supporters of the book:

Some institutions are supporting this idea, which also reduced costs, as they didn’t charge for the licensing of images from their films. They are, for now:

CTAv (Brazil, producer of the animation "From Window to Cinema");
Tonic (former Pascal Blais, producer of the animation "The Old Man and the Sea");
Pravda (Norway, producer of the animation "Aria");
Stayer (Russia, producer of the animation "Adagio").

But the book also has the institutional support of:

Cinanima Festival (Portugal, where the book will be released later this year);
Monstra Festival (Portugal);
ZippyFrames.com - institutional and outreach support.

They believe in the work, and they think it's worth it.
I hope everyone who reads this text believes it too.

 

About this Campaign

I have very little time.
The Cinanima begins on November 12th, and the book can only begin to be printed after the end of the campaign - October 2nd - that is, the campaign has less than 50 days to run.

And if so I do not get all the money?

That is, who really wants and can help me, must also be fast, okay? :)

The campaign is flexible, that is, I pay a little more to IndieGoGo, but I get the amount raised, even if it does not reach my full goal.
And why do I risk that? Because I think it's important and it's too much work, for risking doing nothing in the end. I will do it anyway, according to the help you could give!

If I cannot print 500 books, I can print fewer ... with the images in B & W, anyway ... I'll find it a way!
In Brazil, we have a saying "I'm Brazilian, and I never give up" ... and who knows me, knows what I'm talking about! :)

And if so I do get more money?

It would be very nice, of course!
And in this case, I could print more books and with a hardcover, and so ...

 

Regarding Perks!

All kind of perks can be seen on the right side, and vary with the amount of the contribution, as usual. The highest contribution values are focused on educational institutions.
I already inform that books will be sent, logically, after its publishing process, after I receive them and its launch in Cinanima Festival. That is, after the 20th of November.

And why this delay?

I'm going to be in Cinanima for the book’s release and doing the news coverage of the Festival for the Zippy Frames site, from 12th to 18th November. Only after the Festival is over I will be able to take care of packing and sending the books. However...

It is also worth noting that I do not receive money from IndieGoGo as soon as the contributor makes the contribution, but only 15 useful days after the campaign is finished! And it still depends on the time of the bank transaction, between the US and Portugal, for the money to reach my account! (I'll need to do a disbursement after 20days campaign, just to pay the half cost of publishing.)

Just after that, I can send all Perks, okay?
I hope you understand me and do not be upset with me, please ... I would also like to receive the money faster! ... Even because I will have bills to pay!

I will keep everyone informed!

And the E-book?

The publisher will be responsible for sending the e-books, They carry the editing control of the e-books, which ones, will be sent by email - therefore, double-check if you typed the right email address !!!

And that can only be done after the campaign closes, and according to the publisher, okay?

 

Positive points of the project

  • It is very difficult to find a book that looks at the aesthetic and the narrative of stop-motion animation. This book comes to diminish this issue a little.
  • Just as it is rare an animated book written by a South American. It’s even more, to be written by a South American woman !!!
  • So, despite being suspicious ?, I think it's worth investing in something different. Since each writer carries the look of their culture, I certainly carry a Brazilian look, tinted by Russian (my father was Russian), as well as a feminine eye about animation.

 

And to Finish

  • If you can help with a contribution, please do it. And I ask you to help to make some noise about my campaign, too - you can use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • I'm doing everything, I have just a help of my life partner. So, sometimes is difficult to do everything fast as I would like. So, I thank you for your patience. :)
  • All images showed here are just to illustrate, they are not totally defined. However, the book will be something very similar.
  • Any question, let me know, please.

!!! ThAnKs To EvErYbOdY !!!

story:
Who Am I and Who's the Community?

My name is Erin Casey, and I'm an urban fantasy and YA fantasy writer, as well as a mom to seven birds (several who are rescues).

Why is this a big deal? Well, my main character, Bianca, is a werebird! Can you guess where I got the inspiration? 

For daily work, I'm a proofreader at Pearson. Volunteer wise, I'm the Communications and Student Relationships Manager at the Iowa Writers' House, a literary organization focused on providing workshops to the community and helping writers with their craft, career, and community.

I'm also the Director of The Writers' Rooms, a non-profit corporation focused on providing a free and safe environment to all writers no matter their gender, skill set, background, income, etc. I love both organizations because it gives me the chance to work with the literary community and help people with their writing. 

"The Purple Door District" started out as part of a canon that AE Kellar and I are writing together and hoping to publish in the future. PDD was a smaller component of it, but I fell in love with the concept and asked if I could write a series based on it to help support our main canon. She has been vital in helping me make sure I keep my facts straight! We jokingly say that she's the brain and I'm the heart of our series. I couldn't have done this without her. 

Now I'm looking back to the community for help. My dream is to become an author and help inspire other people. Community plays a big part in my life now, because it was something I grew up without as a child. "The Purple Door District" is all about people of different backgrounds, abilities, and beliefs coming together to save a young woman from being hunted. I'm going to self-publish this book, but I need help. The funds are much greater than I expected, and at the same time, I want to support artists, marketers, and editors who believe in this story and want to help bring it to life. 

Your generous contributions will allow me to publish the books and support additional creators: 

  • Writer and Editor Leona Bushman who edited the book and is an author herself.

  • Writer and Proofreader, Shakyra Dunn who proofread and sensitivity read my book. See her book down below. 

  • Artist Gabriella Bujdoso who has graciously agreed to create character art (coming soon). 

  • Artist Oni Algarra who is creating character portraits. (Bianca is featured below)  

  • PA specialist Sara Cunningham PA who creates marketing items that you can both get for free or purchase to help you get immersed in "The Purple Door District." 

  • Jewelry maker Amanda Bouma who will help create jewelry for the book. 

Not only would this ensure the production of this book, it would open up the possibility to a series that would continue to bring more work to you and invest in these members of the literary community. 

What I Need

My goal is to be open and honest with everyone, so here are what the funds will go towards: 

  • Editing through Leona Bushman $500

  • Author Website Maintenance (x1year) $300  (so I can continue to hold author interviews and provide writing tips and publicity to the community). 

  • Business Cards $40

  • Book printing through Ingramspark ($4.81 per book) x 100   $600 (shipping included)

  • Book printing through Ingramspark (hard cover 10.84) x 10 Special Edition  $120 (shipping included)

  • Ingramspark Print and Ebook Set up  $50

  • ISBN through IngramSpark and Browker (10 ISBNs)   $300  (more ISBNs now means I can provide the books in various platforms) 

  • Art Marketing  $500 (for Gabriella/Oni)

  • Promotional Publishing/swag  $500 (for Sara Cunningham PA)

  • Cover $50 (for artist on Fiverr)

  • E-book Conversion   $100  (to convert the paper book to an e-book so it's available to more people)

  • Audio Conversion  $300   (to convert to an audiobook for people who have trouble with reading. I want to make it accessible to as many people as possible. This would likely go towards a local author I have in mind for audio work.) 

  • Copyright $25

  • Additional Costs (additional marketing/publicity, donation books, office supplies, ec). 

What You Get

  • Character portraits and art! Just look at those awesome pictures by Oni and Gabriella
  • Book swag!
  • First look at items to be sold alongside "The Purple Door District" by PA Extraordinaries and the chance to be the first to receive them
  • Jewelry and items that I and Amanda Bouma create for "The Purple Door District" 
  • E-books
  • Printed copies
  • A one-on-one writing talk with me
  • and much more! 

The Impact

I can't even express how important your support is. Self-publishing is becoming a  more respected form of publishing, and I can't do it without your help. In a time when our country feels so divided, I think it's valuable to bring a book with a diverse cast to the community. The main character is Latina. She works with parahumans who are Latino, Native American, black, Caucasian, LGBT, etc, and with those who have different beliefs to survive. Even if the different parahumans have prejudices against one another, they're able to put it aside to make their community safer for themselves and for their children. I hope that people who read this will see themselves in these characters. As I get deeper in to the series, I want to bring in more people of different nationalities, beliefs, and abilities so they can feel represented as well. 

You have the opportunity to see a group of creative minds come together to create this book and its future series. We can do this together, and in December, I hope you'll feel proud holding this book in your hands.

Other Ways You Can Help

I completely understand that you may not be able to donate, and that's okay! There are other ways you can help! 

  • Share this campaign on social media: Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Tumblr, etc. 
  • Share this campaign word-of-mouth! Get your friends involved. Show them how they can help a creative community. 
  • Let me know what you would like to see promoted. More jewelry? More art? What representation do you want to see in future books? 

 

Thank you from the bottom of my heart! I can't do this without you! 

Cheers!

Erin Casey

www.erincasey.org

Who Am I and Who's the Community?
My name is Erin Casey, and I'm an urban fantasy and YA fantasy writer, as well as a mom to seven birds (several who are rescues).

Why is this a big deal? Well, my main character, Bianca, is a werebird! Can you guess where I got the inspiration? 
For daily work, I'm a proofreader at Pearson. Volunteer wise, I'm the Communications and Student Relationships Manager at the Iowa Writers' House, a literary organization focused on providing workshops to the community and helping writers with their craft, career, and community.
I'm also the Director of The Writers' Rooms, a non-profit corporation focused on providing a free and safe environment to all writers no matter their gender, skill set, background, income, etc. I love both organizations because it gives me the chance to work with the literary community and help people with their writing. 
"The Purple Door District" started out as part of a canon that AE Kellar and I are writing together and hoping to publish in the future. PDD was a smaller component of it, but I fell in love with the concept and asked if I could write a series based on it to help support our main canon. She has been vital in helping me make sure I keep my facts straight! We jokingly say that she's the brain and I'm the heart of our series. I couldn't have done this without her. 
Now I'm looking back to the community for help. My dream is to become an author and help inspire other people. Community plays a big part in my life now, because it was something I grew up without as a child. "The Purple Door District" is all about people of different backgrounds, abilities, and beliefs coming together to save a young woman from being hunted. I'm going to self-publish this book, but I need help. The funds are much greater than I expected, and at the same time, I want to support artists, marketers, and editors who believe in this story and want to help bring it to life. 
Your generous contributions will allow me to publish the books and support additional creators: 

Writer and Editor Leona Bushman who edited the book and is an author herself.


Writer and Proofreader, Shakyra Dunn who proofread and sensitivity read my book. See her book down below. 


Artist Gabriella Bujdoso who has graciously agreed to create character art (coming soon). 


Artist Oni Algarra who is creating character portraits. (Bianca is featured below)  


PA specialist Sara Cunningham PA who creates marketing items that you can both get for free or purchase to help you get immersed in "The Purple Door District." 



Jewelry maker Amanda Bouma who will help create jewelry for the book. 

Not only would this ensure the production of this book, it would open up the possibility to a series that would continue to bring more work to you and invest in these members of the literary community. 

What I Need
My goal is to be open and honest with everyone, so here are what the funds will go towards: 

Editing through Leona Bushman $500
Author Website Maintenance (x1year) $300  (so I can continue to hold author interviews and provide writing tips and publicity to the community). 
Business Cards $40

Book printing through Ingramspark (hard cover 10.84) x 10 Special Edition  $120 (shipping included)
Ingramspark Print and Ebook Set up  $50
ISBN through IngramSpark and Browker (10 ISBNs)   $300  (more ISBNs now means I can provide the books in various platforms) 
Art Marketing  $500 (for Gabriella/Oni)
Promotional Publishing/swag  $500 (for Sara Cunningham PA)
Cover $50 (for artist on Fiverr)
E-book Conversion   $100  (to convert the paper book to an e-book so it's available to more people)
Audio Conversion  $300   (to convert to an audiobook for people who have trouble with reading. I want to make it accessible to as many people as possible. This would likely go towards a local author I have in mind for audio work.) 
Copyright $25
Additional Costs (additional marketing/publicity, donation books, office supplies, ec).

Character portraits and art! Just look at those awesome pictures by Oni and Gabriella
Book swag!
First look at items to be sold alongside "The Purple Door District" by PA Extraordinaries and the chance to be the first to receive them
Jewelry and items that I and Amanda Bouma create for "The Purple Door District" 
E-books

and much more!

story:
Hi! A good-paying union job catapulted me from the working poor into the middle class. I have tried to pay my good fortune forward by fighting for the dignity of the working class as a labor leader, a community activist and a candidate for political office. Capitalism Killed the Middle Class: 25 Ways the System is Rigged Against You is my continued legacy, getting on paper what transformed my beliefs, sharing what I've discovered that inspires me to fight on.

 

This book matters. Each chapter, taken alone, tells a part of my story and ties it to a trend or a phenomenon that will likely change the way we work, live and survive. From housing to the gig economy, what will the future look like? I have had both Republicans and Democrats find something that resonated with them in these pages and I hope this book opens a dialogue, a sharing of ideas. I want to thank contributors from Finland, Switzerland, Mexico and all over this country for their insights and feedback.

As a retired union guy living on a fixed income, I need your help to get this information out there. By raising the funds to publish rather than romancing a traditional publisher, I hope this effort points out the possibilities of grassroots action. 

If I'm successful at this effort, I'll sign a contract by the end of this month for $2500 that will get the book into stores and online for maximum exposure.

Perks: I will distribute ebook copies to those who can give more than $15. The top tier folks ($500+) will receive a hard copy, art work from the book, and a meal with the author. If I fall short on fundraising, the money will still help offset the costs of publication.

The Impact

This book has been a two-year labor of love and I haven't found anything like it anywhere on the book shelves. I have, during those two years, shared my research findings on my Facebook page www.fb.com/capitalism-killed and will continue to do so. We have been kept in the dark for too long; an educated citizen is an involved one.

I'll be working harder than ever after the book is published, scheduling readings and book signings across the nation. I'll work out discounts for classrooms and clubs to encourage the exchange of ideas and to spur on new ones.

Other Ways You Can Help

Remember, no matter the size of the contribution, it will move the project forward and is appreciated. Be sure to send me an email for the mailing list and tell your friends! Indiegogo has some great share tools. Don't be afraid to use them! Thanks!

In solidarity,

Dan

story:
Puertorriqueños en el Jazz (Resumen) Debido a su énfasis en la improvisación, la interpretación del Jazz requiere un alto nivel de conocimiento y virtuosismo; es música que por su calidad y complejidad se le conoce como la música clásica del siglo 20. Los músicos puertorriqueños han sido protagonistas de la historia de esta música desde sus comienzos en Nueva Orleans y otras ciudades en los Estados Unidos hace más de 100 años. 

 Rafael Hernández, junto a su hermano Jesús Hernández y más de una docena de puertorriqueños, llevaron el Jazz por primera vez a Europa con el Teniente James Reese Europe y los Harlem Hellfighters, la Orquesta de el Ejército de los Estados Unidos durante la Primera Guerra Mundial. 

 En la época de oro del Swing y las Big Band, cuando el Jazz llegó a ser la música popular de los estadounidenses, Juan Tizol y otros puertorriqueños aportaron su intelecto musical al éxito de éstas orquestas. Juan Tizol y Rogelio "Ram" Ramirez fueron los creadores de las composiciones Caravan y Lover Man, que hoy se consideran clásicos del Jazz (Jazz Standards) y que han sido interpretadas y grabadas por los mejores músicos de Jazz.

 Cuando el Jazz se reencuentra con la música Cubana y Latina, músicos puertorriqueños como Tito Rodríguez y Tito Puente fueron reconocidos Maestros de esta fusión llamada Latin Jazz, que revolucionó el panorama musical internacional. Desde la década de 1960 hasta el presente el Maestro y virtuoso bajista Eddie Gómez se ha destacado en varios estilos y ha grabado con los mejores intérpretes del Jazz, entre ellos el pianista Bill Evans. 

 A finales del siglo 20 nombres como William Cepeda, David Sánchez, y Miguel Zenón escriben otro capítulo importante fusionando el Jazz con elementos de la música folklórica puertorriqueña (Bomba, Plena, Música Jíbara). En el siglo 21 los jazzistas puertorriqueños continúan recibiendo reconocimientos y el futuro del Jazz en Puerto Rico parece estar en buenas manos con el surgimiento de jóvenes comprometidos con la educación, disciplina y excelencia musical.

En Boricua Jazz nos adentramos a la fascinante historia de los músicos que aportaron al desarrollo del Jazz Puertorriqueño.

Boricua Jazz se encuentra en su etapa de edición y solicitud de permisos de material fotográfico para su publicación a comienzos del año 2019. 

 

Datos del Autor

Wilbert Sostre, historiador y crítico de Jazz, por los pasados 15 años ha escrito reseñas de grabaciones y eventos para publicaciones como Jazz Times, Jazz Inside Magazine, Latin Jazz Network, All About Jazz, Diálogo, y para su blog Puerto Rico Jazz, prjazz.blogspot.com, entre otras. Además ha sido invitado a las emisoras Radio Universidad, Radio Oro, Yunque Radio, Vid 90.3 y el canal de televisión ABC Puerto Rico para compartir sus conocimientos sobre el Jazz.

Actualmente produce el programa Puerto Rico Jazz en Radio Vieques www.radiovieques.net, que se transmite todos los miércoles de 12 a 1pm con repeticiones jueves 8:30pm, viernes 10pm y domingo 5pm

Fue el redactor de las biografías de jazz para el Museo de la Música de Puerto Rico. Actualmente realiza un trabajo de investigación sobre la historia de los puertorriqueños en el jazz.

story:
Short Summary

So here's the deal. This campaign and the book, while hilarious, are not a joke. I really did write a book about the Definition of Sport and I really do need help sending it to sports media personalities. And I actually mean the definition; it is not intended as a gimmick. I believe that the definition in WHAT IS SPORT?  accurately distinguishes between sports and those activities that, while very physical, should be characterized as something else, like "Athletitives" or chid birth.  

Your money will send the book to the media entities and people listed in the perks and will help defray some of the costs of publication.  

Sport is not the most important thing in the world. Cinnabon is. And family and healthcare and human trafficking and criminal justice and education and spiritual and religious formation. But we find a lot of collective and personal solace participating, watching, and analyzing sport. It has a significant place in the fullness of the human experience.  And practically speaking, we simply live in a culture dominated by around the clock media coverage and debate.  WHAT IS SPORT? antagonizes and then resolves a small piece of that on-going debate.  Here's a link to the Tiny Talk I did for TEDxGreenville that generally summarizes the definition:

https://youtu.be/m-c6gjb_qoE

 

Why this book?

I wanted to be the person to officially define sport.  That is it.  To stake out a small corner of history.  

 

Why these donations?

  • You are preordering an autographed copy;
  • You are helping with numerous costs, including design, editing, marketing, production, and freight; and
  • You are supporting me and the project to distribute the book widely

Obviously, the perks are not traditional perks. Think of them as "privileges." The privilege to adopt a "Woj Bomb" or Amin Elhassan or something called The PFT Commenter as your personal sponsored sports media celebrity.  You'll obviously get the book for yourself. But it is mostly about helping me street team the book to various media platforms for discussion.  It is literally the whole point of doing the book. 

Any contribution helps.  Thank you, genuinely. 

 

Why me?

For many who know me from other endeavors, including music and law and semi-professional pantomime, a sport book might seem like a non-sequitur or at least not on-brand.  But, it is not.  First, it arose directly out of my song blogging project, www.thepressjunket.com, where I blogged, in song, multiple times a week about current events and culture.  I authored the original version of the definition there. Second, this book is part of a larger history of personal art and self-publishing.  I am interested in a lot of things. And we have the fortune to live at a time when technology makes developing and sharing one's art possible. This book is just an extension of that work for me.

Lastly, I am a federal litigator. And so I've had a lot of experience making up and then applying fake definitions.  I am also a former Furman University baseball player. And so I have watched a lot of other  people play sports very nearby from front-row bench seating. For my experience at the very, very highest levels of law and spectatorship, I am uniquely qualified to tell others that what they do is not sport.  

 

Excerpt

"The Guide, however, remains more an observation as to the natural order of things than some argument. It is a classification, as of a genus or phyla, that simply names the phenomena, or maybe a theory, in scientific parlance, about the way sport exists in culture. In this respect, it is not some new thought. It is more akin to discovery. Like all great science, the Author of the Guide is simply identifying that which already is, or the way things are, rather than attempting to propose how they should or ought to be. The definition of sport, therefore, flows from the truth of the very thing itself. It is not an attempt to conjure a definition but instead to describe one. It is natural law. And, in that sense, any disagreement you might have with it is necessarily one with the universe, so to speak, and not with the courage of the Author to transcribe it. Humbly, the Guide is something less than divine inspiration reduced to tablets but much more than the work of a mere man.

Begotten not created."

- D. Josev Brewer, WHAT IS SPORT?

story:
The concept for this book came into our minds late Summer in 2020.  It started with a meme, as so many things do these days, and a small group of friends.  We sarcastically built a set of social justice ABCs off this meme.  Very quickly, we both realized this was great information and a spark ignited - we immediately knew we wanted to turn this into a book for our kids.  

As we watch our country around us struggle through challenge after challenge, we noticed our own kids listening.  As moms to four kids between the two of us, all under five, we realized it was our responsibility to ensure those listening ears are learning.  We knew it was on us to explain tough concepts and social structures.  And we knew these were not conversations that could wait.  This book, this spark, was what we knew we needed - and we thought, if we need it, how many other grown-ups need it too?

As grown-ups, it’s easy to forget just how much of our children’s knowledge comes from what we tell them. Research has shown that the more motivated kids are to learn early in life, the more likely it is they will be successful later.  By asking and answering questions, grown-ups play a vital role in a child’s learning by helping the child reconcile new experiences and sending the larger message that curiosity and learning are welcome.

Just because kids are little doesn’t mean they lack the ability to make sense of complicated issues.  In fact, it’s quite the opposite.  I’m sure you’ve heard the expression, “little kids are like sponges.”  They are constantly soaking up information from all around them.  That makes the younger ages an even better time to start talking about important ideas and issues.  The more we normalize social topics and asking questions, the better we can equip our children for the future; the more we can encourage future generations to do better; promote better; be better. Change starts at home...

It sounds like a tough job, we know, but that’s exactly why this book was written!  We want to help you and your kids to not only understand important ideas, but we also want to give you the tools to easily discuss them and come up with creative ways to make a positive change!

 

 'What is Privilege?' is an ABC book designed specifically for grown-ups and children to read together.  We want to inspire little minds to make big changes!  As you read through the book, you will encounter important social issues and societal concepts.  We've taken these grown-up topics and broken them down so they can be easily understood by children!  In these pages there are kid-friendly definitions, intriguing illustrations, and prompts/ideas for starting conversations.  We also include important, relevant information on each topic, as well as supplemental information for further learning.

Each page of this book is meant to be a starting point.  Follow the QR codes on each page to connect to our website - where the learning continues!  Our website will feature a full library - expanding on every topic covered in our book.  You will see vetted suggestions for additional books, articles, videos, podcasts, and other content related to the page you're reading in the book!  We're very carefully curating this library to include only accurate and educated sources, so you can be sure you're sharing with your kids the most reliable information.

 

 Kayla DeWalt  |  As a full time work at home mom, Kayla’s days are sometimes full of chaos, but always sweet! Kayla has a bachelor’s degree in Psychology from Michigan State (Go Green!), was a member of the United States Army Reserves, and currently works in the investigative field. Kayla has a passion for being creative, from graphic design to DIY home projects, and has had a lifelong goal of one day writing a book! Kayla and her husband, Patrick, have a miracle IVF baby, Maleiya, who is the light of their lives! For Kayla, this book is a way to ensure that families feel comfortable talking about the hard topics with their kids, so that together we can tear down and rebuild any system that fails to protect each person equally.

Ashley Gooding | Ashley works full-time as an analyst, spending her days swimming in spreadsheets and loving every minute.  She has a bachelors degree in Business Administration, with a major in Accounting and a minor in Finance and Economics from the University of Michigan (Go Blue!).  Ashley and her high-school sweetheart turned husband, Josh, have three children, Elijah, Genevieve and Jack.  Together they founded a local Agnostic Community Support Group in early 2020.  They believe every person deserves kindness and support and they work tirelessly to foster a positive community.  This book, for Ashley, is one step further in helping to open up conversation and create a space for continued education and social growth.

 

 As you may have already noticed, we're trying to move quickly with this book.  Our goal is to have the book launch the same week as the President's Inauguration in January 2021!  We're making great progress, but we definitely need YOUR help to make those goals happen!  Here's our plan for the book:

 

 What we are seeking monetarily is what we will need to bring this book to life.  On the chance that this project should be overfunded, we will invest the additional funding into ordering more copies of the book for distribution and donation.

Risks and challenges

This book is still in the writing phase. We feel confident in our timeline moving forward, but the entirety of the creation does still need to pass through editing and publishing. We know that COVID-19 has caused publishing delays for other authors, but we are hopeful they are working out the kinks in their systems so that we can proceed in a timely manner. We will, of course, keep every contributor up to date as we move for as to any delays - or successes - that we cross!

 

 

Thank you.  First, for reading this far.  Second, for trusting us to help you to teach your children to do better.  To be better.  To make a change in this country for the better.  As we have worked our way through writing this book, it has been an endless cycle of excitement, doubt, and possibility: knowing the importance of getting it right, striving to do these serious and adult topics justice while making them “kid-friendly,” and worrying.  Worrying if we’re doing too much, not enough, doing it right, or if we’re way off the mark.  We have poured so much of ourselves into these pages.  We cannot thank you enough for helping us to make this dream a reality.
story_txt: The concept for this book came into our minds late Summer in 2020.  It started with a meme, as so many things do these days, and a small group of friends.  We sarcastically built a set of social justice ABCs off this meme.  Very quickly, we both realized this was great information and a spark ignited - we immediately knew we wanted to turn this into a book for our kids.  As we watch our country around us struggle through challenge after challenge, we noticed our own kids listening.  As moms to four kids between the two of us, all under five, we realized it was our responsibility to ensure those listening ears are learning.  We knew it was on us to explain tough concepts and social structures.  And we knew these were not conversations that could wait.  This book, this spark, was what we knew we needed - and we thought, if we need it, how many other grown-ups need it too?As grown-ups, it’s easy to forget just how much of our children’s knowledge comes from what we tell them. Research has shown that the more motivated kids are to learn early in life, the more likely it is they will be successful later.  By asking and answering questions, grown-ups play a vital role in a child’s learning by helping the child reconcile new experiences and sending the larger message that curiosity and learning are welcome.Just because kids are little doesn’t mean they lack the ability to make sense of complicated issues.  In fact, it’s quite the opposite.  I’m sure you’ve heard the expression, “little kids are like sponges.”  They are constantly soaking up information from all around them.  That makes the younger ages an even better time to start talking about important ideas and issues.  The more we normalize social topics and asking questions, the better we can equip our children for the future; the more we can encourage future generations to do better; promote better; be better. story:
(The above Rudy interview took place at Mark Weiss' "Welcome to my Exhibition", live stream Halloween event 2020)

NOTE: This is phase 2 of the pre-order funding. Over 50% was already raised in the first phase!

Did You Bang Your Head to Quiet Riot's, Metal Health?

I did, too.

I discovered Quiet Riot in 1979 with the lineup—Kevin DuBrow, Randy Rhoads, Rudy Sarzo, and Drew Forsyth on drums.

After Randy and Rudy left the band to join Ozzy Osborne, I thought that was the end of the music and the great band Quiet Riot. Little did I know, it was just the beginning.

Hi, I'm Missy Whitney, and I was running the Quiet Riot Squad Fan Club when the #1 Billboard charted album, Metal Health, came out in 1983. I've wanted to write about my unique experiences running the fan club and completed my book earlier this year. It includes photos from my scrapbook, some memorabilia, and even handwritten letters from Kevin.

The book is a journey, starting from when I was 16. Shortly thereafter, I became a fan(atic) promoter of Kevin's solo career, attending 105 gigs, up through Metal Health's release and beyond. I’ve selected my favorite band and fan accounts, plus, video shoot stories from “Bang Your Head” and “Cum on Feel the Noize,” and talk about the shock of Kevin's untimely death in 2007.

Plus, much more...

In my quest to find the perfect photo for the book’s cover, I met the iconic 80s rock photographer, Mark "Weissguy" Weiss. He was curious about my project, and after a few phone conversations (I'm west coast, he’s east), Mark shared a bigger vision for my book.

As it turns out, Mark was friends with Quiet Riot, and he suggested adding some of his incredible photos. And then Ron Sobol also came aboard, offering photos from his treasure trove from the Randy Rhoads years.

With your pre-order, this book will be a collective gift in honor and memory of Kevin's 65th birthday. Plus, a portion of all book proceeds will be donated to the Pancreatic Cancer Cure Foundation in memory of Frankie Banali. 

And in the spirit of the Quiet Riot Squad Fan Club, I’ve designed several packages with fan goodies like vinyl stickers, band photographs, t-shirts, and a limited-edition photo guitar pick commemorating Kevin's birthday.

Please check the FAQ. And if you don't see your question answered, feel free to contact me. I'll do my best to get back to you as soon as possible.  

Please follow and share with your fellow headbanger friends on FaceBook: 

www.facebook.com/MissyWhitneyQuietRiotSquad/

I look forward to sharing this journey with all you -- Quiet Riot fans.  Now go and pick your perk package! All packages are on the right side of this page. Click each box to see what you get!

Keep on Rollin'!

Missy Whitney

story:
Mandalay Bay 32-124

Hola, gracias por tu interés en apoyarme. Me han concedido el honor de realizar una residencia artística durante el mes de febrero de 2020 en Escape 2 create, en Seaside, Florida. Escape 2 create es un espacio multidisciplinario sin fines de lucro que otorga residencias artísticas a creadores de literatura, artes visuales y música de todo el mundo. Yo soy el primer mexicano al que se le otorga dicho reconocimiento.

Puedes ver más información sobre el programa aquí: http://www.escape2create.org/

 

Thank you for you will to support my work. I´ll be doing an artistic residence in February 2020 at Escape to create in Seaside Florida. Escape 2 create is a space for all kind of worldwide artists to hold artistic residences to create. I´m the first mexican with that honour.

Yo can look for mor info about Escape 2 create here: http://www.escape2create.org/

 

¿Qué hace falta? / What is needed?

Escape 2 create proporciona alojamiento y un estipendio semanal para los gastos de transporte local y alimentación. Lo que no proporciona es el transporte aéreo ni el seguro de vida y gastos médicos necesarios para la residencia. Por lo tanto, el dinero recaudado será utilizado de esa manera, en comprar el vuelo redondo Ciudad de México - Panama City, Florida - Ciudad de México y el seguro de vida y gastos médicos.

 

Escape to create will provide housing and a weekly stipend for local transportation and food. Airfare costs and insurance are to be covered by the artist. Thaths where cou can help, all the money will be used to cover the insurance and the round flight Mexico City-Panama City, Florida-Mexico City.

 

El proyecto / The project

El primero de octubre de 2017, Stephen Paddock disparó desde la ventana de su cuarto del hotel Mandalay Bay contra, aproximadamente, veintidós mil asistentes a un concierto de música country. Aún no está claro el por qué o para qué. Esta obra se centra en las últimas dos horas que pasó Paddcok a solas en su cuarto de hotel, mientras reflexiona sobre lo que está a punto de hacer.

Aunque el hombre se encuentra solo en el cuarto de hotel, su cabeza no deja mantener conversaciones imaginarias con las personas que de una u otra manera están involucradas con él. Su novia, una prostituta, su padre (quien estuvo entre los más buscados del FBI), su hermano. Todos ellos, quizá más personas forman parte de esas últimas dos horas en el 32-124 del Mandalay Bay.

¿Qué lleva a un hombre, aparentemente sano y normal, a una acción así? ¿Qué pasa por su cabeza mientras prepara el tiroteo? Sobre eso quiere reflexionar esta obra aún sin título. No quiere contestar tajantemente ninguna pregunta, sólo abrir posibilidades.

 

On October 1st, 2017, Stephen Paddock shoot from the window of his room at the Mandalay Bay Hotel against approximately twenty-two thousand attendees to a country music concert. It's not yet clear why. This work focuses on the last two hours before that event, when Paddcok was alone in his hotel room, while reflecting on what he was about to do.

Although the man is alone in the hotel room, his head is not, allowing imaginary conversations with people who are in one way or another involved with him. His girlfriend, a prostitute, his father (who was among the FBI's most wanted), his brother. All of them, maybe more, are part of those last two hours in the room 32-124 of Mandalay Bay.

What brings a man, apparently healthy and normal, to such an action? What goes through his head while he prepares the shooting? We don´t want to give any answers, just explore the possibilities.

 

Otras formas de ayudar / Other ways you can help

Sé que no es fácil ayudar a veces económicamente, pero puedes ayudarme difundiendo la campaña entre tus amigos y conocidos, quizá alguien de tus contactos esté interesado y en posibilidades de ayudar.

Otra forma de ayudar es comprando una versión digital de mi primera obra La Princesa y El Ministro. Esta obra obtuvo el Premio Bellas Artes Baja California de Dramaturgia en 2017, el más importante de México. Está disponible en Amazon en español, inglés y francés. No necesitas un KIndle para leerla, puedes bajar la app gratuita y leerla en cualquier dispositivo. Aquí el link:

https://www.amazon.com.mx/s?k=Alonso+Fiallega&a...

 

I know sometimes it´s hard to help with money, but it would be a great help if you tell your friends and family about this project. Maybe someone of them would be intrsted and able to help.

Another way is buying a digital versiona of my play The Princess & The Minister. This play won the Baja California Fine Arts Award for Playwrighting in 2017, the most important award in Mexico. Tha play is available in spanish, english and french in Amazon. You don´t need a Kindle to read it, you can download the free app on any device, and read it. Here is the link:

 https://www.amazon.com/s?i=digital-text&rh=...

story:
Thank you for visiting my Indiegogo campaign page.

OK, for those of you who want to cut to the chase, I made this pretty infographic, plus they said it'll make the pitch visually appealing.

An emotive longer piece follows.

The First Story 

‘Foe becomes Charity’ is the first story I’d like to illustrate and publish. It’s about a lady, named Charity Foe McGuinness, who learns that forgiveness is a choice we can all make.

This video tells you a bit more about the story:

 

And in this video I let you in on the story behind the story:

 

Please keep watching the updates section for well, updates on the progress of this inspirational story on forgiveness journey into reality. 

Here is a list of the other stories waiting to be illustrated and published. I will be recording videos, similar to those above, about all of them and posting them up soon!

1. Consider the Lily(s)
2. The pearl diver
3. Training wheels
4. How goslings learn to fly
5. Greated garlic (not a typo)
6. The seed inside
7. The gift to see the good
8. The how to guide for floundering fish, by Ellie Brown
9. Eagles are meant to fly
10. Heavenly Brothers
11. The toy maker
12. Diamonds and decisions are forever
13. Threads of power
14. The Creator blowing bubbles
15. A boatload of abundance
16. You can't beat love
17. Healing a war horse
19. How taste buds die
20. The caterpillar and the worm
21. The bird's nest
22. See some more of me oil ~ The sequel to Greated Garlic

For those of you interested in the long version of who I am, here you go.

Early Years

As a teenager I used to make life books for my high school friends, using magazines (remember those) and making up tales about their past and future lives. I also wrote poetry as a teen and into my early 20’s.  Then life kind of got in the way and since the early 2000’s I didn’t devote much time to creative writing.

Now that you know I’ve had this burning artistic dream since my youth, let’s move on to the…

Dramatic Life Event

In 2017, I was snapped out of my zombie like state of work-home-repeat by an unexpected job loss, followed by the break down of my marriage. Coming to the shocking conclusion that I’m not my job or my marriage, and through a series of coincidental (not really) events, I started a journey of self-development and a reawakening to self-awareness.

Like any enlightened person would do, I took out a $20 000 loan to pay for Bob Proctor’s coaching program (and a few other things, like car insurance) and what I learnt changed my mind. Just as a side note, one year and three weeks after getting out the loan, I paid it all back, still in the same job while earning less money and no it wasn’t from book sales or eating baked beans on toast for a year. I must love beans huh?

Inspirational Turn-Around

Having the right mindset is the key, that and a bunch of coincidences (no such thing).

As I tried to make sense of what I was learning, I found writing stories helped me to embed the information in my own life. I was learning by writing and posting Facebook live videos, because that’s what you do when you are trying to be an influencer - I didn’t have any left-over money for butt implants.

I also had some changes in my relationship status that brought new challenges and again, to make sense of them, I found writing stories a great outlet.

Time To Milk The COVID Cow 

During COVID19 isolation, with a boss who decided that 99% of what I normally did, I shouldn’t do from home, to save him money, I had time to write. I have 22 stories completed thus far, ranging from 300 to 5500 words, ready to be illustrated, published and shared with others, in exchange for money of course.

The stories are just the start and one of many projects I’d like to launch that will uplift, educate, inspire and entertain others.

Witty Ending

I’ll make no qualms about it I want to be successful.

Why?

Because I want the Tesla Model P Pickup real bad. Have you seen it?! Drooling. Just kidding, I really want to teach, guide and direct people, ok maybe it is the truck, or the people, or I can drive people around in the truck….

Either way I need resources to continue to progress myself and others.

Raymond Holliwell in his gem of a book, ‘Working with the Law’ said:

“Man is a progressive being, a creature of constant growth, before whom lies an illimitable ocean of progress to be navigated and conquered only by development and culture of his inherent powers”

Heartfelt Plea

To go back to the un-progressive life I lived prior to 2017 would be a fate worse than death and to awaken others to the endless possibilities that life contains, would be my life’s purpose fulfilled.

I would really appreciate your support in allowing me to use my talents for the benefit of others.

To gain an idea of who I am as well as samples of my work, please see my social links.

Thank you once again,

Allison

I also wrote poetry as a teen and into my early 20’s.  Then life kind of got in the way and since the early 2000’s I didn’t devote much time to creative writing.Now that you know I’ve had this burning artistic dream since my youth, let’s move on to the…Dramatic Life Event In 2017, I was snapped out of my zombie like state of work-home-repeat by an unexpected job loss, followed by the break down of my marriage. Coming to the shocking conclusion that I’m not my job or my marriage, and through a series of coincidental (not really) events, I started a journey of self-development and a reawakening to self-awareness.Like any enlightened person would do, I took out a $20 000 loan to pay for Bob Proctor’s coaching program (and a few other things, like car insurance) and what I learnt changed my mind. Just as a side note, one year and three weeks after getting out the loan, I paid it all back, still in the same job while earning less money and no it wasn’t from book sales or eating baked beans on toast for a year. I must love beans huh?Inspirational Turn-AroundHaving the right mindset is the key, that and a bunch of coincidences (no such thing).As I tried to make sense of what I was learning, I found writing stories helped me to embed the information in my own life. I was learning by writing and posting Facebook live videos, because that’s what you do when you are trying to be an influencer - I didn’t have any left-over money for butt implants.I also had some changes in my relationship status that brought new challenges and again, to make sense of them, I found writing stories a great outlet.Time To Milk The COVID Cow  During COVID19 isolation, with a boss who decided that 99% of what I normally did, I shouldn’t do from home, to save him money, I had time to write. I have 22 stories completed thus far, ranging from 300 to 5500 words, ready to be illustrated, published and shared with others, in exchange for money of course.The stories are just the start and one of many projects I’d like to launch that will uplift, educate, inspire and entertain others.Witty EndingI’ll make no qualms about it I want to be successful.Why?Because I want the Tesla Model P Pickup real bad. Have you seen it?! Drooling. Just kidding, I really want to teach, guide and direct people, ok maybe it is the truck, or the people, or I can drive people around in the truck….Either way I need resources to continue to progress myself and others.Raymond Holliwell in his gem of a book, ‘Working with the Law’ said:“Man is a progressive being, a creature of constant growth, before whom lies an illimitable ocean of progress to be navigated and conquered only by development and culture of his inherent powers”Heartfelt PleaTo go back to the un-progressive life I lived prior to 2017 would be a fate worse than death and to awaken others to the endless possibilities that life contains, would be my life’s purpose fulfilled.I would really appreciate your support in allowing me to use my talents for the benefit of others.To gain an idea of who I am as well as samples of my work, please see my social links.Thank you once again,Allison

story:
Short Summary

A long time ago I took a graduate course about women and autobiography. There I learned about a woman named Vladka Meed, who smuggled guns and dynamite into the Warsaw Ghetto in preparation for the Uprising (among many other important tasks). And I was horrified; horrified that I'd never heard of her before.

As my research went deeper, I discovered so many equally amazing women involved in the Warsaw Jewish Underground during World War II that I also hadn't heard of. I couldn't believe I didn't know any of their names! So, it was time for me to take this into my own hands: if no one else was going to make sure these badass bitches'* names were as well-known as Anne Frank's, then I would. And that's what I'm trying to do.

Hi, my name is Elizabeth Hyman, and I am the granddaughter of a Polish Jewish Holocaust refugee. I earned my Master's degree in Modern Jewish History, and I work as an archivist at the Center for Jewish History in New York. The topic of women and the Holocaust is one I hold near to my heart, and one I have been writing about for many years, long before I had the idea for this book. 

Indeed, since 2011, I have been writing a history blog. As of this writing I have over 116,000 followers. You may learn more over at my website: https://historicitywasalreadytaken.com/. Four posts which speak specifically to the themes this book will engage with are listed below:

  • Why Gender History is Important (Asshole)
  • We Need to talk about Anne Frank
  • Fierce Historical Ladies post: Vladka Meed
  • Girls with Guns, Woman Commanders, and Unheeded Warnings: Women and the Holocaust

*I use "bitches" as a reclaimed term of respect, admiration, and affection.

What I Need & What You Get

This isn't going to be an academic history, and it's not going to be another chronological narrative of 1939-1945. This book is driven by female actors. Their words, their actions, and their thoughts drive the narrative. And to get into their heads, I need access to works published only in Hebrew, Yiddish, and Polish; I need access to books not published in the United States; and I need access to archival materials housed in Poland and Israel.

In other words, to get my hands on the sources I need to do this book correctly, I need to be able to pay multiple translators, for overseas shipping of potentially rare volumes, and for archival copying (which adds up fast once you factor in labor and digital infrastructure). I will also need to pay for a professional editor; in nonfiction publishing, successful writers generally have an editor review their submission materials before those materials go out to any agent. This professional service can also be quite expensive. A conservative estimate of what I need to pay for all of this is $5000. And when I say "conservative," I mean "that might pay for the translation of one book."

Your Impact

The Holocaust is one of the turning points of Modern History. Yet, our collective understanding of it is deeply informed by male narratives, and the male experience. That means we're missing half the picture of the largest mechanized genocide in human history. Please, help me do my part to shed a light on the other half: their deeds, their lives, their fears, and, sometimes, their deaths.

story:
EAT, a novel. 

EAT is the story of Niall DelBianco's long fast, and why he thinks humans can survive on energy other than that derived from the death of organic beings. The narrator, Rick Zito, answers the call of Niall's alarmed partner, Laura, and returns to the college community where he once taught to see if he can talk some sense into Niall. How this plays out forms the drama of the novel. 

EAT is my ninth book, and fourth novel. As with most of the others, I am trying to fund its printing, distribution and publicity through crowd-sourcing. I figure I need roughly $1500. to get it in print and to readers who still have an interest in serious fiction. 

Here’s how you can help. For a donation of $50., you get an autographed copy of the book. For $100., you get two autographed copies (give them as gifts), and mention as a Sponsor on the Acknowledgments Page. Those who give $200. will receive the two copies and be mentioned as Patrons on the Acknowledgments page. Beyond that, a $300 donor will be Acknowledged in print as an Angel, and whatever reward such beings get in literary heaven. Please understand that to be acknowledged in the printed volume, the donation must be received before we go to press on or about September 25, 2021. If there should be a second or third printing, we will be able to acknowledge donors who miss this initial deadline. 

Even if you cannot donate, you will help the campaign by mentioning it and EAT on social media platforms such as Facebook, and/or by notifying friends and acquaintances of the book's publication.  Any and all such publicity is valuable and much appreciated.
