story:
In 2013, Gabe Durham pitched a series of critical, historical, and personal nonfiction books about classic video games. The generous backers of our first Kickstarter campaign said “MAKE IT HAPPEN!” and Boss Fight Books was born. Thanks to your continued support since then, we've released sixteen great books about classic video games, and we've got so much more planned for the future. 

For Season 4, we're offering five all-new books by six all-new writers. This time around, every book this season shares one thing in common: unprecedented access to people who made these games. In our first ever Creator Access Edition, you'll meet a diverse group of creators and characters, including:

  • Final Fantasy legend Hironobu Sakaguchi
  • Mark Turmell's team behind NBA Jam, including announcer Tim Kitzrow
  • Knights of the Old Republic Lead Designer James Ohlen and Senior Writer Drew Karpyshyn
  • Yacht Club Games, the entire team behind Shovel Knight
  • the team behind Postal, and infamous video game film director Uwe Boll

We hope you’ll subscribe to Season 4 and join us as we explore these fascinating games.

For Season 4, we've enlisted designer Cory Schmitz to give our covers an updated aesthetic that will look great on your shelf alongside all of our previous titles. Each book is numbered and collectible, and will have the usual crisp, elegant interiors thanks to returning layout designer Christopher Moyer.

All the books will be available in:

  • Paperback: 5x7-inch, matte finish, 128-222 pages.
  • eBook: DRM-free in EPUB, MOBI, and PDF formats.

and will be sold directly from bossfightbooks.com, in the Kindle Store, and in more bookstores than ever before thanks to our new distributor, SCB Distributors.

Final Fantasy V by Chris Kohler

When Final Fantasy V was released for the Japanese Super Famicom in 1992, the game was an instant hit, selling two million copies in the first two months alone. With a groundbreaking job system that combined the usual character classes like knights, thieves, and mages with offbeat classes such as chemists, dancers, and bards, the game appeared to be a shoo-in for North American distribution. But the game was dubbed "too hardcore" for a Western audience and was swapped out with Final Fantasy Mystic Quest, a simplistic new game tailor-made for Americans.  

That didn't stop a teenage Chris Kohler from tracking down Final Fantasy V. The young RPG fan got a Japanese copy of the game, used it to teach himself Japanese, and with the help of some internet companions created the first-ever comprehensive English-language FAQ of the game. As the internet narrowed the cultural gap between the East and West more each year, the game was eventually translated into English for the PlayStation, Game Boy Advance, and iOS. 

Fans in the West finally got to learn what all the fuss was about. Now the acclaimed author of Power-Up and an editor at Kotaku, Kohler is revisiting the game that started his career in games journalism. Based on new, original interviews with Final Fantasy V's director, Hironobu Sakaguchi, as well as previously untranslated interviews with the rest of the development team, Kohler's book weaves history and criticism to examine one of the Final Fantasy series's greatest and most overlooked titles.

​Chris Kohler is the author of Power-Up: How Japanese Video Games Gave the World an Extra Life, and the founding editor of Game|Life, the Webby-nominated video game section of WIRED. He is currently Features Editor of Kotaku, and lives in the San Francisco Bay Area. 

Shovel Knight by David L. Craddock

In 2014, Yacht Club Games released its very first game, Shovel Knight, a joyful 2D platformer that wears its NES influences on its sleeve. This unlikely pastiche of 8-bit inspirations manages to emulate the look, feel, and even the technical limitations of nostalgic titles like Mega Man, Zelda II, and Castlevania III—imbued with a contemporary sense of humor and self-awareness. But how is a fundamentally retro game created in the modern era? And what do the games of the past have to teach today's game designers?  

Based on extensive original interviews with the entire Yacht Club Games team, writer David L. Craddock unearths the story of five game developers who worked so well together while at WayForward Games that they decided to start their own studio. From the high highs of Shovel Knight's groundbreaking Kickstarter to the low lows of its unexpectedly lengthy development, Boss Fight presents a new master class in how a great game gets made. Get ready to steel your shovel and dig into this fascinating oral history. For Shovelry!

David L. Craddock lives with his wife and business partner in Ohio. He is the author of Stay Awhile and Listen, a three-part series that chronicles the history of World of WarCraft developer Blizzard Entertainment and Diablo/Diablo II developer Blizzard North; Break Out: How the Apple II Launched the PC Gaming Revolution by Schiffer Publishing; and HERITAGE, a young adult fantasy novel. Connect with David on Twitter or Facebook.

NBA Jam by Reyan Ali

When NBA Jam dunked its way into arcades in 1993, players discovered just how fun basketball can be when freed from rules, refs, and gravity itself. But just a few years after Midway's billion-dollar hit conquered the world, Midway, home version publisher Acclaim, and even video arcades themselves fell off the map. How did a simple two-on-two basketball game become MVP of the arcade, and how did this champ lose its title?  

Journalist Reyan Ali dives deep into the saga, tracking the people and decisions that shaped the series. You'll get to know mischievous Jam architect Mark Turmell, go inside Midway's Chicago office where hungry young talent tapped into cutting-edge tech, and explore the sequels, spin-offs, and tributes that came in the game's wake.

Built out of exhaustive research and original interviews with a star-studded cast -- including Turmell and his original development team, iconic commentator Tim Kitzrow, developers and executives at Midway and Acclaim alike, secret characters George Clinton and DJ Jazzy Jeff, Atari founder Nolan Bushnell, Doom co-creator John Romero, and 1990s NBA demigods Glen Rice and Shaq -- Ali's NBA Jam returns you to an era when coin-op was king.

Follow Reyan's progress on Twitter at @nbajambook.

Reyan Ali is a writer from Columbus, Ohio. He’s been published by Wired, Rolling Stone, Spin, The Atlantic, Pacific Standard, and alt-weekly papers across the country. Born in Dallas, he grew up in Karachi, Pakistan, where he soaked up 1990s NBA action almost exclusively through trading cards, Beckett Basketball back issues, and NBA Jam: Tournament Edition on the Sega Mega Drive. His first writing gig was contributing to the Mortal Kombat Netherealm (MKNe), a fan site long lost to time. At MKNe in 2000, he scored his very first interview: GamePro editor Dan Elektro. Over a decade later, he interviewed Elektro once more -- this time for NBA Jam, his first book. 

Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic by Alex Kane

Set in an even longer time ago in a galaxy far, far away, BioWare's 2003 RPG Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic wowed Jedi and Sith Lords alike with its compelling characters, lightsaber customization, complex morality choices, and one of the greatest plot twists in video game history. Among the droids and blasters, the game delves into themes like choice, free will, and the construction of identity and memory.

Featuring brand new interviews with Lead Designer James Ohlen and Senior Writer Drew Karpyshyn, game critic Alex Kane's book unveils how this classic game was made, analyzes KotOR's worldview through the lens of philosophy, mythology, and the ethics of war, and investigates how the game borrows techniques from contemporary films like The Sixth Senseand Fight Club. Whether you align with the light or the dark side, you're invited to dive into this fun and thoughtful exploration of the most beloved Star Wars game of all time.

Alex Kane is a freelance journalist and critic based in west-central Illinois. His work has appeared in Glixel, Kill Screen, the website of Rolling Stone, StarWars.com, and elsewhere.

Postal by Brock Wilbur & Nathan Rabin

In 1997, game studio Running with Scissors released its debut title, Postal, an isometric shooter aimed at shocking an imagined pearl-clutching public. The game focused on a disgruntled "Postal Dude" whose goal is to murder as many people as possible. It was crass, gory, and dumb—all of which might have been forgivable if the game had been any fun to play.  

Postal gained enough notoriety from riding the wave of public outrage to warrant a sequel. And DLC. And a remake. And, perhaps most surprising of all, a Golden-Raspberry-winning feature film adaptation directed by the infamous Uwe Boll.  

In this thoughtful and hilarious tag-team performance, comedian Brock Wilbur & media critic Nathan Rabin mine the fascinatingly troubled game and film for what each can tell us about shock culture & mass shootings, interviewing the Scissors team and even Boll himself for answers. Like it or not, Postal is the franchise that won't die—no matter how many molotov cocktails you throw at it.

Brock Wilbur is a writer and comedian from Kansas who now lives in Los Angeles. He lives with his wife Vivian and their cat, Cat. He is the author of a forthcoming book about growing up with a adopted Bosnian brother, and an investigative journalism piece where he exposes a cult that has haunted the east coast since the late 70s.

Nathan Rabin is the former head writer of The A.V Club and a staff writer for The Dissolve as well as the author of six books, including The Big Rewind (Scribner), My World of Flops (Scribner), Weird Al: The Book (with Al Yankovic) (Abrams) and most recently 7 Days in Ohio and Kanye & Trump for his own imprint, Declan Haven Books. He is also the proprietor, owner and editor-in-chief of his own website, Nathan Rabin’s Happy Place. He lives in Decatur, Georgia with his wife, dog Ghostface Killah, and son Declan.

October 2017: First book, Final Fantasy V, arrives.

November 2017: Next open reading period for book pitches. This will include both general pitches and pitches for the new fan-selected book.

December 2017: Release of Katamari Damacy, our final book of Season 3.

February 2018: Second book arrives.

April 2018: Third book arrives.

June 2018: Fourth book arrives.

September 2018: Fifth book arrives.

We currently estimate that the Season 4 books will come out in the following order: Final Fantasy V, Shovel Knight, NBA Jam, Star Wars: KotOR, and Postal. This order will likely change as the books progress.

For $25, you'll get digital copies of all our Season 4 books delivered right to your email account.

For $100, you'll get print and digital copies of all our Season 4 books delivered right to your mailbox and email inbox. (Includes shipping in the U.S., with an additional $10 per book internationally.)

And if you're new to Boss Fight, you could get the whole 22-book catalog for $100 (digital) or $400 (paperback + digital).

If you've been with Boss Fight awhile, we hope you'll take this opportunity to renew your subscription. Your support will allow us to keep Boss Fight publishing great books about classic video games, and you'll keep receiving each of our books before its public release.

If you're new to Boss Fight, we're glad you found us! You can subscribe to the new season, order existing books from our website, or find us in a bookstore near you! Just tell your local bookseller how they can stock our books.

It was crass, gory, and dumb—all of which might have been forgivable if the game had been any fun to play.  Postal gained enough notoriety from riding the wave of public outrage to warrant a sequel. And DLC. And a remake. And, perhaps most surprising of all, a Golden-Raspberry-winning feature film adaptation directed by the infamous Uwe Boll.  In this thoughtful and hilarious tag-team performance, comedian Brock Wilbur & media critic Nathan Rabin mine the fascinatingly troubled game and film for what each can tell us about shock culture & mass shootings, interviewing the Scissors team and even Boll himself for answers. Like it or not, Postal is the franchise that won't die—no matter how many molotov cocktails you throw at it.Brock Wilbur is a writer and comedian from Kansas who now lives in Los Angeles. He lives with his wife Vivian and their cat, Cat. He is the author of a forthcoming book about growing up with a adopted Bosnian brother, and an investigative journalism piece where he exposes a cult that has haunted the east coast since the late 70s.Nathan Rabin is the former head writer of The A.V Club and a staff writer for The Dissolve as well as the author of six books, including The Big Rewind (Scribner), My World of Flops (Scribner), Weird Al: The Book (with Al Yankovic) (Abrams) and most recently 7 Days in Ohio and Kanye & Trump for his own imprint, Declan Haven Books. He is also the proprietor, owner and editor-in-chief of his own website, Nathan Rabin’s Happy Place. He lives in Decatur, Georgia with his wife, dog Ghostface Killah, and son Declan.October 2017: First book, Final Fantasy V, arrives.November 2017: Next open reading period for book pitches. This will include both general pitches and pitches for the new fan-selected book.December 2017: Release of Katamari Damacy, our final book of Season 3.February 2018: Second book arrives.April 2018: Third book arrives.June 2018: Fourth book arrives.September 2018: Fifth book arrives.We currently estimate that the Season 4 books will come out in the following order: Final Fantasy V, Shovel Knight, NBA Jam, Star Wars: KotOR, and Postal. This order will likely change as the books progress.For $25, you'll get digital copies of all our Season 4 books delivered right to your email account.For $100, you'll get print and digital copies of all our Season 4 books delivered right to your mailbox and email inbox. (Includes shipping in the U.S., with an additional $10 per book internationally.)And if you're new to Boss Fight, you could get the whole 22-book catalog for $100 (digital) or $400 (paperback + digital).If you've been with Boss Fight awhile, we hope you'll take this opportunity to renew your subscription. Your support will allow us to keep Boss Fight publishing great books about classic video games, and you'll keep receiving each of our books before its public release.If you're new to Boss Fight, we're glad you found us! You can subscribe to the new season, order existing books from our website, or find us in a bookstore near you! Just tell your local bookseller how they can stock our books.

story:
**YOU CAN STILL PURCHASE BOOKS FROM THIS PAGE** 

**Even though the official campaign is over, Indiegogo Indemand allows new backers to fund the campaign. All new backers will receive the PDF, ebook, and audiobook MP3 files within 24 hours of making a pledge, and the print book will be mailed to you immediately. You can also purchase a paperback or Kindle ebook from Amazon. ** 

 

Short Summary

You want to change the world. Maybe you’re even audacious enough to want saving the world to be fun. But real problems are messy, and it can often feel difficult to get people to care.  But what if saving the earth were a game? Not just any game, but the greatest game we’ve ever played?

I've just completed the ultimate "how to" manual that will turn you into a  world-changing superstar, and I want to share it with you. It's finished. It's in the final stages of editing, and it's ready to send to you at the end of this campaign in mid-November 2018.

How to Save the World is a workbook that helps social and environmental change professionals learn how to implement powerful techniques, drawn from behavioral psychology, measurement, design, data, storytelling, visualization, and game design that are proven to have impact.

The design framework taught in this workbook will take you through a journey of exercises, questions, and case studies that will teach you the art of changing the world — and it’s often not what you think it is.

For example, did you know that just showing people the number of cans recycled increased the recycling rate by 67%? Or that letting people know that prior customers chose vegan meals doubled the rate of plant-based meal orders? Jam-packed full of fascinating insights, this book will help unleash your highest creativity and help you take giant leaps in your capacity to create real and measurable change for the causes you most care about.

The approach taught in How to Save the World means not just tinkering around the edges, or merely talking about change. It will help you design solutions that reach the cores of your issues, so you can experience the incredible joy and satisfaction of seeing your work, really, actually change the world every single day.

 

 

What people are saying

 

"An urgent and useful guide for anyone who seeks to make a difference. It will change your work for the better." - Seth Godin Author, This is Marketing

 

"I am loving How to Save the World  . . .  I am only halfway through it, and cannot wait to read it again soon. So many gems! Thanks for putting this out into the world." - Erin Rhodes, Writer & Speaker on The Zero Waste Lifestyle

 

"How to Save the World – WOW!  This remarkable book continues Katie’s amazing journey. It is easy to read, practical and full of ways for you to act, and help us survive in a world where the evidence of climate change and sustainability collapse can be frightening, and even bring on despair. But, as Al Gore told us: “Never Despair, it’s a form of denial.”  Katie’s enthusiasm shines from every page, and fires hope for my grandchildren. I urge all to read this book, to “think beautifully”, and get out there and do epic things to save the world. Never has this call to action been more damn serious." - Professor David A Hood AM HonFIEAust CPEng, Chairman, The Long Future Foundation, 2012 National President, Engineers Australia

 

"I am a complete novice at game design, yet I have found the book to be well designed, beautifully  explained, and crystal clear in terms of explanations. Katie presents her material brilliantly and passionately. This book and the games it will enable are a great opportunity to explore real innovation at the edge of how people are learning and changing behavior. This is a rare resource!" -  Tim Bennet, Agricultural Scientist, Investor, Consultant to the United Nations Center for Alleviation of Poverty by Sustainable Agriculture

 

 

 

"Katie's teachings gave me a solid base to begin the challenging task of tracking change . . . having been turned down for a grant or two for this very reason (we didn't have the behavior-change data the foundations wanted), I hadn't understood how to even begin collecting this information in a meaningful way until I participated in this workshop." - Constance Taylor, California Center for Natural History

 

 

 

“Katie’s book on approaching the sometimes fraught topic of global environmental change and the actions that can help save the world is exactly what “change-wanters” should read! By presenting the state of knowledge in what actually works, in a way that we can all understand, using beautiful and simple graphics, Katie has delivered something useful for all walks of life, from all corners of the world.” - Jeremy S. Hoffman, Ph.D., The Science Museum of Virginia

 

 

 

 

 

 

"Great stuff! Strong material presented in a very captivating way. The way Katie gave several hi-tech and lo-tech implementation ideas for each gamification technique made it feel both approachable and aspirational."  - Eugene Otter, Software Engineer

 

Hardcover dimensions: 8" x 10"

 

 

Who's it for?

This book is a must-have for anyone pursuing meaningful change in the world. It's written for social change entrepreneurs, designers, sustainability professionals, environmental advocates, student activists, engineers, city planners, civic technologists, tech startups, and community organizers. Whether you are just starting your search for meaningful work, or you've spent a lifetime's career campaigning for change, How to Save the World will add techniques you haven't heard of, inspiration to creatively flower, and a roadmap to chart your future journey for solving the world's biggest problems. The unique design-thinking process in the book will help both experienced and aspiring world-changers discover their next big idea.

 

What We Need & What You Get

What's involved in this campaign:

  • The campaign goal covers an initial print run, editor's fees, and some promotion. 
  • You'll receive the first-ever print run of this book, with your name on the thank-you page and a special thank-you video with all the supporter's names. 
  • Don't worry if we don't reach the goal, all orders will still be printed and distributed through the print-on-demand service Blurb.com. 

The Impact

The difference your contribution will make:

  • This project is valuable to me because it helps me share these insights and my unique take on how optimism, vision, and creativity can make the world better. It helps me continue to read academic case studies, turn this knowledge into real change, and share it with my community of world-changers. 
  • This project is valuable to the world because the movement of world-changers hasn't had a manual before. We haven't had a big inspirational manifesto on how to get to work on making saving the world our art form. In a world that is often mired in doom, frustration, and politics, the approach in this book of looking at measurement, technology, and creativity is a beacon of positivity. Many world-changers are making mistakes without realizing it, and this book shines a light on these mistakes and new ways of fixing the world. 

 

About the Author

Katie Patrick is an Australian-American environmental engineer and designer.  Her company, Hello World Labs, applies data-driven, gamification, and behavior-change techniques to solve the world’s environmental problems. She is the designer of the zero-waste behavior-change game Detrashed, host of the related Detrashed YouTube series, and author of the book Detrash Your Life in 90 Days - The Art of Zero Waste Living. Katie is also the creator of Zerowastify.com, an app designed to measure and report municipal solid waste, and UrbanCanopy.io, a map-based application that uses spectral imaging of urban heat islands and green cover to encourage urban greening initiatives. 

Katie has been a media spokesperson on environmental issues, and has been featured regularly on TV, radio and in print publications, including Vogue Australia, ABC News, and BBC Radio. She was CEO of the VC-funded green-lifestyle magazine Green Pages, and was appointed environmental brand ambassador by the Ogilvy Earth advertising agency for Volkswagen, Lipton Tea and Wolfblass Wines.

She has served on the board of Australia’s national eco label, Good Environmental Choice Australia, and won the 2008 Cosmopolitan Woman of the Year Award for entrepreneurship. After graduating from the Royal Melbourne Institute of Technology with a B.Eng in Environmental Engineering, she worked as an environmental design engineer for building engineers Lincoln Scott in Sydney on some of the world’s first platinum-LEED-certified commercial buildings. Katie lives in San Francisco with her young daughter Anastasia. See Katie's Linkedin here.

 

Risks & Challenges

The book is ready to go! It's written, designed, and in final proofreading right now. The main challenge currently is getting as many people as possible to hear about it. I'm hoping you can help me turn the message of saving the world from being about fear and doom to being about creativity, optimism, and adventure.

Stretch Goals

Help me reach my ultimate goal of selling 1,000 copies through this Indiegogo campaign and book launch, which works out to about $25,000. This would enable me to tour: to promote the book to schools, governments, and universities, and hold more workshops, podcasts, and free events.

The $6,000 goal covers the editing, initial print run, and some help with promotion.

Stretch goal 1: $10,000 - Covers the cost of making an HD video and public speaking.

Stretch goal 2: $15,000 - Funds the podcast "How to Save the World" for another 12 months.

Stretch goal 3: $25,000 - This goal would fund touring: promoting the book to schools, governments, and universities, and holding more workshops, podcasts, and free events.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Thank you for reading about the campaign! No problem if you aren't in a position to financially contribute. Here are other ways you can help that will still get you digital hugs from me:

  • Share it now on social media!
  • Tell your friends about the book at work, school, and at parties
  • Sign up to katiepatrick.com to get free tutorials
  • Join the How to Save the World Facebook group
  • Subscribe to the How to Save the World podcast on Itunes
  • Subscribe to the How to Save the World Youtube Channel 
  • Follow me on Instagram
  • Follow me on Twitter
  • Spend 1 hour a day doing the creative thing you always wanted to do

story:
So guys! We're done shooting our burlesque beauties and the recipes are all ready!

The stockings are hung up by the chimney with care, and we're just waiting for Ole St. Nick to get here. What we really need now are the last few funds to publish our book and make this a reality.

Some of you know me already -- I'm a burlesque event producer and journalist living in Brooklyn, and I've been working on this cookbook with many talented folks -- the many burlesque performers, chefs and venue owners, our photographer Lauren Silberman, fashion stylist Kristina Uriegas-Reyes, chef and food stylist Lynn Wolsted, makeup artist Nicole Cerro, production assistants Jason Hood, Andrew Ellzey and Dan Kim, and graphic designer Greg Stadnyk. It's been a lot of work and we're very proud of what we've done.

We're finally ready to publish. But we do need a bit more funding to make this a reality, or it's never going to happen. There's nothing I love more than bringing beautiful people and food together. This is a wonderful community of burlesque performers we are highlighting in New York, with artists who create their own work from scratch. Their photos and the bakeries' recipes deserve to be seen and baked by you at home!

Here are the deets!

Here's how it breaks down. If the campaign succeeds, we'll publish early next year.

  • Publishing our first run will cost us approximately $6,000. I'll provide a bit over $3,000 from my own wallet that I've saved up over the past year, and am looking for funding to make up the rest.
  • Contributors who donate $35 get calendars! We're publishing a pinup calendar this year with some gorgeous photos of performers from the book!

Spread the good word

If you can't contribute, you can still help out!

  • Retweet, Snapchat, Instagram, Facebook or good old-fashioned talk about our campaign!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to easily share info about our campaign!

Hello

I am H.G. Lukofth and this is my campaign; I need your help/contribution to make all of my stories come to life. Every single one of the stories teaches a lesson and touches the heart of our children, teenagers and adults as well, for example it touches the subject of bullying, tolerance, respect, faith, love, and honesty. One of the many characteristics of this stories is the simplicity of how they are written, they are easy to understand/read, every single drawings aren’t digital, they are done by myself the author.

My intention is not to become rich, my only intention is to share my imagination and dreams with all of you.

The money collected in here, is going to be used to publish the book.

I compromise with you, that if this my dream comes true, it’ll  all be thanks to you.

                                                                                                         -H.G. Lukofth

story:
////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////


Our campaign was relaunched.

Check out the NEW CAMPAIGN!


The heart of Vector scissors is a solution to a common problem which a lot of us already knows: If you want to cut a large piece of paper or some kind of material you have to pre-mark the line for which you need to use a ruler and a pencil.

If you use a cutting knife you will also need an under plate in case you don't want to scratch your tabletop. This is why I wanted to create a new type of scissors which can cut straight lines without using additional tools. 




The top/left part of Vector sits on top of the table while the bottom/right half presses against the side of it. 

To cut a straight line, you simply place your paper over the corner of a table, providing the right angle for you to begin cutting.

You start going forward and Voila!  A straight cut from a scissor – something you never could have done before!

Main advantages

- Straight cuts without using additional tools

- everyday use besides straight cut

- Unlimited cutting length

- easy handling

- Comfortable, convenient use



"Yet when to comes to the common task of cutting in a straight line, craftspeople would have little choice but to break out heavy-duty solutions like paper cutters. Concepts like the Vector Scissors..., may someday fill that void...

"Genius! Scissors have evolved slowly over the years ... Designer Tamás Fekete has sliced through millennia of shear repetition and designed a new pair of scissors…"

Vector Scissors are one of those designs that make you say “duh!” For the 99.9% of us who can’t cut a straight line, they make getting it right each time a cinch.


The early concept of Vector scissors was the end result of my first year project at the Moholy-Nagy University of Art and Design where I study at the faculty of product design. After the concept created quite a buzz around the web and a lot of people were interested in having Vector Scissors, we decided to make it become a real product. 

Handcrafted in Hungary

The blades of Vector are handcrafted in Hungary. They are made of stainless steel from Solingen which are tempered, individually whetted and adjusted precisely by hand. Therefore Vector scissors are not just accurate, but  they are also beautiful pieces of craftsmanship.



What We Need & What You Get

We have a large connection of suppliers and manufacturers who are ready to start the manufacturing. Even though Vector Scissors look very simple, they are difficult to manufacture. It requires a lot of stages and components are expensive. In order to make this project economically feasible, we need to begin the production with a minimum order number.

We would be paying the cost of materials, production, packaging and shipping with the help of the collected funds. By backing us not only you can get your own pair of scissors or something else you choose but also you will be part of the birth of this unique new tool.

We are very confident and enthusiastic about Vector Scissors. We’ve done our very best to forecast demand and create a solid production plan but sometimes forecasts don’t always hit the mark. If we missed something, we will let you know and make it right as quickly as possible.

If we don't reach our funding goal or we stop below a critical amount, we will send back all of your contributions!

Component supply, manufacturing delay and unexpected shortages can occur. If this happens, we’ll be sure to keep you informed and work very hard to quickly solve everything.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you want to help in another way, then please share the campaign with your friends and encourage them to spread the word. If you have ideas for perks that you would like to see and contribute to, feel free to contact me. Thank you for passing by and thank you for every share which is already a really big help.

Our campaign was relaunched.
Check out the NEW CAMPAIGN!

The heart of Vector scissors is a solution to a common problem which a lot of us already knows: If you want to cut a large piece of paper or some kind of material you have to pre-mark the line for which you need to use a ruler and a pencil.



If you use a cutting knife you will also need an under plate in case you don't want to scratch your tabletop. This is why I wanted to create a new type of scissors which can cut straight lines without using additional tools. 















The top/left part of Vector sits on top of the table while the bottom/right half presses against the side of it. 



To cut a straight line, you simply place your paper over the corner of a table, providing the right angle for you to begin cutting.


You start going forward and Voila!  A straight cut from a scissor – something you never could have done before!

Main advantages

- Straight
cuts without using additional tools 
- everyday
use besides straight cut 
- Unlimited
cutting length
- easy
handling
- Comfortable,
convenient use











"Yet when to comes to the common task of cutting in a straight line, craftspeople would have little choice but to break out heavy-duty solutions like paper cutters. Concepts like the Vector Scissors..., may someday fill that void...



"Genius! Scissors have evolved slowly over the years ... Designer Tamás Fekete has sliced through millennia of shear repetition and designed a new pair of scissors…"


Vector Scissors are one of those designs that make you say “duh!” For the 99.9% of us who can’t cut a straight line, they make getting it right each time a cinch.









The early concept of Vector scissors was the end result of my first year project at the Moholy-Nagy University of Art and Design where I study at the faculty of product design. After the concept created quite a buzz around the web and a lot of people were interested in having Vector Scissors, we decided to make it become a real product. 






Handcrafted in Hungary






The blades of Vector are handcrafted in
Hungary. They are made of stainless steel from Solingen which are tempered,
individually whetted and adjusted precisely by hand. Therefore Vector scissors are not just accurate, but  they are also beautiful pieces of craftsmanship.

story:
At long last, Cometbus has some competition in the punk writing realm. -Dakota Floyd, The Wild (in a review of Reckless Chants #19)
[Rust Belt Jessie is] my favorite Zine Chronicler of the Current True-Life Punk Rock Experience -Adam Gnade, The Do-It-Yourself Guide to Fighting the Big Motherfuckin' Sad
I'm (Rust Belt) Jessie Lynn McMains, fka Jessica Disobedience (and about ten other pen names/stage names/punk rock names). I've been making zines and writing about punk for 20 years, now, and I think it's about time I publish a book.
What We Talk About When We Talk About Punk is a collection of some of my writings about punk - both non-fiction and fiction - spanning nearly fifteen years. It’s a look at my little corner of the punk scene, and everything punk has meant to me. From love affairs to getting wasted, from self-destruction to survival, from the death of old friends and heroes to hearing that one perfect song, from wanting to quit punk to realizing I never can - it’s all in here.

I’m not a punk band, and this isn’t a record, but you could consider these my songs. These are the songs where I make fun of punk, and the songs where I eulogize it. These are my anthems.

Funding & Perks

I need to raise $2100 for the first print run of What We Talk About. Some of the money will go toward paying Emma Thacker to design and draw the cover art (the image I'm using for the campaign card and video overlay is my own mock-up of what the cover will look like, Emma's a great artist and I can't wait to see what she'll come up with!). Another portion will go toward paying someone to proofread the manuscript and do some minor editing. The rest will go towards purchasing the copies - 300 in total for the first print run, getting a .pdf version made for those who prefer their books digital, mailing out the preorders that I receive through this campaign, and promotion: getting posters made, sending out review copies, and transportation costs so I can do readings, etc. If there is any tiny amount of extra money left over, it will be put toward a second printing.

But I'm not asking for something for nothing - anyone who contributes over $10 gets a .pdf copy of the book, and the perks get better the more you contribute - signed copies of the book, poster prints of the cover art, and more.

If I don't reach my goal, I still plan on publishing the book. What not reaching my goal would mean is that I wouldn't be able to make the initial print run as big, but the book would still get printed. If the goal is not reached, I will put any funds I receive toward doing as big a print run as possible. However, it will take me longer to get it printed and mailed out if I don't reach the goal, so if you'd like your copy sooner rather than later, try and get the word out about my campaign and help me reach my funding goal.

DIY? Because I Gotta.

I suppose I could try to get this book published in a more traditional way, but at this point in my life, I don't have the patience. I'd have to spend months researching publishers that might be the right fit, then several more months mailing out cover letters, pitches, and sample chapters. Then several more waiting to hear back from all of them, and then even if by some miracle one of the publishers wanted to publish it, it could take years to actually get published! I know Sue Grafton says that self-publishing is a shortcut, but I've never read any Grafton and also...

Yes, it is a shortcut. I'm nearly 33, I've been building this body of work since I was 18, and I want it out in the world. Not to mention, I had some success with more traditional publishing when I was younger, and it left a bad taste in my mouth. There was a lot of editing and cutting not only of extraneous things but of things that were intrinsic to the message of my writing. A lot of talk of certain things being unpublishable, either because of the risk of censorship, or because of market trends and what would sell. Well. I hate censorship and I don't care about market trends. In the case of What We Talk About  - I'm a punk, I write for punks.

Self-publishing may be a shortcut on the one hand, but on the other hand it takes a whole lot of hard work. It means that I have ultimate control over the book, but also that I have ultimate responsibility. It means that I am responsible for finding an artist and an editor. It means that I am responsible for doing the layout, paying for printing and shipping, and for promotion. It won't be easy, but as I have been self-publishing and self-promoting my zines for 20 years, now, I think I'm up to the challenge.

Etc.

Times are tough and we're all broke. I realize that some of you may want to contribute but just can't afford to right now. There are other ways you can help - namely, by getting the word out. If you can't contribute - heck, even if you can - please share this information anywhere you can. Share it on your blog or website. Share it with punks, zine and book lovers, and zine-and-book-loving punks. Let's spread my anthems around the world, so everyone can shout along.

story:
This is an extremely unique project with profound personal and global implications. It is the writing/co-birthing of a book entitled, ‘Water Lillies' – the story of an Elongation – the story of a Waking Up’. If you have already viewed the video introduction to this project offered by the writer, Ariole, you will know how special this project is. The contents of this book are flowing through Ariole and published daily online. The book is the magnet at the core of a Call to Global Cooperation in response to the multi-faceted and interconnected global crises of which we are all a part – more on this issue in a moment. Appearing in the form of a ‘book’, Water Lillies is also an alchemical activation of the awakening of mass human consciousness – into its original memory of itself as Light. In simpler terms, The Call to Global Cooperation through ‘Water Lillies’ is a real-time response to the readiness of humanity to ‘grow up’ – to remember itself in its full radiant glory.

The ‘story’ is accessible to readers from all walks of life – creeds, colors, races, ideologies – as it bridges and connects multiple spokes of one ‘wheel’. Told in a mystical, magical weave, it resembles Harry Potter, Mutant Messages Down Under, Raiders of the Lost Ark, The DaVinci Code, Star Wars, The Men Who Stare At Goats– and it follows the sacred route of ‘Field of Dreams’ – bringing into manifest, tangible experience what we have all long dreamed of – “peace on Earth, joy to all humankind”. ‘Water Lillies’ reveals in its mesmerizing pages why humanity has been ‘stuck’ for millennia – and how it is NOW that we are free to liberate ourselves from the ‘cage’ of our own collective making .

This Call to Global Cooperation goes out to all among us (humanity) who are attuned to the urgency of shifting up our species. It is a call to step out of the perpetuation of suffering – duality – via our conditioned behaviour of ‘fighting against’ that which we do not want, to co-create a unified vision of what we actually do want. To this quantum leap, the real-time writing of 'Water Lillies' – the story of an Elongation -- the story of a Waking Up', is being actively contributed – as a ‘catalyst’.  Told via the story of a young woman’s awakening to her full potential, it is meant to expand our conditioned perceptions – thus easing our collective shift into whole brain conceptions. 

Welcome to this ‘Invitation’! 

Know now: “We are the ones we have been waiting for.”


My name is Aaron Chubb. I am... Just as you are… a spiritual being having a human experience. I am also the campaign manager for the Call to Global Cooperation. My inspiration to be campaign manager for this deeply meaningful project comes from my love for my family, and the entire human family, as well as the Earth itself. The intention in sharing so little about myself and the writer, Ariole, is to keep the focus on the message (not the messengers) of Water Lillies and the Call to Global Cooperation. We are so excited and grateful to be a part of the Call to Global Cooperation and the co-birthing of 'Water Lillies'. It really is a co-creative project. Without the 70 plus people who are currently providing energetic support of this project, the writing would literally not flow.

The challenging reality that this project addresses is that humanity IS intertwined in a multi-faceted and interconnected global crisis that is at a bleak tipping point. If we go much past it (a few more years) a very large percentage of humanity will be unable to survive it. The Earth and so many of its inhabitants are suffering from an inflammation created by a level of consciousness that places duality above unity, which has led to a dangerous rush to ruthlessly compete for power on a journey of 'modernization' and 'progress'. Astounding numbers of plant and animal species are going extinct, while masses of life forms experience chronic and contagious dis-ease. I won’t delve into the heart-wrenching numbers that quantify how sick the life of the planet has become… it is sufficient and accurate to say that we are in an unparalleled state of global crisis. 

This global crisis that is now at its tipping point was created by a level of consciousness that places duality above unity. The same level of consciousness that got us into this situation, won’t get us out. However, there is another exciting tipping point that we are approaching… one wherein the crisis will begin to rapidly decrease and move through recovery on a journey to a state in which the health of humanity - physical, mental and spiritual - and the planet thrives. This tipping point occurs when a sufficient number of humans have a shift of consciousness in which unity takes the lead from duality. Just feel it for a moment if you can – GLOBAL COOPERATION. When we act from UNITY consciousness, not only do we recover, but we thrive!

 So, is the chaos of the world ripe enough for you yet?

'Water Lillies' is meant to inspire you, to ignite you, and to evoke in you deep feelings of ‘Home’ (our collective home, wherein we are dearly beloved family members). It is intended to accelerate the currently awakening mass human consciousness out of duality and into original memory of itself as united in the pure Light of Source.

‘Water Lillies’ is an epic project. Via the trust and innocence of its lead character, Ella, readers are positively entranced into mirroring her ultimate transparency. In demonstrating her own, pure inner power, she reminds readers of their own inner power and essential benevolence.

‘Water Lillies’ is a call to liberation – a call to humanity’s freedom. Through its pages, the ‘root of the rot of human civilization’ is revealed, and, safely, gently, surely, a new frontier is unveiled – the real-time choice to transcend all suffering – individual and collective.

Welcome to ‘Water Lillies' – the story of an Elongation, the story of a Waking Up'.... and thank YOU for answering the Call to Global Cooperation.

Our time is Now . . .

When you choose to fund the Call to Global Cooperation and 'Water Lillies', you are contributing to thousands of hours of unpaid (and ongoing) research and service by the writer and her teams of co-creators over the past 20 years. In particular, since 2012, a core team has given an immense amount of time, energy and expertise to this project on a volunteer basis. Some of the core team were not and are not in a financial position to offer much more, for income is required to cover living expenses like food and shelter. 

The financial goal of $29500 for this campaign is merely a starting point to cover current basic expenses for the writer and those in her core team in need. The amount of the goal was chosen so as to be an attainable starting amount with a knowing that it can and will need to be surpassed many times to support the ongoing work.

We have included a very valuable selection of perks as measures to express our heartfelt gratitude for your contribution. These perks will undoubtedly brighten your day and enhance your life. Please explore more in the ‘Perks’ section.

The project is, at its heart, very simple and yet very complex. The complexity lies in the work that will be engaged in by a great diversity of individuals, groups and cultures that will accept the Call to Global Cooperation. The simplicity lies in the truth at the heart of the Call to Global Cooperation - that we are all One. When we feel that truth, cooperation is achieved by default... and cooperation itself is a simple way to manage complex challenges.

Whether you choose to contribute financially or not, you can support the project by sharing with people the link to this campaign - via the Indiegogo share tools - and the 'Water Lillies' online scribing site- http://waterlillies-thebook.com/

Your support is deeply appreciated.

story:
It's time to FLOOD the campaign for Together 2016 with our support. Let's make it rain! 


There have been times in history when the call to Jesus assembled the masses: Explo 72, Promise Keepers' Stand in the Gap, crusades led by Rev. Billy Graham. These were historic events that impacted culture, not just the Church.

Now it's our turn. It's time for our generation to rise up and lead toward a historic event that will define our day and shift modern culture.

On July 16, 2016 for Together, we're calling a million people to stand together for Jesus on the National Mall in Washington, D.C. 

Together 2016 doesn't belong to any one person or organization. It belongs to you. And without you, it won't happen.

Like other marches and rallies in Washington, D.C., we're not selling tickets. There is no cost to attend. We want people from across the nation—from every background, race, and denomination—to stand together, united for Jesus, for FREE.

But it costs a lot to pull off an event like this. We're raising money for advertising and promotions, speaker/artist fees and travel, stages, sound equipment, and more for the day of the event.

story:
I am from Hungary, Budapest ⟶ I moved to New York City to complete the MFA Photography program at School of Visual Arts.

Hungry Hungarians is a photo-cookbook about Hungarian culture, politics, personal stories and food of course. I love Hungary and I think it is important to show to a wider audience that despite the current political situation it is a great place.
The book is ready to be printed. As a contributor you could help me in the production: printing, transporting, advertising and translating.


The Book
125 pages, 16 chapters

The Hungry Hungarians project represents and communicates my extreme disappointent with current Hungarian politics with the form of a cookbook. It criticizes the political and social changes that have occured in Hungary over the past years through a presentation of images, Hungarian recipes and cultural stories. The book explores how Hungary’s political system moves further away from the Western democratic and liberal values.

The book contains different elements: personal texts with associated food and family pictures, black and white portraits of and interviews with a women who left Hungary, and at the end of the book, I include the recipes of the dishes I mention in the texts.


                                                               CHAPTER 7

                                             Halászlé / Fisherman's Soup


There is absolute male dominance in Hungarian politics. Hungary is the only European country that has not a single female minister in its government and where the number of female members in the parliament is under ten percent.

In our family kitchen both males and females are fairly represented, not perfectly equal but close. Well, nothing is perfect. There are special types of meals that are always prepared by Mom, like soups, chicken and deserts, but beef, pork, duck, or Italian food are usually my dad’s duty. There are exceptions to the rule of course, Fisherman’s Soup is one of them. It is a typical dish at Christmas dinners. You need several different kinds of fish to prepare it and it takes a lot of time to make. We eat it with fresh bread and if you like it spicy you can put hot paprika cream in it.

My father is very good at making it and he also catches the fish for the soup himself. We have a riverside cabin in East Hungary so during the summer he spends all his time there fishing. That means that the rest of the year our fridge in Budapest is stuffed with frozen fish and nothing else can fit in it.

After my dad is done cooking he leaves all the dirty dishes in the sink because washing them is something that women have to do. Unfortunately my brother follows his conservative dish-ideology.


GOAL
money goes to:
▹ print 200 copies / soft cover book  (7"x 5"), english
▹ print 200 copies / soft cover book (7"x 5"), hungarian
▹ 16 copies / limited edition artist book  (11"x 17"), english
▹ transportation
▹ launch party / show / advertising
▹ translation

If I don't reach the goal, the money would go to print the books but a smaller edition. 
Please share my story!
Júlia

story:
¿Quiénes somos?

Somos el San Juan Bike Polo Club. En el año 2009 un grupo de amigos conocimos el deporte en la Ciudad de México y decidimos traerlo a Puerto Rico. Desde entonces, han llegado jugadores de todas partes de la isla y del mundo para jugar este deporte en expansión global a la cancha de bicipolo del Parque Barbosa. La evolución del club se ha dado gracias al trabajo, la entrega y el entusiasmo de la comunidad bicipolera y de los ciclistas urbanos de San Juan. Hoy día contamos con dos equipos consistentes que han viajado fuera de la isla para competir.

Queremos continuar desarrollando nuestro nivel competitivo y representar a Puerto Rico en el 2do Torneo Latinoamericano a celebrarse los días 15-18 de octubre en Quito, Ecuador.

¿Qué queremos y por qué hacemos esto?

Queremos seguir representando a nuestra isla en los torneos internacionales más importantes.  Nuestra presencia, en esta segunda edición, tiene aún más relevancia ya que aspiramos a celebrar el próximo Torneo Latinoamericano en Puerto Rico en el 2016. 

La ejecución de estas metas requiere de capital. Representar a Puerto Rico es nuestro compromiso y te invitamos a que nos acompañes en esta tarea muy importante para desarrollar el Bicipolo a nivel local.

Retos y obstáculos

El mayor reto es que alguno de nuestros dos mejores equipos llegue al podio en este segundo torneo latinoamericano. Para lograrlo hemos estado entrenando fuerte. El principal obstáculo ha sido recaudar suficientes fondos para llegar a Quito, Ecuador. Cada aportación nos acerca más al 2do Torneo Latinoamericano. #LoQuito2015  

A pesar de organizar torneos internacionales en Puerto Rico, los fondos recaudados se reinvierten en la producción de los eventos. Por ende, no es suficiente para enviar a los mejores jugadores a competir en el exterior. El dinero que deseamos recaudar se utilizará para cubrir los gastos del viaje:

-Transporte: $ 6,602

-Dietas: $ 1,050

-Inscripción: $ 240

-Estadía: $ 1,050

Total: $ 8,000

Equipos y  jugadores

Zumbadores: Ivonne, David, Jan Poul  

Tres Gallos: Joey, Gandul, Rube

story:
Short Summary

The "African Wildlife Stories" is a series of children’s books with three inter-related aims:

1. To introduce sub-teenage and teenage children to the wonders of Africa’s rich diversity of wild life;

 2. To encourage them to take a stand on such important issues as trophy hunting and the illegal trade in wild animals (which is one of the biggest illegal trades worldwide after modern-day slavery and drug trafficking); and

3. To persuade them to embark on the wonderfully rich journey of a lifelong relationship with books and reading.

What We Need & What You Get

We would like to raise $7 500 to get "Lennie the Lion" into print. When you contribute to this campaign you will not only receive a copy of "Lennie the Lion", the kind of book every child will cherish, but you will also help to alleviate poverty in rural Zululand (see our list of perks).

The cost of printing is only one of the costs associated with publishing a book: there are also costs for research, writing, editing, illustrating (in this case) and design (pagination and layout).  We have already covered all of those costs from our own funds, so the only stumbling block left is the print bill.

We are hoping to raise $7 500, which will be enough to print 2 000 copies of each edition, with enough left over to have the text translated into Zulu and German.  If we don't reach our funding goal, we shall put the translations on the back burner and print only  as many copies as we can afford.

 

Turn your children into future heroes

“Children start to form core values around the age of 10,”

  Lesley McNutt, Coaching for Conservation

“Our aim is to inspire young people to become future  conservation heroes,”

Tanya dos Santos, Investec Rhino Lifeline

We couldn’t agree more.  The African Wildlife Series of children’s books has three inter-related aims:

  1. To introduce sub-teenage and teenage children to the wonders of Africa’s rich diversity of wild life;

  2. To encourage them to take a stand on such important issues as trophy hunting and the illegal trade in wild animals (which is one of the biggest illegal trades worldwide after modern-day slavery and drug trafficking – bigger even than illegal arms sales); and

  3. To persuade them to embark on the wonderfully rich journey of a lifelong relationship with books and reading.

There is no argument that Africa’s wild life is under threat. The recent social media storm around US dentist Robert Palmer and his killing of Cecil the Lion in Southern Africa, shows that millions of people are vehemently opposed to trophy hunting.  Sadly, as happens so often in the new digital age, the storm died down and trophy hunting continues unabated, despite protest marches in cities across the world.

The rhino poaching saga shows how quickly criminal elements move in when they sense an opportunity for profit. 

Twenty rhino are slaughtered every week in Southern Africa, and the illegal trade in rhino horn is showing no signs of slowing down.  With rhino horn – which is nothing more than an agglomeration of hair follicles – now worth more per ounce than gold, a couple of kilos of hair can bring the gangsters more profit than a containerful of sex slaves.

It is possible that your children may in the future be asked the question, “Grandpa, what were rhinos?”  This is a situation to be avoided at all costs.

But the possibility of extinction for our only living link to the dinosaurs is not the sole reason for action.  Lions are not endangered and trophy hunting probably kills fewer than disease: our opposition to trophy hunting is not just in order to save the lions – it is to prevent humans from behaving in an amoral fashion.  And most people would agree that poking a gun through a fence and shooting a caged lion is simply unacceptable.

However, just because we are fully signed up to the cause of the wild animals, we should not lose sight of the bad situations in which many humans find themselves in Africa. Poverty is endemic here in Southern Africa, particularly in the rural areas, and Zululand is as poor as anywhere else.

The contrasts are stark.  In Johannesburg, six-lane highways connect the city with its suburbs, million dollar high-rise buildings glint in the sunshine, almost everyone carries a cell-phone, internet banking is old news (and very efficient) and supermarkets offer everything from imported Canadian salmon to fillet steak.

Where I live, despite the government’s best efforts, people still use outside drop toilets, many women and children walk miles every day to fetch water, and household electricity is a distant dream. One little-known statistic is that 50% of South Africans have never been inside a supermarket.

In such a climate, with an unemployment rate above 25%, it is almost impossible for rural people to find work, so any attempt to assist them deserves our help.

It is for this reason that we have chosen the Zulu beadwork initiative as one of the beneficiaries of our project.  There are fewer than 800 qualified beaders in KwaZulu-Natal, with more undergoing training.  We have chosen two beadwork items to offer as perks to those people who join our team.

The first one is a badge designed by our team, which we plan to sell later to raise funds for the fight against rhino poaching, and the other is a standard ballpoint pen, transformed by beading into a must-have conversation piece and work of art.

Whichever one of the two you choose (hopefully both), it will be shipped to you as soon as possible after the close of our campaign. And your copy or copies of “Lennie the Lion” will be shipped to you before Christmas.

We are publishing two editions of the book – a “European/English” edition (ISBN 978-0-9946606-3-3) and a “United States/Canada” edition (ISBN 978-0-9946606-2-6), so that you can choose whichever spelling your kids will find more acceptable. You will find the two variants of Chapter 1 below, with the only change being the alternative spelling of the word color/colour (There are some chapters with several changes).

Chapter 1

When Lennie was born, under a thornbush in the Imfolozi National Park in Zululand, South Africa, he looked just like his brother and sisters. There were five of them, two boys and three girls, and they all grew up together playing the games that lion cubs play, while their mother rested after a long night of hunting for food.

As they got older, Lennie and his brother grew a little faster than their sisters, so that by the time their first birthday rolled round, it was easy to see which were the boys and which the girls.  Even though Lennie and his brother were a little bigger, this did not mean they were regular winners of the wrestling and pouncing games that the cubs played all day long.

And then, after the sad day when Lennie’s brother tried to play catch with a puff adder, Lennie became the only boy in the brood.

When the four of them turned two, Lennie’s mane – which would make him look different even to people who knew very little about lions – had started to grow.  He no longer looked like his sisters, and he wouldn’t grow up to look much like his father either, for the first few hairs of Lennie’s mane were really, really black.

All male lions have manes, the huge shaggy hairstyle that starts to grow when they are about two years old. By the time they are grown-up, it covers not only their heads and ears but also much of their shoulders as well.  This helps to protect them in a fight, and in most male lions – almost all of them, in fact – that hair is the same golden color (colour) as the rest of their bodies. But a very few male lions are blessed with a black mane, and this makes them rare and special.

Lennie was going to be one of those.




Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute financially please help us by sharing this campaign with your friends or 'like' our facebook page www.facebook.com/africawildlifestories and of course please use the Indiegogo share tools.

story:
The S, M, L Tour is a whacky collaboration between “world renowned” authors Nicholas Power, Lillian Necakov and Jim Smith. Our first gig took place in May 2015 at Argo Bookstore in Montreal, Quebec. Following the success of that reading we knew that this was our calling. We would endeavor to bring our writing to as many places as would have us.  

We received our next invitation to read in beautiful Nova Scotia at Lexicon Books in October. After that, another invitation to read in Fredericton, and so it began…

It is 1,870.7 km from Toronto to Lexicon Books in Lunenburg, Nova Scotia and it costs money to make that trek. Of course we could walk it in 294hrs, bike it in 95hrs and it would cost us nothing except our sanity. Instead, we have chosen to fly. And, because we were unable to secure funding from any arts organizations in time, we are asking for your help in funding our tour.

We are dedicated to bringing fine literature to your neighbourhood. We’ve even garnered attention from international venues! This could be the start of something great, maybe even XL!!

There will be perks for donating, we guarantee it!  Just check out our campaign page.

Thanks in advance for your generosity in supporting Canadian writing.

Nick, Lill and Jim (S, M, L)

2015

story:
Steps to liberty - LGBT Asylum seekers need your solidarity!


Wir brauchen Eure konkrete Unterstützung - JETZT!

Anwaltskosten & Fahrtkosten für 2 Lesben

Diesmal geht es darum geflüchtete Lesben zu unterstützen, die in ihrem Herkunftsland verfolgt wurden und nun hier Asyl suchen. 

Was sie sagen:

"Wir sind zwei aus Mazedonien geflüchtete Lesben und wegen der Diskriminierung, Gewalt und Folter in unserem Land in der Hoffnung auf Schutz und gleiche Rechte für Homosexuelle nach Deutschland gekommen.

Wir wissen, dass es nicht einfach sein wird, aber wir glauben, dass wir ein Recht auf Schutz haben und wir sind bereit, dafür zu kämpfen."

Ihr unterstützt mit Eurer Spende, dass sie Ihr Asylverfahren gut vorbereiten können

  • Um bei einem Asylverfahren gut begleitet zu werden haben die 2 Lesben eine Anwältin
  • Fahrtkosten zu Vorbesprechungen, Terminen, ...
  • Wir wollen Ihnen ermöglichen, dass sie gut begleitet in das Asylverfahren gehen können. Daher wünschen wir uns, dass sie viele unterstüzen.

Hintergrundinformationen zur Situation von Lesben in Mazedonien und zur Situation von Asylsuchenden in Deutschland

Von wegen „sichere Herkunftsstaaten“

Im September 2014 wurde die Liste angeblich „sicherer Herkunftsstaaten“ auf Serbien, Mazedonien und Bosnien-Herzegowina erweitert. Trotz massiver Proteste von zahlreichen Menschenrechtsorganisationen. Ein Gutachten von Dr. Reinhard Marx und Dr. Karin Waringo aus dem vergangen Jahr zu Serbien, Mazedonien und Bosnien Herzegowina erläuterte die verfassungsrechtlichen Vorgaben und die menschenrechtliche Situation in den einzelnen Ländern und zeigt das Ausmaß an menschenrechtlichen Defiziten in den Balkanstaaten auf. Besonders gefährdet sind Minderheitsangehörige und Homosexuelle. Hetze und rassistische Angriffe sind an der Tagesordnung. Einen effektiven Schutz durch Polizei und Justiz gibt es nicht.
Dr Reinhard Marx schließt daraus, dass das Gesetz zur Einstufung von Serbien, Mazedonien und Bosnien Herzegowina als “Sichere Herkunfsstaaten mit EU-Recht nicht zu vereinbaren ist:

Es “stellt ausschließlich auf staatliche Verfolgungen und Übergriffe ab und verfehlt damit den unionsrechtlich maßgebenden Rechtsmaßstab für die Einstufung eines Staates als „sicherer Herkunftsstaat“.
Soweit festgestellt wird, es finde „keine Verfolgung oder sonstige systematische menschenrechtswidrige Behandlung“ statt, verfehlt er die maßgebenden verfassungs- und unionsrechtlichen Prüfkriterien. (…) Die Einschätzung, dass die Verhältnisse „ansonsten mit Staaten in der Region, darunter auch EU-Mitgliedstaaten, vergleichbar“ seien, wird durch Berichte internationaler und nichtstaatlicher Organisationen nicht bestätigt. (…)
Homo- und Transsexuelle sind häufig Opfer von Gewaltverbrechen. Homophobie ist in der mazedonischen Gesellschaft weitverbreitet und hindert diese daran, ihre Sexualität frei auszuleben. Diskriminierungen und Stigmatisierungen dieser Personengruppen sind weit verbreitet und werden insbesondere dadurch verstärkt, dass Mitglieder der Regierung, andere Politiker wie auch Medien Vorurteile gegen diese schüren.

Dr. Karin Waringo beschreibt auf u.a. auf Basis von Dokumente der EU-Kommission, des US State Departments und des Menschenrechtskommissars des Europarats die Situation Schwule, Lesben und Transsexuelle:

“Ähnlich wie in anderen Staaten Südosteuropas ist Homophobie in der mazedonischen Gesellschaft weitverbreitet und hindert Schwule, Lesben und Transsexuelle daran, ihre Sexualität frei auszuleben. Besonders bedenklich ist, dass sie in Mazedonien weder durch Aufklärung noch durch Sanktion bekämpft wird, sondern z.T. bis in Regierungskreise hinein geschürt wird. (…)
In der alljährlichen Bewertung der rechtlichen Gleichstellung von Schwulen, Lesben und Transsexuellen der Internationale Schwulen, Lesben und Transsexuellenvereinigung ILGA (International Lesbian and Gay Association) nimmt Mazedonien einen der letzten Plätze weltweit ein. (…) Damit rückt Mazedonien in der Bewertung der ILGA in den Bereich der Staaten, in denen die Rechte von Homo- und Transsexuellen grob missachtet werden. (…)
Bezeichnend ist, dass Mazedonien Diskriminierung aufgrund der sexuellen Orientierung trotz erheblichen Drucks von Seiten der Europäischen Union noch immer nicht als verbotenen Diskriminierungsgrund in sein Antidiskriminierungsgesetz aufgenommen hat. So ist es nach wie vor zulässig, Schwule und Lesben im Arbeitsprozess zu benachteiligen.”

ILGA-Europa über Menschenrechtsverletzungen gegen LGBTI Menschen in Mazedonien

ILGA-Europa – ist der Europäische Regionalverband des Internationalen Lesben, Schwulen, Bisexuelle, Trans und Intersex Verband (ILGA und ist eine internationale nichtstaatliche Dachorganisation, die 422 Organisationen aus 45 europäischen Ländern zusammenzubringt.

Die ILGA-Europa trägt in Partnerschaft mit nationalen Organisationen mit der ausführlichen Dokumentation über Menschenrechtsverletzungen gegen LGBTI Menschen zu den Fortschrittsberichten bei, die die Europäische Kommission in allen derzeitigen und potenziellen Kandidatenländern jedes Jahr fortlaufend erstellt.

Hier ist aus dem Bericht 2015 die Zusammenfassung der jüngsten Entwicklung seit dem letzten Bericht von ILGA-Europa: Staatlich geförderte und in Medien verbreitete homophobe Rhetorik, sowie strukturelle Gewalt gegen LGBTI Menschen zeigen weiterhin einen besorgniserregenden, zunehmenden Trend in Mazedonien. Institutionen und Gesetze zur Verhütung von Diskriminierung schließen immer noch sexuelle Orientierung und Geschlechtsidentität von ihrem Geltungsbereich aus. Polizeikräfte und Justiz zeigen beide weiterhin aktive Gleichgültigkeit in Bezug auf Hassreden und Hassverbrechen. Trans Menschen scheinen weiterhin in Gesetzen und Institutionen, unsichtbar zu sein. Die Regierung schlug Änderungen in der Verfassung vor, die festlegen, dass die Ehe ausschlieslich eine Verbindung zwischen einem Mann und einer Frau ist, und dass jede zukünftige familienbezogenen Rechtsvorschriften (einschließlich eingetragene Partnerschaften) eine Zweidrittelmehrheit im Parlament erforderlich macht. Schließlich hat sich die allgemeine politische Lage in den letzten Monaten stark verschlechtert,was die Funktion der staatlichen Institutionen, die das Mandat haben, die Rechte der LGBTI-Personen zu schützen, illegitimiert und sie funktionsunfähig macht.

Stellungnahme der Lesbenberatung Berlin zur Situation von asylsuchenden LSBTIQ in Erstaufnahmeeinrichtungen und Gemeinschaftsunterkünften in Berlin

Durch vermehrte Meldungen von Gewalt- und Diskriminierungserfahrungen von asylsuchenden LSBTIQ in Unterkünften, einer Umfrage unter Unterkünften sowie einem Austauschtreffen zur Evaluation der Bedarfslage von asylsuchenden LSBTIQ wurde deutlich, dass LSBTIQ Gewalt und Diskriminierungen in den Unterkünften erleben und in den meisten Fällen wenig Unterstützung von Seiten bestehender Strukturen erhalten.

Zusammenfassend lässt sich die aktuelle Situation von asylsuchenden LSBTIQ wie folgt
beschreiben:

  • Gewalt und Diskriminierung durch andere Bewohner_innen,
  • verunsichernden und unangenehmen Momenten in den Mehrbettzimmern mit anderen Asylsuchenden,
  • Angst vor Coming Out und diskriminierende und gewaltvolle Reaktionen in der Unterkunft,
  • Überforderung der Leitung und des Personals mit den diskriminierenden Situationen in den Unterkünften,
  • Wenige bzw. keine sensibilisierten Ansprechpersonen für ihre Belange in den Unterkünften oder Beratungsstellen,
  • Angst davor, dass die Familien in den Heimatländern informiert werden, gerade wenn sie noch kein Coming Out hinter sich haben bzw. wenn das Thema Homosexualität in den Heimatländern tabuisiert ist,
  • Gewalt- und Diskriminierungserfahrungen auf der Straße,
  • Unsicherheit und Unwissenheit, wie die einzelnen Menschen, von denen sie abhängig sind, z.B. Behörde, Ärzt_innen, Lehrer_innen (in den Sprachschulen) auf ihre Homosexualität bzw. ihre Genderidentität, auch in Verwobenheit mit ihrem Asylantrag, reagieren


Solidarische Strukturen & Selbstorganisation

Praktischer Solidarität bedeutet auch für uns die Forderungen in kleinen Schritten selbst umzusetzen, um Abschiebungen zu stoppen, Bewegungsfreiheit zu ermöglichen, Residenzpflicht aufzuheben, Arbeit & Lernen zu ermöglichen, Wohnorte zu schaffen, mit Respekt & Achtsamkeit, auf Augenhöhe zu kommunizieren, ... UND eben auch Geld zu sammeln.

Macht Öffentlichkeit !!!

Bitte verbreitet diese Kampagne


Weitere Informationen siehe auch:

http://stepstoliberty.blogsport.eu/

story:
We, editors of the Playwickian- the student newspaper of Neshaminy High School in Langhorne, Pennsylvania- voted in 2013 to ban the word "Redskins" in our student newspaper because we believe it's a racist term. 

In June of 2015 we received word that the Playwickian's funding had been cut in half from its already-reduced budget from the 2014 year. 

People didn't like that:

  • The high school's mascot for sports is the "Redskins"
  • The principal and school board ordered the word must be allowed in advertisements and letters to the editor
  • The student editors published a paper in June without a letter to the editor that used the offensive word
  • The adviser and journalism teacher was suspended for two days -- Sept. 17-18, 2014 -- without pay for failing to prevent students from printing a copy of the June 2014 paper
  • The editor in chief, Gillian McGoldrick, has been "stripped of her title for September." (Thinkprogress, Sept. 19, 2014)

The Philadelphia Inquirer noted on Sept. 16, 2014: "The disciplinary actions appear to represent more ripples in a seemingly unending battle between administrators and members of Neshaminy's student newspaper, the Playwickian, over whether students can ban the name of the school mascot from the paper."

What We Need

We would like to raise money to continue regular production ( eight 12-page print issues) of the Playwickian

  • $400 in printing costs per issue
  • Five issues to cover
  • $2,000 total

Previous Donations Went.... 

  • Toward attendance to Columbia Spring Journalism Conference to receive the Edmund J. Sullivan Award for truth in student journalism
  • Coverage of the Tara Huber's $1200 loss of pay due to her suspension
  • Regular printing costs
  • Legal fees

Recent Awards and Accolades

  • Native American Journalists Association 2015 Free Press Award
  • University of Oregon 2015 Ancil Payne Award for Ethics in Journalism
  • Florida State Press Association 2015 Keynote Speakers
  • Columbia Scholastic Press Association 2015 Edmund J. Sullivan Award
  • Columbia Scholastic Press Association Gold Circle Award, First Place Opinion, 2014
  • NSPA & SPLC Courage in Student Journalism Award, 2014
  • National Liberty Museum Teacher as Hero Award 2014
  • ACLU of PA 2014 Civil Libertarian Award
  • Philadelphia City Council Resolution, October 2014
  • Keystone Scholastic Press Awards, First Place April 2014
  • Philadelphia Magazine Best Truth-To-Power Award, 2014
  • Pennsylvania Scholastic Press Association Journalism Teacher of the Year 2014
  • Widener University & NBC10 Leadership Award, 2014
  • Columbia Scholastic Press Association Gold Medalist Certificate 2014, Silver Medalist 2013

The Impact

You're supporting the education and exercise of free speech by young journalists in the United States, starting with their high-school publication. 

If you can't help with a donation, you can:

  1. Write to the Neshaminy School District: 2001 Old Lincoln Highway, Langhorne, PA  19047
  2. Tweet #printtheplaywickian or #savetheplaywickian
  3. Share this campaign on social media
  4. Tell other student publications to spread the word
