story:
Welcome to My Great Big Positive Life!

 My name is Lorna Park, and along with my husband Chris we are the co-founder's of My Great Big Positive Life. We are passionate about helping kids break through their fears, build their resilience and boost their confidence using the principles of Growth Mindset, Positive Psychology and Mindfulness.

We all want our kids to be happy, right?  We want them to lead a successful and positive life?

Sadly statistics are showing that kids are growing up more stressed out and anxious than ever before. With little resilience and unable to cope with the challenges of life.

 

Where it all began.

Alongside being a wife to Chris, I am also a proud mum of two incredible boys, Charlie (11) and Jacob (6). Being a parent is just the best job in the world, but it is definitely one of the hardest, especially when you know your child is struggling. 

 Two years ago we found ourselves in that very position when our son Charlie, went from a confident, happy little boy to developing a very negative mindset during his school years, believing he was failing at everything. Suffering from anxiety and lack of confidence he would give up at the slightest hurdle, so terrified of making mistakes that he’d rather not try. He was becoming increasingly frustrated with life, and as a result was becoming a victim of his own negative self-talk, stress and worries .

As if the planets were somehow aligned, I happened to be during this time committing to my own journey of self development, and was lucky enough to be introduced to the approach of Growth Mindset and Positive Psychology, via Positive Psychologist and Global success coach Niyc Pidgeon. Learning about the differences between fixed and growth mindset blew my mind, as I started to identify with Charlie’s problems and understand his behaviour more. 

Armed with this knowledge, Chris and I began to understand how to support Charlie better and our parenting style totally changed. We started to praise his effort and hard work rather than his natural ability, we encouraged mistakes so they could be learnt from, but most of all we helped him understand how his brain was working and how he could take control of it.

Amazingly the results were immediate.

As soon as he understood how he could be the boss of his brain, his behaviour,  confidence, self belief, resilience, persistence, stress levels and over all health improved significantly.

Having seen first hand the impact of sharing with Charlie what I had learnt, I went on the hunt for child friendly content to pass directly onto him, but I couldn’t find anything that covered everything I wanted him to know, so I set about creating something myself to enable him to navigate his own way through the emotional rollercoasters of life.

 After speaking to other parents and realising just how many were facing similar obstacles to our own, something that started out as a small guide for my own son, soon became a mission to help as many kids as possible empower themselves with the knowledge that could change their lives.

 

 

My Great Big Positive Life: The ultimate guide to all things happy, was born.

Bringing this together has been a passion project of love, sweat, tears and joy. I have personally studied hundreds of books, studies and journals in the field of Child Psychology, Positive Psychology, Growth Mindset and Mindfulness. At times I have felt overwhelmed by need to make sure I get this right. I have checked, double checked and triple checked the information provided to make sure that it has been written responsibility and although from a place of love, it can all be backed up by the scientific research that has been done in this field.

 

What's inside?

Our “Superstar Edition”  is the ultimate self development toolkit for kids ages 9+ that will help them understand who they are, who they want to be and how they can live a positive life.

Our 3 in 1 guide encourages reading, creativity, journaling and purposely planning for a positive life.

With over 460 pages (including planner), it comes in either a gorgeous blue or orange cover, which is beautifully embossed with silver**. The planner section has been deliberately left undated so it can be started at any point during the year. Inside, it has been creatively brought to life with stunning design and illustration by the immensly talented  Lucy Munro.

 

Included in the wide range of topics is Attitude of Gratitude, Making Friends With Failure, I am, I can, I will, The Power of Yet, You Ain’t Nothing But A Goal Digger, Choose Happy, Stay True To Who You Are, Random Acts of Kindness, The Road to Resilience, Understanding Emotional Intelligence, Let your Soul Sing, Mindfulness Matters and many more.

Encouraging personal engagement, the emphasises is on the child to develop a deep understanding of how their brain works, where their thoughts and feelings come from, and how by developing daily habits such as, gratitudes, affirmations and intentions they can go forward with the belief that they are not only capable, but that they are worthy of living their own Great Big Positive life.

Who's it for?

My Great Big Positive Life "Superstar Edition" is not just for kids that are suffering from lack of confidence, stress or anxiety at the moment. It is for all kids, to help them understand that they are in control of who they are and that they can choose to live a confident, happy and productive life.

Starting their own self development journey at this key stage in their lives, will help them manage their feelings, understand themselves better and hopefully stop negative thoughts for developing in the first place.

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • We are nearly there, everything is written and we are in the final stages of design. We have our printer lined up and ready to go but we really need your help to get it printed and distributed.
  •  
  • Alongside our stunning our stunning 3 in 1 guide, Lucy Munro has exclusively designed for this campaign two gorgeous prints. "Start Each day with a Grateful Heart" and "If you can be anything be kind" Measuring 275 x 215 these individual and unique designs will be printed on to luxury quality true card.
  • All backers will also receive a downloadable parents guide which will allow them to support their children as they go on their journey of self discovery.

 

The Impact

  • We think that our 3 in 1 guide could be life changing for kids. Going on a journey of self development at a young age could alter the way they view themselves, and the world around them. Building their confidence, self worth and giving them the courage to go out there, embrace all the joys and face all challenges that life will throw their way.
  • This is just the beginning... Our first  "Superstar Edition" (ages9+) is just the start for us, we are committed to growing My Great Big Positive Life into a movement that will help change the future for generations of kids throughout the world. 
  • We truly believe that random acts of kindness can change us, those around us and possibly even the world. Backing this campaign will give you a sense of pride knowing that you have done a great thing for others and that you have made an impact in someone else's lives.

 

Risks & Challenges

The risk to you is low. Everything has been written, rewritten and rewritten again and we are now just tweaking the last bits of the design.

  • Chris Park,  has over 25 years experience in the printing trade and has sourced the best and most reliable printer who is waiting and ready to go.
  • .We are being helped and supported by two incredible coach and mentors, Abigail Horne and Sarah Stone Co-founders of the massively successful Female Success Network, both having between them many years of experience in success in the world of all things business.

 

Become a founding member

If you feel as passionately about helping kids help themselves, as we do, we would love you to get involved and support us by becoming a founding member. There are many ways to do this and they are detailed in the campaign perks section.

 

Other Ways You Can Help:

 Don't have the funds to contribute financially?  That doesn't mean you can't help:

  • We would be eternally grateful if you would get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Indiegogo has many share tools that you can use to spread the word.

* Photos currently depict the cover in Orange or Blue with white writing. Once printed the white writing will be replaced with stunning silver embossing.

With over 460 pages (including planner), it comes in either a gorgeous blue or orange cover, which is beautifully embossed with silver**. The planner section has been deliberately left undated so it can be started at any point during the year. Inside, it has been creatively brought to life with stunning design and illustration by the immensly talented  Lucy Munro.
 
Included in the wide range of topics is Attitude of Gratitude, Making Friends With Failure, I am, I can, I will, The Power of Yet, You Ain’t Nothing But A Goal Digger, Choose Happy, Stay True To Who You Are, Random Acts of Kindness, The Road to Resilience, Understanding Emotional Intelligence, Let your Soul Sing, Mindfulness Matters and many more.
Encouraging personal engagement, the emphasises is on the child to develop a deep understanding of how their brain works, where their thoughts and feelings come from, and how by developing daily habits such as, gratitudes, affirmations and intentions they can go forward with the belief that they are not only capable, but that they are worthy of living their own Great Big Positive life.
Who's it for?
My Great Big Positive Life "Superstar Edition" is not just for kids that are suffering from lack of confidence, stress or anxiety at the moment. It is for all kids, to help them understand that they are in control of who they are and that they can choose to live a confident, happy and productive life.
Starting their own self development journey at this key stage in their lives, will help them manage their feelings, understand themselves better and hopefully stop negative thoughts for developing in the first place.

 

 
What We Need & What You Get

We are nearly there, everything is written and we are in the final stages of design. We have our printer lined up and ready to go but we really need your help to get it printed and distributed.
 
Alongside our stunning our stunning 3 in 1 guide, Lucy Munro has exclusively designed for this campaign two gorgeous prints. "Start Each day with a Grateful Heart" and "If you can be anything be kind" Measuring 275 x 215 these individual and unique designs will be printed on to luxury quality true card.
All backers will also receive a downloadable parents guide which will allow them to support their children as they go on their journey of self discovery.

 

The Impact

We think that our 3 in 1 guide could be life changing for kids. Going on a journey of self development at a young age could alter the way they view themselves, and the world around them. Building their confidence, self worth and giving them the courage to go out there, embrace all the joys and face all challenges that life will throw their way.
This is just the beginning... Our first  "Superstar Edition" (ages9+) is just the start for us, we are committed to growing My Great Big Positive Life into a movement that will help change the future for generations of kids throughout the world. 
We truly believe that random acts of kindness can change us, those around us and possibly even the world. Backing this campaign will give you a sense of pride knowing that you have done a great thing for others and that you have made an impact in someone else's lives.

 

Risks & Challenges
The risk to you is low. Everything has been written, rewritten and rewritten again and we are now just tweaking the last bits of the design.

Chris Park,  has over 25 years experience in the printing trade and has sourced the best and most reliable printer who is waiting and ready to go.
.We are being helped and supported by two incredible coach and mentors, Abigail Horne and Sarah Stone Co-founders of the massively successful Female Success Network, both having between them many years of experience in success in the world of all things business.

 

Become a founding member
If you feel as passionately about helping kids help themselves, as we do, we would love you to get involved and support us by becoming a founding member. There are many ways to do this and they are detailed in the campaign perks section.
 
Other Ways You Can Help:
 Don't have the funds to contribute financially?  That doesn't mean you can't help:

We would be eternally grateful if you would get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
Indiegogo has many share tools that you can use to spread the word.

* Photos currently depict the cover in Orange or Blue with white writing. Once printed the white writing will be replaced with stunning silver embossing.

story:
Short Summary

I am Carrol May Coleman Nelson and I have successfully completed writing my book Dolly May & the Magical Enchanted Garden.  My background is in nursing, cognitive behavioural therapist, mentoring and coaching.

I live in Manchester but spent my early childhood growing up in the beautiful countryside of Mount Olive, Ginger Ridge, in the Caribbean Island of Jamaica. I resided with my grandmother and later with my Aunt Merlyn, her husband and their children.

I grew up with a love for books and passion for writing introduced to me by my Aunt Merlyn who was a school teacher and encouraged by my younger sister Claudette. 

This book is about a young child growing up with her grandma and other children on the top of a mountain, where they spent many wonderful days in the garden with her grandma playing inspirational games. This book was written to emphasise that with the right support and aspiration, children can become great achievers in life. The book aims to help young children by teaching them about key world figures and achievers throughout our history; stretching their imagination and inspiring them to realise that they can be whoever they want to be.

My wish is for them to feel empowered enough to transform their lives and create a brighter future for themselves and the world. However, I can not do this without your help. I need to raise £3,000 to publish and market my book. So I'm asking you to contribute towards my crowdfunding campaign and help transform this dream into a reality. Your support will make this project a valuable contributor to the lives of many young children across the world.

What We Need & What You Get

I have selected a self publishing company that has already agreed to publish the book as they can see the potential of its reach and influence.

The  £3,000 will go towards  paying  for the following;

*Cover design

*Editing

*Proofreading

*PR and Marketing plan

*Distribution

* Publication and proof copy

For contributions of £5+ you will receive a thank you email and exclusive updates on new releases. Those who contribute £15+ will receive a thank you email, a signed free copy of the book plus a dedication and mention from the Author.  £25+  will receive a thank you email, 2 free signed copies of the book and a dedication by author. £50+ will receive a thank you email, 2 signed free copies of the book, a dedication, and a 40 minute personal development coaching session by the Author.  

*Testimonial.

Carrol Nelson is an inspirational individual, who has had a significant impact in my life! Over the years, she has been able to speak words of encouragement into many people’s lives, which are like “rays of sunshine” dropping light into an individual’s life!  Carrol is a highly creative individual who is passionate about children and young people achieving their full potential.  I know that her book is going to be an uplifting read, which will inspire and encourage children from a range of backgrounds and cultures.Andrea Nelson (Deputy Headteacher)

*Testimonial

Carrol’s coaching sessions were extremely illuminating for me. Sessions were well-structured and extremely helpful. I was coached by Carrol during a period in my life when there were several different life paths that I could take. With Carrol, I developed strategies which enabled me to gain a sense of clarity amidst feelings of confusion. I was also encouraged to uphold positive thoughts. As a result, I was able to make the best life-changing decision. Additionally, sessions enhanced my self-awareness, allowing me to realise my full potential and purpose in life. I was tasked with answering questions which I had never considered, and this also made me increasingly self-aware and further enthused to accomplish my academic, professional and personal goals. I enjoyed completing the weekly worksheets and activities set by Carrol, they allowed me to become more self-reflective. I still have these worksheets and use them as a reference in the practise of looking back in order to move forward and continually progress. I can truly say that Carrol’s sessions allowed me to develop valuable skills, helping me to see and shape my life path (always setting goals and targets). I couldn’t have asked for a better coach, thank you Carrol. Trishauna Stewart (Master's Degree Student)

*Testimonial

I was struggling with the decision of whether or not to go back to university and lacked the motivation to complete the personal statement and applications. I sat down with Carrol and we spoke about my options and was tasked to clearly consider them. I decided I definitely wanted to attend a master’s course which started approximately 3 months later and get my degree. Carrol immediately helped me break down the work into pieces and create deadlines that were personally attenable for this very short- term goal by using my strengths and recognising my weaknesses. During the following sessions, I developed a life long plan with my long-term personal goals, created a timeline and acknowledged the short-term goals that are necessary to achieve them. We discussed the barriers that were delaying my progress and was tasked with short goals and habits to start developing to allow me to grow now and more so in the future. Carrol worked with me at my pace but was not afraid to point out when I was becoming lethargic in reaching my personal goals which I needed to give me the extra push.  Each session contained questions, worksheets and activities that made me reflect on myself, as well as, what I needed to do or gain to be the best version of myself in order to achieve my goals. Then was sent away with a weekly strategy to practice or activity to complete to allow continuous development. Without Carrol’s guidance and support, I would not have met the application deadline to attend university that October. I learned so much from Carrol about myself, my surroundings, life in general, how get over hurdles with confidence and power of the magic words “I will”. Nikuare Bisson(Master Degree Student)

*Testimonial

Carrol’s coaching sessions were a welcomed opportunity for me to become more focussed in the understanding of what I wanted  to achieve for myself both in regards to my professional and personal growth. Carrol is a very warm person and I immediately felt empowered and revitalised in knowing there was someone who was there to keep me on track in a supportive and informal way. In the sessions I was able to reconnect with past and present desires, acknowledge how my own language and thinking can create barriers to these desires as well as set the necessary steps to turning desires into achievable goals. One of my main issues was finding focus and prioritising my goals which Carrol provided guidance to, remaining continuously patient  Carrol helped me to realise things could be made manageable with determination, commitment and courage. Carrol naturally helped with feelings of confidence in allowing me to appreciate all that I had already accomplished in life producing many positive outcomes. The self appreciation I acquired  aroused an inner strength and clarity which saw me seek higher paid employment, make steps towards moving home and travelling all of which was accomplished thanks  to the support Carrol as well as other factors. However without Carrol's interventions my accomplishment of my goals may have come much later or remained desires with no structure of how I could make them a reality. Much Appreciation. Surriya (Social Worker)

story:
Summary

Adventures with Watersnake - Exploring the Waterways of British Columbia shares eight adventurous water stories written by young British Columbian authors. Each story/chapter features real waterbodies and facts; some stories are fictional, and some are inspired by the author's own experiences and adventures! The seven authors are volunteer members of Waterlution's Youth Advisory Board.

Waterlution is a non-profit organization working to build future water leaders in Canada, and around the world. Annually, Waterlution trains and supports a nation-wide Youth Advisory Board comprised of young professionals and post-secondary students who are passionate about water and education! The Youth Advisory are champions of water and cultural education in their communities.

This campaign is so very important to the Youth Advisory Board, our dream is that Adventures with Watersnake inspires many to steward and protect our most precious resource, water!  All funds raised during this campaign will support educational workshops for school-aged youth in Canada. Please support our dream by helping us reach our goal!

What We Need & What You Get

To continue to reach more school groups in BC and across Canada, our Youth Advisors are working to raise $5000 that can help cover the costs associated with delivering workshops (For instance, some volunteers have to drive far distances to reach their schools, and some workshops require resource guests and/or materials).  Your contribution supports educational workshops for the Great Canoe Journey and Great Waters Challenge programs, delivered by the Youth Advisors and very knowledgeable resource guests.

Adventures with Watersnake includes:

- Eight stories (presented as chapters) tied together with Watersnake's narration

-A few black and white sketches in each chapter (as seen throughout this campaign!)

-Five printable colouring sheets of the sketches

-A glossary to help readers with big words and water terminology

-A place for readers to add in their own water story!

- It's waterless! Though it is filled with water stories, the book itself is printed through a waterless printing company (most print shops use a ton of water for printing! See more below**). It makes perfect sense to raise awareness of water consumption while being an environmentally-conscious gift.

The campaign also features:

- A culturally informative 2019 water calendar, with photos of waterbodies from across Canada and the traditional territories these waterbodies belong to. Each month you'll learn how to say "water" in a different indigenous language. Available in English and French, printed on eco-friendly paper (French version shipping the first week or Jan 2019).

- Copies of Canada's Great Water Adventure storybook (from 2017), inviting readers to explore Canada and its waterways through the eyes of two young adventurers set out to visit each province and territory to learn about many breathtaking and unique waterways. Available in English and French, printed by Warren's Waterless Printing.

The Team

Sarah Alexis, Author and Narrator -Sarah is a member of the Okanagan Indian Band located at the head of Okanagan Lake in British Columbia, Canada. She has an undergraduate degree in Indigenous Studies with a minor in History from the University of British Columbia Okanagan. Sarah continues to focus on her work involved in the Natural Resource sector and the Okanagan Language in the Syilx Nation. 


Kirsten Mathison, Author and Editor- An adventure enthusiast and life-long learner, Kirsten is passionate about exploration and discovery – whether in a cave, on a boat, up a mountain, or behind a computer screen. Exploring and learning more about the natural world led to a recognition of our profound interdependence and connection to the environment, including the omnipresent force and flow of water.  Kirsten has BSc in Geography and Anthropology from UVic and now works as a Geomatics Analyst, mapping the ocean floor and making navigation charts for submarines.

Emma Squires, Author and Editor-  Emma has always felt connected to and in awe of the natural world.  After earning her B’Comm from Queen’s University in Kingston, Ontario, the draw of the ocean, glaciers and mountains of the West Coast led her to BC. Emma works in management consulting, and spends her free time exploring the backcountry of BC, by way of foot or boat through the summer, and by skis through the winter.

Jackson MacPherson, Author- Jackson is a  student studying water and environmental engineering technologies at the Okanagan College and eventually hopes to attend BCIT to obtain a full Bachelors of Technology. Ever since a young age, Jackson has been captivated with the role of water in society and within the ecosystem. 

Noa Mayer, Author- Noa is a student at the University of British Columbia pursuing a BSc in Natural Resource Conservation. Social and environmental stewardship were key ethics in Noa’s elementary education, focusing on our collective responsibility to protect and repair the planet. These ethics have stayed with Noa into her adult life and guide both her academic endeavours and personal ideologies. 

Cairo Huntingford, Author- Cairo is a Simon Fraser University History grad and future social studies teacher. An avid backpacker, Cairo has traveled through several countries in the world, and has big plans on traveling more of her own. If she could have it her own way, Cairo would be on the water all the time, whether it be while paddle-boarding or swimming on the vast ocean and lake bodies throughout her province.

Alan Shapiro, Author- Alan is an environmental professional and science communicator. He has consulted on a range of water resource projects, from environmental assessments to hydrogeological investigations, and has a particular interest is in water resource planning and stakeholder engagement. He is also co-founder of LitScience – a science communication training firm that supports academic, research, and technical organizations – and Science Slam Canada, a non-profit organization that runs science outreach events across the country.

Christine Craig, Water Calendar Coordinator- Christine completed the Ecosystem Management Technician program and the Advanced Water Systems Operations and Management program both completed at Sir Sandford Fleming College. She has been a water and wastewater treatment plant operator/mechanic with Ontario Clean Water Agency (OCWA) for the last 2 years. Christine teaches grade eight students about water and wastewater treatment processes giving students perspective on the importance of conserving/protecting our water for future generations.

The Impact

In the first two years of the Youth Advisory Board, 36 young leaders were trained and delivered educational workshops to over 4200 school-aged youth! As part of the program's design, many school classes hosted their own water celebrations, educating even more young minds!

The first self-published book by the Youth Advisory Board was released in Dec 2017 and has sold over 600 copies to date!

Your donations help bring more youth-led educational workshops to schools across Canada!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't be a supporter!

  • Help us get the word out! Post the campaign on social media, follow us on Facebook, Instagram and Twitter @Waterlution to reshare our posts!
  • Send this campaign with a personal message to three friends who might be really interested!

Note on waterless printing: Yes, it costs more, but it is the right - and environmentally conscious - thing to do. Many large presses can consume hundreds of thousands of litres of water per year as part of the normal printing process. Waterless printing takes advantage of modern technology to reduce these environmental impacts. It eliminates chemicals and water altogether. Waterless presses are also praised for their high-quality colour reproduction and the reduced paper set-up waste for each job.

Note on Canada Post Strike: Please be aware that regional Canada Post strikes are happening in some Canadian cities. Our anticipating shipment date is December 10th 2018. Stay tuned into crowdfunding updates.

story:
"My Journey with Dr. Sebi" chronicles the untold story of the great healer and the great man Dr. Sebi. My experience with our dear brother was nothing short of life changing. After years of battling with my decision, I felt that now was the time to reveal Dr. Sebi's lessons and divine knowledge that was shared with me on the importance of the African Bio Mineral Balance.

My Invitation To You

story:
Calling all Knights

We've built this community from the ground up; not just us, but each of you. Now we need your help to keep it going and growing:

  • All of you know me as Captain Ducky and Eric as the science geek with the answers.
  • We built this group so we all could support each other.
  • With a little help from our friends we can continue to work on new and better ways to help all our members to achieve their goals.

Our goal is to bring our Indie community of authors, artists, editors, and small publishers up to a level of excellence that surpasses the big publishing houses.

We Can Do It Together

    • We offer blog hosting that is connected to the Sci Fi Roundtable name. A name that is gaining recognition outside of our group.
    • We designed and built a Convention Co-Op booth to help authors get their books out to more places than they can alone. We invested so much in getting it built, because we aren't trying to make a profit off of the members of the group. Now, we just don't have the resources to continue this project without some front end help. It takes money up front to do it for convention booth space, travel, and lodging when needed.
    • We have been actively involved in getting the Sci Fi Roundtable name on a convention that we sponsor/co-sponsor so that people will start recognizing that we stand for the Indie community.

    This is the Real Deal

    We've built a place where our members feel welcome, like family. Up to now, Eric and I have been putting our own funds on the line for the Sci Fi Roundtable. We want to continue to provide the best support we can. However, we've expended all we can on; building a booth for the co-op, buying the equipment so that we can directly print our t-shirts and other swag more reliably, cheaper, and at a better quality than we can get them through outsource suppliers, web hosting and the support structure for the newsletters. We want to continue to push the boundaries of what Indie creatives can do. We are daily working on new ways to keep the group growing; ways to build up our collective "brand" so that we all can benefit from this association - ALL OF US.  This isn't Ducky and Eric's group. This is a way for all of us to attract attention from what we do together, so that everyone KNOWS that if you are a KNIGHT of the Sci Fi Roundtable, that makes you something unique in the world. This is where you come in. It won't take much from each of you to get enough to keep things running.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

    • Get the word out. People who aren't member Knights might be interested in joining up.
    • It's easy, just use the Indiegogo share tools!
    • Share on Twitter, Instagram, Facebook, Tumblr, blogs, newsletters and anywhere else you can think of.

    Final Words

    We thank you so much for helping build the Sci Fi Roundtable into the wonderful community it is today. You're all amazing.

story:
Bring Stormlysfortællingerne 2 til live!

 

For 4.500 år siden brød herolderne deres ed om at holde verden i balance. 

For 10 år siden blev Alethkars konge myrdet under fejringen af en fredsaftale. 

Nu er aletherne og parshenderne igen i krig, og hver dag falder tusinder på hver side. 

Er der håb om fred? 

Eller er verden ved at gå under? 

Højfyrste Dalinar har set det i sine syner, men tør han stole på dem? 

Shallan aner det i sine studier, men dem skal hun opgive for at redde sin familie. 

Kaladin har set overklassens bagside … 

… og mistet håbet. 

 

I 2017 udkom En konges vej del 1 og 2 som er den danske oversættelse af første bog i Brandon Sandersons episke fantasyserie Stormlysfortællingerne. Ulven og Uglen stod bag udgivelsen som på dansk spænder over 1.600 sider fordelt på to bøger og er oversat af erfarne Jakob Levinsen.  

Bøgerne er blevet modtaget rigtig godt, og mange har allerede spurgt hvornår fortsættelsen kommer. Målet er at det bliver i 2019, men vi er et lille forlag, og bøger af den størrelse koster en del at oversætte. Derfor har vi brug for din hjælp inden vi kan sætte Jakob ordentligt i gang.

 

”Fantasy for voksne fra øverste hylde” 

Citatet ovenfor er skrevet af Arne Larsen, bibliotekar og anmelder på Litteratursiden.dk, som bare er en af mange glade læsere af første bind i Stormlysfortællingerne.  

Siden 2013 har Ulven og Uglen tilstræbt at udgive fantasy for voksne, både i form af originale danske titler og, ligesom med Stormlysfortællingerne, som oversat litteratur. Vi er et lille forlag med to ejere, et par praktikanter og flere freelancere tilknyttet. Vi er dedikerede nørder, og vi er ovenud begejstrede for at udgive en stor amerikansk forfatter som Brandon Sanderson. En konges vej har solgt godt og bragt glæde blandt læserne, men den har grundet sin størrelse været dyr at oversætte, og det samme er tilfældet med bog nummer to som på engelsk bærer titlen Words of Radiance, og som på dansk vil blive delt i tre bind a cirka 500 sider hver.  

Ulven og Uglen kunne vente på at En konges vej tjener sig ind, før vi igangsætter oversættelsen af bog 2, men så går der måske et år mere, og det synes vi er ærgerligt for alle dem der allerede har læst En konges vej, og som går og venter på fortsættelsen.  

Derfor vil vi gerne i gang med første tredjedel allerede nu, og vi giver dig derfor mulighed for at hjælpe os – og sikre dig et eksemplar før alle andre! 

Du kan støtte med et valgfrit beløb, men hvis du støtter med bare 300 kr., så får du del 1 af Stormlysfortællingerne 2. Bogen vil efter udgivelsen blive solgt for 399 kr. så hvis du bestiller den allerede nu, er det godt for både dig og os.  

Hvis du ikke allerede har læst En konges vej, kan du støtte med 900 kr. og få dem også. De koster normalt 399 kr. per styk.  

 

”Dansk oversættelse på højt niveau” 

Sådan skrev bibliotekernes lektør om En konges vej del 1, og det er ikke underligt at hun var imponeret for Jakob Levinsen har en lang række oversættelser bag sig, inkluderende værker af bl.a. Mary Shelley, Kazuo Ishiguro, Stephen King, Salman Rushdie og J.R.R. Tolkien. Jakobs litterære spænd er bredt, men ligesom med resten af holdet hos Ulven og Uglen har fantasygenren en særlig plads i hans hjerte. 

Derfor valgte vi ham til at oversætte Stormlysfortællingerne, og vi har ikke et øjeblik fortrudt vores valg. Jakob er loyal mod originalteksten, men også kreativ og formår at omgå udfordringerne i forskellene på engelsk og dansk således at teksten bevarer tonen og charmen selvom en passage ikke kan oversættes ordret. 

Jakob har allerede oversat først kapitel af Words of Radiance, og uanset hvilket beløb du støtter med, så får du det tilsendt som pdf.  

 

Risiko og udfordringer 

Som det altid er med crowdfunding så er der desværre ingen garanti for at vi når vores mål. Derfor er der heller ingen garanti for at oversættelsen udkommer, eller at den udkommer i januar 2019 som planlagt. Selvom vi ikke når målet for indsamlingen, vil vi selvfølgelig gøre vores bedste for at alle får de perks de har betalt for, dog med det forbehold at vi ikke kan sende bogen før vi har den. Hvis vi ikke når målet, kan oversættelsen komme til at tage længere tid end planlagt, eller vise sig helt umulig at gennemføre, og i det tilfælde får bidragyderen derfor ikke hele sin perk.  

 

Bliv en del af Stormlysfortællingernes univers 

Hvis du støtter med 3.000 kr. eller derover, så kan du få en tegning af dig selv som en person fra bøgernes univers. Tegningerne laves af dygtige Thorkild Skov som har lavet forsiderne til En konges vej del 1 og 2, og som også kommer til at lave de næste forsider i serien.  

Du kan vælge mellem fem forskellige typer karakterer: 

  • Skårbærer 
  • Forsker 
  • Bromand 
  • Snigmorder i Hvidt 
  • Parshender 

Hvis du bestiller denne perk, kontakter vi dig for at få billeder og andre informationer så Thorkild kan gøre tegningen så livagtig som muligt. Du kan se et eksempel på en tegning i vores billedgalleri øverst på siden. Den forestiller Jakob Levinsen som Skårbærer. 

 

Andre måder du kan hjælpe os  

  • Del vores kampagne med dine fantasyglade venner: Send dem linket til denne side, eller fortæl om os på sociale medier eller lignende. 
  • Følg Ulven og Uglen på: www.ulvenoguglen.dk, www.facebook.com/ulvenoguglen eller www.instagram.com/ulvenoguglen. 
  • Følg indsamlingen på www.instagram.com/stormlysfortaellingerne. 
  • Læs En konges vej del 1 og 2, og fortæl os og resten af verden hvad du synes.

story:
Our Story

My name is Sebastian Andrei Rojas, President & Founder of USA Vegan Magazine.  USA Vegan Magazine combines my commitment to veganism, my skills as an entrepreneur and my passion as a chef. We strongly believe that the main reason why more people have not yet make the transition to a plant-based diet is due to lack of knowledge. People are misinformed and are not aware of the real effects meat consumption has on our body, our environment and our society. We at USA Vegan Magazine are committed to filling in the gap of unawareness by providing all the necessary tools for people to start shifting their lives into a healthier and more compassionate one.

The Magazine

Every section of our magazine is designed to provide useful tools and information to people who are looking for guidance and help them make the transition to a plant-based diet. 

EDITORIAL

CONTENT 

INTERVIEW

RECIPES

TRAVEL

​

TOP VEGAN-FRIENDLY RESTAURANTS

HEALTH & WELLNESS

VEGAN SHOPPING GUIDE

KIDS & FAMILY

TECHNOLOGY

 

COVER STORY

VEGAN DIRECTORY

MUST-TRY VEGAN ALTERNATIVES

 

What We Need & What You Get

This has been a self-funded project I started from scratch and that I have been working on for the past two years. We are now in the process of launching the magazine, our release date is scheduled to be this Winter 2018. I have been bearing all the cost associated with the creation and production of the magazine. (Writing, Editing, Designing, Etc). And at this point, I want to ask for your support to help us make this project a reality. 

  • We're raising $20,000 to help offset the costs of Printing, Shipping and Distribution. 
  • There is no small contribution, every little counts. Please give us your support by selecting one of our perks and become part of the fastest growing movement in the world.
  • We've tried our best to put together some amazing perks.  But the best reward that you will receive is the satisfaction of knowing that you are making a difference in the world.

For The Planet - For The Animals - For Ourselves

  • Global Warming: The U.N. believes that a global shift toward plant-based food is vital if we are to combat the worst effects of climate change. A report published by the Worldwatch Institute shows that a staggering 51 percent or more of global greenhouse-gas emissions are caused by animal agriculture. 
  • Animal Rights: Being vegan is about living a lifestyle that does not cause suffering, harm or death to animals, and allowing animals to be free to choose the way they want to live. Other animals are sentient beings like us, with their own needs, desires and interests. We now know that like us, they can experience a wide range of sensations and emotions such as happiness, pain, pleasure, fear, hunger, sadness, boredom, frustration or contentment. 
  • Serious Diseases: Animal fats have been linked to a range of illnesses and conditions, including diabetes, rheumatoid arthritis, hypertension, heart disease, and various cancers. Animal sources are likely to account for 13 of the top 15 sources of cholesterol-raising fats in the U.S.

 WITH YOUR HELP AND CONTRIBUTION WE CAN MAKE THIS WORLD A BETTER PLACE FOR ALL OF US.

 

From Our Heart

We dream of living in a world where all animals are treated with respect, love and compassion. All of us at USA Vegan Magazine are devoted to this project, we have made many sacrifices, not only financially but personally as well. We've come a long way and we are all very proud of what we've accomplished so far. Now more than ever we are certain that our magazine will become the #1 publication of its type and will be at the forefront of veganism. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help us spread the word and the campaign! To reach our goal we need as many people as possible to contribute, and any help you can give us in sharing the campaign would be a great help and very much appreciated!

On behalf of all animals, a deep and sincere THANK YOU! from the bottom of our hearts

story:
The book is out! Ordering information here!

From the authors of More Than Two and The Game Changer...

 

It came out of nowhere.

We were driving home from dinner, and it fell with a thud out of the air, straight into Franklin’s brain: a glittering little bit of inspiration about a world both similar to and different from our own, a world where the Catholic Church schismed, the colonies in the New World remained colonies, and the skies above London in 1855 were filled with airships...

...but there’s still war in Afghanistan, because no matter what you change, some parts of history stay where they are.

Not content with staying in Franklin’s brain, the inspiration spread and grew. It leaped into Eve’s brain, inspiring a vivid dream about a woman and a cathedral that became a pivotal scene in the book.

And thus was born Black Iron, the novel...and the world where we plan to set many more novels.

Wait a minute! Who are we?

We are Eve Rickert and Franklin Veaux. We co-own an indie publishing company called Thorntree Press, which has published over a dozen books, and have co-written a successful nonfiction book together, More Than Two..

We are successful authors and crowdfunding veterans. We crowdfunded More Than Two, which has been a smashing success. We’ve since crowdfunded and published a string of other books and posters for ourselves, Thorntree authors, and private clients.

This is our first foray into fiction. We didn’t really choose to write this book—it chose us. Inspiration does that sometimes. And so, we locked ourselves away in the same cabin in the woods where we wrote More Than Two, and came back with...Black Iron.

The Rewards

Of course, at most levels of support, you can receive a printed or electronic copy of Black Iron, along with an advance chapter—and at higher levels, the complete manuscript. We’re offering a chance to get a paperback or a limited edition hardcover. The paperback will feature beautiful cover art by Julie Dillon, who is working madly on the final art as we speak. The art you see here is concept art; we will update the campaign as the final art materializes. The hardcover will use woodcut designs of the sort adorning blackironbook.com.

Your name immortalized on the Black Iron Web site.

Stickers based on the hardcover design. The design is still being finalized—stay tuned!

A poster of the final Black Iron artwork by Julie Dillon, and, at higher levels, one of a limited number of posters of the final artwork printed on metal!

An outtakes reel of bloopers and screwups in the campaign videos.

An invitation to the launch party, or the chance to take us out to dinner if we end up in your town.

A gear pendant, to help you show off your love of all things 19th-century alternate history.

A hand-forged black iron heart pendant. Since these are all made by hand, they will vary slightly from the one shown here.

An Amazon Kindle Fire 7 tablet, autographed by both of us and pre-loaded with all our books: Black Iron, More Than Two, The Game Changer, Polyamory and Jealousy, and (optional) Franklin’s BDSM erotica collection (as William Vitelli)—Nineteen Weeks, Elicitation, Evocation, and The Webcam Chronicles. (Who says you can’t get an autograph with an e-book?)

More rewards, including rare, hard-to-find copies of the hardback special first edition of More Than Two! See the perks for details.

Budget

The money raised in this campaign will go toward editing, sensitivity reading, design, cover artwork, production support, and advertising, as well as to print the first edition paperback and fulfil the rewards.

As you can see, publishing a book ain’t cheap. We’ve become quite good at it—our publication company, Thorntree Press, along with its parent company, Talk Science to Me, produces beautiful books—and all the editors, proofreaders, book designers, and artists who work on a book need to be paid. Robots haven’t taken over those jobs yet, so they all need to eat.

Stretch Goals

Watch this space! When we hit 50% of our goal, we’ll announce some cool stretch goals.

 

Questions?

Got a question about something not covered here? Send an email to news@blackironbook.com.

 

Thank you for your support!

story:
The Mini-Sledgehammer Writing Group hosts a monthly quirky writing event that incorporates four writing prompts and a 36-minute time limit. All writers are welcome, from published professionals to newborn novelists, and when the time is up, they read their stories and the judges select a winner—all right there on the spot. There’s no time to hesitate, second-guess, or hold back.  (By donating through Indiegogo, you are not entering a contest of any kind).

We have met once a month since 2009. Some truly amazing writers have come through our doors, and  it's time to publish the 36 best winning stories from the last eight years!  

Whether you like thrillers or romance, there’s a story for you in this anthology. Sci-fi, absurdist drama, voodoo noir—they’re in here! You'll hold every genre in your hands. 

This is a PRESALE campaign for The Exquisite Rush: 36-Minute Stories. The funding will be used for printing and shipping costs, and we are so grateful for the support of our community! The funds go directly to Indigo: Editing, Design, and More, the business that supports the Mini Sledgehammer Writing Group and is managing the production costs, but this is an all-volunteer and donation project. 

The pre-sale cost for the anthology is $10.00 (paperback) or $2.99 (eBook). The anthology will also be available at our launch party on March 6, 2018! 

Beyond March 6, it will be available wherever books are sold for $13.99.

We've picked the best of the best for our anthology, and we're so excited for you to read it! 

Thank you for your support! We couldn't do it without you!


Details: 
Published in 4.37" x 7", the page count is 224.
ISBN 978-0-9819422-4-7 (paperback)
978-0-9819422-5-4 (eBook)

story:
Short Summary

Nora Jacques was born in a troubled home. Abuse, addiction, and poverty was prevalent. Through adoption, she dodged quite a few challenges, but she couldn't dodge the inner struggle of humanity. The struggle to feel belonging, the struggle to find our place in the world. Though Nora had guidance through her beloved adopted parents, many from her community, continue, to this day, to remain bound behind the walls of limitation of their minds and their surroundings.

A 2015 White House Study states that a disadvantaged youth "born 25 years ago has only a roughly 1 in 2 chance of being employed today as a result of early death, incarceration, low labor force participation, and high unemployment." 

This series  will share the emotional and sometimes ugly truth within disadvantaged communities.

The series, based on real-life stories, will cover topics such as addiction, poverty, abuse and violence. It will open up the imaginations of youth from preschool ages to adult, to help them visualize an individual road beyond their current limitations and on to their God-given purpose.

What We Need & What You Get

This IndieGoGo campaign was initiated by my friends in Corporate America who saw the passion dedicated towards this project. A few weeks ago, I made the decision to leave an established career to focus on building this work.

The work will go beyond the book. As I conduct research, I will record the interviews on film and produce a documentary to help spread awareness of the conditions that are exposed throughout this journey of research, asking questions and building relationships.

Where Lost Dreams Go will begin a conversation within underprivileged communities, families and schools. This is not just a book, this is a movement.  

Donations will go towards:

·  The cost of conducting interviews, travelling, and other related expenses

·  The cost of producing a documentary and submitting it to film festivals

·  The cost of publishing the books

I am writing this from an intense desire to reach the community where I was born and bridge the gap from the struggle to the dream. 

As a supporter of this campaign, you will get the first word about the interviews, the stories, and the impact of this movement to make even the most unlikely dreams come true.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • You can help get the word out and make some noise about our campaign
  • You can use the Indiegogo share tools to increase visibility of our campaign
  • Help increase awareness for the campaign and the book
  • If you have a story that you would like to share, send me an email at norajacx@gmail.com.

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Dear Family, Friends, and Prospective Supporters:

Please click here to enjoy a video depicting how we are living here in MN!

In short

I've written a book for children to communicate our culture and help raise awareness and support for our creative community (pilot site and more videos at CoCreateX.com).

Summary

Story About Stanley is a storybook intended to inspire confidence, creativity, and compassion in children. It is also intended to share the values and culture of our community towards increasing the number of kind, generous, and supportive people in the world.

Here below and on CoCreateX.com, I have posted the text for this, my first children's book, in an effort to inspire artists to volunteer illustrations for each of the pages. With a collage of contributions, we should be able to complete the book, have it printed, and make it available to our community in support of our continued investment in the CoCreate Community. If this activity proves successful and are readers delighted, we fully intend to hire key people to expand this project.

Background

With preparations beginning 3 years ago, and drawing upon savings and experience accumulated over the course of my entire life, over the past year:

We turned our home into a maker environment with a machine shop and engineering laboratory with specialized tools available to our community, largely for free. Our desire is that people be able to realize their creative dreams at less expense and in less time. When a person can create something of value for less, everyone wins, and creativity of all forms can be sustained.

Some of our stories of impact include: We supported a young woman's pursuit of American Ninja Warrior, paid for a semester of a young man's college, raised money for a charity that sends medicine to developing countries, gave a grant to document stories of positive impact, and built a team of passionate people spanning many generations to sustain such efforts. We helped to build a pickle company so that we could cater community events with healthy food and raise donations.

With the proceeds from this book, all donated to the Invent Minnesota 501(c)(3) Not-For-Profit Public Charity in support of the CoCreate Community (pilot site at CoCreateX.com), my hope is that we will be able to further sustain our charitable activities and provide support to our student interns and dedicated volunteers.

Please enjoy Story about Stanley, named for my personal hero who first inspired our culture of supporting those who support others.


Story about Stanley

Cover

Drawing of Stanley.

Once there was a little boy named Stanley.


Page 1

Drawing of Stanley walking, learning, and helping.

Stanley loved to walk and he loved to talk.


Page 2

Drawing of Stanley discovering a ladder.

(from afar)

Whisper: what is it?


Page 3

Drawing of Stanley looking at the ladder.

Stanley looked.


Page 4

Drawing of Stanley climbing on the ladder.

(laying flat)

And he climbed.


Page 5

Drawing of Stanley sitting on the ladder.

(turned on its side)

And he sat.


Page 6

Drawing of Stanley, proudly standing on the ladder.

(turned on its side)

And he smiled.


Page 7

Drawing of Stanley lifting the ladder.

(over his head)

Stanley lifted the ladder over his head.


Page 8

Drawing of Stanley carrying the ladder.

(place to place, over his head then over his shoulder)

And he carried the ladder…


Page 9

Drawing of Stanley pulling the ladder behind him.

(with wheels on one end, holding the other)

Everywhere he went.


Page 10

Drawing of Stanley meeting a little boy, reaching up a wall.

(from afar)

Whisper: Who’s that?


Page 11

Drawing of Stanley and the boy reaching up the wall.

(feet on the ground)

They reached…


Page 12

Drawing of Stanley and the boy reaching up the wall.

(feet on the ladder’s edge)

And they reached…


Page 13

Drawing of Stanley and the boy, together, standing up the ladder.

(and leaning it against the wall)


Page 14

Drawing of Stanley and the boy climbing the ladder.

And they climbed,

Up and up and up,


Page 15

Drawing of Stanley and the boy at the top.

(arms up then hugging)

All the way to the top!


Page 16

Drawing of Stanley’s grandmother reading Story About Stanley to Stanley.

(tucked into bed)

Mother: Be good Stanley,

You are what you do.

You are who you help.

You are who you care about.


Final Page

In Loving Memory of Sjk,

All Proceeds Towards Doing Good.


--

About Stanley

Stanley is about 4.

He’s curious but calm, expressive but not overly excited.


To The Community

Thank you for your support.

For and with you, we hope to accomplish great things.


(c) 2016 Nicholas Powley

Proceeds to Invent Minnesota

in support of CoCreateX.

story:
Nice to meet you!

My name is David Jacques, I have a degree in Creative Writing. But what makes me uniquely qualified to be your storyteller is that for most of my life, my father has been telling me stories. He's 85 and there are a lot of stories. In a way I've been trained, how to listen, and how to tell stories, and I want to tell you stories.

I work three jobs wholly unrelated to my passion. 

Or are they?

When I put it in perspective, my entire life, studying so many different things, has lent me the opportunity to cross pollinate my creativity until it bloomed into this novel. 

Read a preview

Preview Priya and the Unseen World

Priya and the Unseen World:

The story centers around Priya, a young girl, who hears voices, but when one voice comes calling, OUA, she falls into a coma. She awakens in the hospital, frightened, convinced she's crazy, afraid she'll never go home. Only to find out that she isn't crazy, the voice, OUA, is real. 

It protects her and tells her bedtime stories about a new world. A world where the veil between life, death, man, machine, the paranormal and mystical is very thin. Little does Priya know, that the Unseen World, and hers are closer than she dares imagine.

Some Background

It's a Science Fiction / Fantasy novel that explores the ways that altered states of consciousness are embraced and stigmatized in the USA. Altered states can originate biologically, or can be induced via breathwork, meditation, psychedelics, empathogens, narcotics, meditation, ritual, religion, technology, or art.

The idea is that when these altered states are used with intention and training, they can evolve us and change the world.  This scares the crap out of the "status quo" folks who run the world. The novel deals with these topics and where things might be headed in a world where our privacy is the subject of heavy surveillance.

Is there hope? 

I want to believe. 


Why Indiegogo?

A more direct route to readers, that also ensures you are getting to read the most authentic novel I can write. 


How can you help?

I am seeking $7000 to help with:

  • Professional copyediting of the novel
  • Professional cover, layout, and interior design
  • Ebook, softcover, and hardcover production
In return for your contribution you'll get perks:
  • The unfinished novel in digital format
  • The finished book in digital or print format
  • A tarot reading and the finished book in digital or print format

Gratitude

I am so grateful for this opportunity and the big magic that it takes to be creative. I am tithing 10% of what I earn to organizations that support the evolution of consciousness and have definitely helped me along the path to creativity. By supporting me, you will help me support these people. More info to come.

If you think this is a great idea...

Please help spread the word via Facebook, Twitter, and Email


Thank You!

story:
Help Publish Freefall into Fiction

Freefall into Fiction  is for writers who have found their voice, and now want to write fiction or memoir. Funding will bring this book through pre-production. 

Don’t leave writers high and dry! The book is written, but it still needs to be published.

Barbara Turner-Vesselago’s first book, Writing Without a Parachute, showed writers how to fall in love with writing. Freefall into Fiction  shows them how to write fiction and memoir (without falling out of love). But her publisher has unexpectedly closed its doors. 

Barbara teaches Freefall Writing™ Workshops privately and through universities in Canada, the US, England and Australia. She is a writer and an editor, with a doctorate from the University of Cambridge. Barbara has published 3 books and many shorter pieces (fiction, memoir and non-fiction).

Barbara’s first book about writing, Writing Without a Parachute: The Art of Freefall, published in the UK by Vala (2013) and in Australia by Finch (2014) was widely acclaimed.

“I used to have two shelves of books on writing,” wrote one bookseller, “Now I only stock this one.” 
From reviewers: "I'm on fire!" "An absolute lifesaver" "Do Freefall!"

Freefall into Fiction, designed to take this process to the next stage, was scheduled for publication this year. But Vala is closing shop -- and writers need this book now.

This campaign will bring Freefall into Fiction to market, funding the pre-production, production and marketing costs so that writers around the world can write the books they’ve always wanted to write. 


What we need, and what we would like to offer you

The book is written and ready for pre-production. The funding is to take the book through the editing process, to print, and to market. To do this, we are seeking a total of CAD $14,756, which will fund:

  • Pre-publication costs:  $6,880
  • Initial Printing of 300 copies in UK, and 300 in CAN/US:  $2,896 
  • Marketing in UK, Australia, Canada and US: $5,000

Every dollar will help bring this book out sooner. We are grateful for all contributions, and are offering the following:

  • $50 contribution:  our personal thanks to you as a Supporter and an on-demand copy of Freefall into Fiction 
  • $200 contribution:  a pre-publication copy of the book posted to you and  special mention on the FreefallWriting.com website as a Silver Supporter
  • $500 contribution:  your name in print as a Gold Supporter in Freefall into Fiction, a pre-publication copy of which will be posted to you, plus special mention on the FreefallWriting.com website 

To Freefall Patrons and Founders we offer the following:

  • $2,000 Freefall Patron:  free tuition at a 3-day Freefall Writing Workshop* for yourself or a writer of your choice OR 3 hours of personal Freefall Mentorship with Barbara Turner-Vesselago. Plus a signed copy of Freefall into Fiction  with your name in print as a Patron and special recognition on the FreefallWriting.com website.  
  • $5,000 Freefall into Fiction  Founder:  free tuition at a week-long Freefall Writing Workshop* for yourself or a writer of your choice OR 5 hours of personal Freefall Mentorship with Barbara Turner-Vesselago. Plus a signed copy of Freefall into Fiction, featuring your name in print as a Founder, and special recognition on the FreefallWriting.com website 
    * (excluding accommodation, admin costs and any travel costs incurred)
If we don’t reach our target?

The book is written;  there is no risk there. So we will forge ahead, using the funds contributed to keep us moving towards market. However, it may take (a little) longer for the book to end up in your hands.

Barbara’s work has already shown numerous writers how to tap into their deepest intention through her ‘Freefall Writing’ approach, many of whom have gone on to win prizes and publication.

By donating to this campaign, you will be helping writers across the globe.


Praise for Writing Without a Parachute: The Art of Freefall

“Here is a book that charts new territory”
 Lapidus Journal (UK)

“Freefall is an amazing process. I’m always telling anyone who wants to write:  do Freefall!"
Helena McEwen, author of The Big House and Invisible River (Bloomsbury)
 “One of the sanest books on writing I’ve ever read – an easy-to-follow roadmap for producing work that captures each writer’s unique voice.”
Byline Magazine (Canada)
“If you’ve struggled with fear, doubted the clarity of your voice or the persuasiveness of your material, you will want to clasp this book to your breast and never let go.”
Susan Lynn Reynolds, author of Strandia (Douglas & McIntyre)
"Useful for beginners, superb for writers in the middle of their training and an absolute lifesaver for pros who have lost their nerve."
Mimi Thebo, Senior Lecturer in Creative Writing, Bath Spa University 
"Read this book.” 
Richard Moss, MD, author of The Black Butterfly (Celestial Arts) and The Mandala of Being (New World Library)

Freefall into Fiction will help thousands of writers develop their work for publication.  

Other ways you can help

We would love you to help spread the word about this campaign, and bring other readers, writers and editors to the cause as contributors.

And of course, tell your friends about Barbara’s Freefall Writing approach, the book and workshops. You never know who will be the next budding author you inspire.
