story:
QUICK SUMMARY (details below)

Help Mark Gardner publish his unique book: Driving Through Heaven: The Complete Guide to Knowing God and Living in His Kingdom on Earth

  • The most comprehensive handbook on Christian living to be published, next to the bible
  • Concisely teaches all of God’s basic New Testament principles and skills for living according to his design (we need the skills to apply biblical principles to life)—no other book does this!
  • Clearly and topically explains biblical concepts you can immediately use
  • An easy-to-use tool for use in local church disciple making to help your church grow

In approximately 370 pages in the paperback, Mark describes how we can experience the Abundant Life Jesus promised by living in God’s kingdom on earth

  • He covers all aspects of life: spiritual, intellectual, emotional, relational, and physical—no other book is as thorough, other than the bible
  • Introduction plus seven sections with 60 short, easy-to-read chapters
  • Questions for meditation or discussion, and suggestions for further study for each chapter
  • 475 biblical references ground the work in scripture
  • Complete book information (read the table of contents and 7 sample chapters) is available at the book website, DrivingThroughHeaven.com


How to Contribute Quick Start (details below)

There are three ways to contribute:

1. To Pre-order a book or life skills coaching, in the right-hand column, click on the perk you want or the giving level you'd like. A new page opens, where you'll have the opportunity to include an additional contribution, if you like, and complete the order using your credit or debit card.  Selecting more than one perk requires placing additional orders as the Indiegogo system doesn’t permit selecting multiple perks in one transaction. Or, ...

2. To contribute without selecting a perk, click on the "Contribute" button at the top of the right column. A new page opens and will confirm that you are contributing without selecting a perk. Complete the order using your credit or debit card. Or, ...

3. Mail me a check made payable to "Mark Gardner," along with the perk you'd like from the right column. My contact information is available at the book website, DrivingThroughHeaven.com

Thanks in advance for considering this opportunity to transform lives and churches


WHY THIS BOOK IS NEEDED

1. Churches are declining

We need a resource that will help teach members how to grow their churches.


2. Only 1% of Americans experience the best life God offers


We need a resource that will help people experience more of the Abundant Life that Jesus promised.


THE IMPACT THIS BOOK CAN HAVE

Mark's God-given mission is to help save as many struggling churches as possible by empowering them with the training to use Jesus' disciple making method.

In this unique and comprehensive book, Master Life Skills Coach Mark Gardner will concisely teach you God's New Testament, whole-person design for living in his kingdom on earth.

You will learn the life-transforming principles and skills Mark has taught thousands of people in his 35-year career as a Christian personal life coach, psychotherapist, addictions counselor, and pastor.

1. Driving Through Heaven teaches like Jesus did

2. Learn step-by-step the basic principles and skills of the New Testament

  • Hear God's voice and deepen a real, loving, and practical relationship with him
  • Overcome problems and obstacles to the Abundant Life Jesus offers
  • Maximize love, joy, peace, and rest into your life (the Fruit of the Holy Spirit)
  • Improve your relationships
  • Reduce or end depression, anxiety, fears, self-destructive habits, and addictions
  • Heal painful memories and wounded hearts
  • Reduce stress and improve coping with crises, pain, and life's challenges
  • Teach your children and friends how to live the Abundant Life
  • Increase your commitment to Jesus Christ and serving him

3. Use Driving Through Heaven in your church

  • Enhance your disciplemaking ministry and grow your church
  • Train people like Jesus did with both the biblical principles and skills for living as God designed us
  • Topically teach much of the New Testament (there are 475 biblical references supporting the book's content)
  • Encourage new members with a gift of the book to help them quickly learn Jesus' way of living


Learn all about the book and read sample chapters at DrivingThroughHeaven.com


READY TO PRE-ORDER OR CONTRIBUTE?

Click a perk on the right to pre-order books, life skills coaching, or organizational training. Or, to contribute without a perk, click "Contribute" at the top right


INSIDE THE BOOK

WHAT YOU WILL LEARN IN EACH OF THE 7 PARTS

  1. You can Live in Heaven on Earth has an overview of God's design for living and a description of life in heaven, so we can live that way on earth.
  2. Having a Relationship with Your Creator is about spiritual health and will teach you how to actually hear God's voice, know his will, and deepen your relationship with him.
  3. Thinking Like God will teach you how to transform your thinking (based on Romans 12:2) to change your personality, emotional reactions, how you act, and your relationships.
  4. God's Gift of Emotions will help you understand and use emotions in healthy and appropriate ways. Learn to transform anger, pain, and guilt into inner peace and personal growth. Overcome most depression, anxiety, and fears, plus self-destructive habits and addictions. Obtain God's healing for your heart and memories.
  5. Relationships in the Kingdom of Heaven teaches how God loves, including basic skills for having loving, fulfilling relationships with trust, intimacy, and oneness.
  6. Living as a Spirit in a Physical Universe is about physical health and well being. Discover freedom from worry about your physical possessions and finances.
  7. Experience the Best Possible Life by learning to integrate what you learn into all of your five life dimensions and to balance life. Maximize God's blessings in your life.

FEATURES

  • Includes every dimension of life: spiritual, intellectual, emotional, relational, and physical -- no other book does this
  • The paperback edition will be about 370 pages, with 60 brief, easy-to-read chapters that will average 3 pages each in length
  • Questions for Meditation or Discussion and Suggestions for Further Study for every chapter
  • 475 biblical references grounding the teaching in God's written word
  • Free bonus material available on the book website


ABOUT THE AUTHOR

Mark Gardner, M.Min., founder of Gardner Coaching in 2005, has done counseling and personal life skills coaching for over 35 years. He is an expert disciple maker who empowers people to experience the Abundant Life Jesus promised, and he trains pastors and churches with the skills to use Jesus' disciple making method to transform and grow their churches.

Mark has worked one-on-one with over 3,000 people and taught seminars and workshops on more than 100 topics related to Christian living and life in God's church family. He has a B.A. in psychology and a masters in ministry.  Mark is married, has two daughters, and lives in a small town near Dayton, Ohio.



WHAT MARK NEEDS TO PUBLISH AND PROMOTE THIS BOOK

Budget

(Full details are below, before the FAQS section)

Minimum Goal: $7,000 to publish & distribute the book

  • This is the goal we’re currently working on

Hope Goal: $12,000 total to publish and promote the book so people will know it exists

  • Includes the $7,000 to publish & distribute the book PLUS an additional $5,000 to promote the book to pastors, churches, bookstores, etc.
  • Without promotional marketing, the typical book only sells about 100 copies.
  • While Mark trusts God to promote the book, God will need to help Mark purchase copies of the book to give to key people. God may be wanting you to contribute the money to help publish and promote the book.

Dream Goal: $17,000 total to publish and promote the book, and for living expenses to allow Mark to devote time to jump start promotion of his missionary work and book

  • This is the amount Mark is asking God for
  • Includes the $7,000 to publish & distribute the book, $5,000 to promote the book, PLUS an additional $5,000 for Mark’s living expenses.
  • Without a source of income to support ministry and book promotion, Mark will only be able to share his missionary work and market the book very part-time, while he earns a living through his life coaching. Having limited time to promote the book may put its success in jeopardy.
  • While Mark’s missionary and the book’s successes are ultimately in God’s hands, God will need to provide Mark with income to support his work; you may be one of the people God wants to contribute to Mark’s missionary work to reverse church decline and transform lives.

Like most first-time authors, traditional publishing companies and literary agents aren’t interested in talking with Mark, so he must self-publish this book. Traditional publishing companies only accept manuscripts from literary agents.

Mark contacted numerous agents to obtain representation, but none were interested, with two explaining that the large costs incurred to publish and promote books causes publishing houses to refrain from taking risks on most first-time authors.



ADVISORY TEAM OVERSIGHT

Mark has an Advisory Team that provides counsel, oversight and accountability to Mark’s ministry. They are not a legally invested group, as Mark’s self-employed ministry is not incorporated. But Mark makes himself voluntarily accountable to them. All of these professionals have known Mark for over 10 years, and two for over 20 years.

  • Steve Brown, retired CEO of Bullen Ultrasonics, Inc., elder of Eaton Church of the Brethren, and board member of two international missions organizations
  • Rev. Jim Chronister, pastor of Brookville (Ohio) Church of the Brethren, and self-employed businessman
  • Lou Driggs, Director of Equipping Ministries of Eaton (Ohio) Church of the Brethren, and staff member of Preble County (Ohio) Council of Aging.
  • Rev. Ron Sherck, II, pastor of Greenville (Ohio) Church of the Brethren
 

HOW TO CONTRIBUTE AND PERKS FOR DOING IT

Please help Mark to make this valuable book available to as many people and churches as possible.

If everyone Mark knows pre-orders at least one paperback with a $25 contribution, we will easily make the $7,000 minimum goal. If everyone orders two copies with a $50 contribution we'll easily reach the $12,000 Hope Goal. If we can raise that amount, we’ll have funds to promote the book to make pastors and people aware of it. Please consider ordering at least two paperbacks or giving at least $50.

Pre-Order Books and Contribute to the Book’s Success

You can make contributions in any amount, and if you choose, depending on the level of your support, Mark will provide you with digital or paperback copies of the book, and free life skills coaching for you or your church.

Examples:

  • Contribute $15, and Mark will send you a copy of the PDF version of the book.
  • Contribute $25, and you will receive one signed paperback copy.
  • For $110, he’ll provide you with one hour of coaching you can use, give to a family member or friend, or have him do training for your church or organization.
  • For $1,000, you’ll receive 5 paperback books plus 10 hours of coaching or training.

Anyone who contributes any amount will be listed on the Thank You Page of the book website.

This fundraising campaign will only run for 40 days, so time is limited.

Please help Mark make this book a reality, and pre-order books and life skills coaching or church training today!


Here are three ways to contribute:

1. To Pre-order a book or life skills coaching, in the right-hand column, click on the perk you want or the giving level you'd like. A new page opens, where you'll have the opportunity to include an additional contribution, if you like, and complete the order using your credit or debit card.  Selecting more than one perk requires placing additional orders as the Indiegogo system doesn’t permit selecting multiple perks in one transaction. Or, ...

2. To contribute without selecting a perk, enter an amount in the box at the top of the right column and click on the "Contribute" button. A new page opens and will confirm that you are contributing without selecting a perk. Complete the order using your credit or debit card. Or, ...

3. Mail me a check made payable to "Mark Gardner," along with a note about the perk you'd like from the right column. My contact information is available at the link above, which requires you to establish an Indiegogo account to obtain it. Or find my address at the book website, DrivingThroughHeaven.com


Please be as generous as you can to help Mark reach his minimum goal

Thanks in advance for considering this opportunity to transform lives and churches


PERKS YOU CAN RECEIVE OR GIVE TO OTHERS

1.  Name listed in the book as a project partner, and on a Thank You Page on the book website, DrivingThroughHeaven.com for every contribution.

2. Everyone who contributes will receive 30-minutes of free Christian life skills coaching by phone or in Mark's Eaton, Ohio office.

2.  Copies of the PDF version

  • This will be the complete book, the same as the e-books and paperback versions.
  • They will be sent to you via email as soon as it has been formatted, sometime in late 2015 or early 2016.
  • We regret that distribution complexity of e-books prohibits Mark from making Kindle, Nook, and similar editions available.

3.  Author-signed copies of the paperback

  • Mark will hold several special Paperback Book Launch events in Preble County, Ohio soon as he receives the first run from the printer, approximately May 1, 2016.
  • Anyone living in the Preble County, Ohio area who is unable to attend will have their books delivered to them to reduce shipping costs.
  • Everyone else in the U.S. will receive their copies by U.S. Postal Service delivery as soon as possible after the books are received.
  • Pre-publication orders of the book are only available to be shipped inside the United States due to the high cost of international shipping.  The book will be available through retail outlets about May 1, 2016.

4.  Hours of Christian life skills coaching or training for your church or organization

Benefit from Mark’s 35 years of experience helping 3,000 people to improve their lives, pastoring 5 churches; over 12 years serving as an inner-city social worker, psychotherapist, and addictions counselor; and master Christian life skills coach, trainer, and expert disciple maker since 2005. He holds a Bachelors degree in Psychology and Masters in Ministry.

  • Coaching for individuals, couples, and families in all areas of Christian living: know God better and his will for your life, overcome problems, improve relationships, learn how to have God’s healing, receive help with making decisions like career changes
  • Coaching for churches and organizations: clarify your mission and God’s vision for your future, identify challenges and opportunities, develop a strategic plan for success, determine what training and other resources are needed to grow and excel
  • Training for churches and organizations. Mark has created and presented over 100 public seminars and workshops on topics related to Christian living and church life. He specializes in training pastors and churches to use Jesus’ disciplemaking method, but can provide customized training according to your needs.

Coaching and training may be scheduled directly with Mark beginning in December, 2015. Coaching for individuals, couples, and families will be provided in-person in Mark's Eaton, Ohio office or by phone from anywhere in the world, at the client's expense for the call. Church and organizational coaching or training will be provided in-person within 3 hours of Eaton, OH, and by Skype or other Internet service for all other areas. 

While there is no specific expiration date for the coaching and training hours, practically speaking, they must be scheduled with Mark prior to his retirement from coaching sometime in the future (he has no plans for retiring at this time, but because we never know when health problems or accidents may interrupt our work life, it would be wise to schedule with Mark in a timely manner). There will be no refunds for unused hours upon his retirement. In other words, consider scheduling coaching or training with Mark in 2016.

5.  Name your own perk for contributions of $2,500 or more

Contributors of amounts of $2,500 or more may discuss with Mark how they would like to receive their books or coaching or training.

Restrictions regarding the above perks may still apply. At this contribution level, paperback books may be able to be shipped overseas, though high shipping fees may limit the number of books that can be ordered, especially for international shipments. NOTE: The paperback book cannot be shipped to countries to which the U.S. prohibits exports.

Additional Notes

Please contact Mark if you have any questions about these perks or preferences about how to receive them. When you place your order, there is a place to leave comments and instructions, which you may mark as "private."

Find more information about Mark’s ministries at his website, GardnerCoaching.com


TO PRE-ORDER OR CONTRIBUTE:

Click a perk on the right to pre-order books, life skills coaching, or organizational training. Or, to contribute without a perk, click "Contribute" at the top of the right column. Either way, a new page will open that will begin the process.

To contribute by check, make it payable to "Mark Gardner" and mail it to me with a note about which perk you want to order.  My address can be found at the book website:  DrivingThroughHeaven.com.

Mark's book and coaching make great gifts: order perks or contribute for someone else

You can order perks or make a contribution on behalf of a friend or a family member.

  1. In the right column, select the perk you want to pre-order for someone else, or click “Contribution” at the top right to be taken to the order page.
  2. To have a paperback copy shipped to another person, be sure to add their “shipping address” at the appropriate place.
  3. You will be able to elect to make your contribution for someone else during the Share stage of the contribution process, right after you submit your payment information:
  • At the top of the screen, you'll see your Contribution Summary details. Near the bottom, below your name and amount, select the "Change your visibility" link.
  • Select the fourth radio button, next to "Credited to another name:" and enter the name of the person you'd like to be attributed to your contribution.
  • If you'd like the amount to also show with your friend's name, check the box next to "Show the contribution amount"
  • Click the "SAVE CHANGES" button

Thanks for your contribution.


OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Whether or not you can contribute financially, there are other ways to help:

  • Ask God to encourage people to meet or exceed our Dream Goal of $17,000
  • Ask God to ready people’s and pastors’ hearts to buy and use Mark’s book and training as soon as the book is released.
  • Please share this campaign with everyone you know who may benefit from the book so they have an opportunity to pre-order first-run copies.
  • Share this campaign with anyone who may support a biblical solution to the decline of American churches so they have an opportunity to support Mark’s missionary work.
  • If you share our desire to transform lives and churches, make some noise! Tweet this campaign, share it on Facebook, email it to your family and friends, talk to people and your pastor at church. The more people who know about this campaign, the more likely we are to succeed in reaching our goals.

BUDGET DETAILS

$7,000 to publish the book (Minimum Goal)

Publishing Costs: $3,492 to the publishing company

  • Copyright registration
  • Back cover sales copy creation (deciding what goes on the back cover to promote sales)
  • Custom cover design by a graphics artist (front, back, and spine)
  • Custom interior formatting for digital printing (“typesetting”)
  • Physical proof copy (first print copy for the author to check for accuracy and quality)
  • Distribution setup with major book distributors and large online retailers like Amazon (distributors are the middle-men from which most bookstores buy their books)
  • Annual distribution management fee (coordinate sales and printing with distributors and major online retailers)
  • Printing set-up (placing initial order with the printing company and printing press set-up fee)
  • Annual book ordering fee (the publishing company charges a one-time fee to manage book orders, instead of a small charge on each copy sold, which makes the selected company’s sales costs less expensive than others)
  • Annual physical book returns management fee (generally, retailers only purchase print copies if they know they can return them for a refund if they don’t sell, so this service manages that returns process)
  • E-book formatting (digital books require conversion into the two types of electronic files that online e-book retailers use)
  • E-book distribution set-up with major online digital book retailers
  • Google Books submission (provides book excerpts on the Google Books website)
  • Amazon Search Inside set-up (provides book excerpts on Amazon.com)
  • Books In Print submission (listing the book in this international database)
  • Accounting services (sales reports, sales accounting, IRS reports, paying royalties to author)
  • Marketing strategy consultation
  • Additional costs may be incurred if the manuscript is more complex than average

ISBN Codes Purchase: $89 (each book version published is required to have an international code number that is used for every aspect of the book’s life; this is the number and bar code found on the back cover of printed books)

Indiegogo.com Crowdfunding Website: $644 estimate (based on $7,000 raised)

  • Indiegogo 5% platform fee (based on the total contributions, and comparable to or less than the costs Mark would incur to set-up the fundraising campaign on his book website; includes the fundraising pages, processing all contributions/orders, permitting contributors to use credit and debit cards, providing Mark with a list of all contributors and the perks they choose)
  • Credit/debit card processing fees (3%+30¢ of each transaction, imposed by Indiegogo.com’s bank)

Costs to Deliver Pre-Ordered Paperbacks to Contributors: $2,527 (based on an estimated 280 copies)

  • Printing the pre-ordered paperbacks, sales tax from the printing company, and freight and handling to ship them to Mark so he can sign them
  • Ohio sales tax on each copy (Ohio considers premiums given to reward contributions to be taxable sales based on the retail value of the product, in this case $19.97)
  • Shipping costs to deliver an estimated one-half of the books to contributors

Unforeseen Expenses: $248 (an amount built into the budget to cover actual costs that are more than the estimates or additional services required by the publishing company)

Mark will take every opportunity to minimize costs and will report actual expenditures when totals become available.

$5,000 to promote the book to pastors, churches, bookstores, etc. (included in Hope Goal)

Purchase and ship 300 copies to people who can influence others to purchase the book: $2,790 (e.g., mega-church pastoral staff, denominational leaders, bloggers, reviewers, etc.)

Conduct book tours to meet influencers and conduct book signings as churches and bookstores: $2,210

$5,000 in living expenses to allow Mark to devote time to jump start promotion of his missionary work and book (included in Dream Goal)


22 FAQS

What's the book about?

Driving Through Heaven will teach you how to live the way God designed us to live in order to experience the Abundant Life that Jesus promised us. It is the most comprehensive how-to book on Christian Living ever published. It is based on the premise that if we could go to heaven and see how they live there, then we could live that way on earth.

The good news is that God teaches us in the New Testament how to live like they do in heaven. Because life here is not perfect like heaven, we still have stress and pain, but God has given us all of the spiritual blessings of heaven to enjoy now through a relationship with Jesus Christ (Ephesians 1:3).

Applying God's principles and skills to life can greatly reduce earthly suffering, and increase our experience of the fruit of God's Spirit: love, joy, peace, patience, rest, etc. (see Galatians 5:22-23 for the full list). For more about the book, visit the book website at DrivingThroughHeaven.com.

Why did Mark write it?

Mark's answer: "The original reason was that I was searching for a way to help my clients more quickly learn what they needed. But I couldn't find a book to give my clients that included all of God's New Testament principles and skills for living, which is what I was teaching them. So God told me to write it. Many excellent books on Christian living are based on just one area of God's design for living, like prayer, communications, or dealing with depression.  I've concisely included in one guidebook everything that you need to know to experience more of God in your life and more of the fruit of his Holy Spirit."

"The second reason is that the lack of skills training in churches means that Christ followers do not have the skills to reach out to the unchurched, invite them to become part of God's family, and train them to follow Jesus.  This lack of skills training is the primary cause for the closing of 7,000 churches annually in the U.S, and why researcher George Barna reported that only 1% of Americans experience the most fulfilling life God offers."

What topics are included?

The book is divided into seven parts: you can live in God’s kingdom on earth and experience the Abundant Life Jesus promised, on part on each of the five dimensions of life (spiritual, intellectual, emotional, relational, and physical), how to integrate life, and how to live life to the fullest. The actual Table of Contents from the book is included at the book website on the Sample Chapters page.

Can I read some sample chapters?

Sure. Several sample chapters are included at the book website on the Sample Chapters page, including the Introduction, titled What You Will Learn.

When will the book be published?

Mark will independently publish Driving Through Heaven. First, Mark must raise the funds to hire a company to design and publish the book in paperback and digital (e-book) formats. Once the minimum amount of $7,000 is raised, it will be 4-6 months until you can buy a copy.

But those who financially partner with Mark to make this book available, will receive a free copy of the book.  Mark hopes the book will be available in both formats by May 1, 2016.

How many pages will it have?

The manuscript has 451 pages, but the actual count for the print editions won't be known until after the interior is designed and "typeset." We're guessing the paperback edition will be about 370 pages, but this answer will be updated as soon as we know, later this fall.

Will it include questions for discussion?

Each chapter ends with Questions for Meditation or Discussion.

How long did it take Mark to write it?

In December, 1995, God called Mark to write the book, and he began work shortly thereafter, but it wasn’t until 2000 that he produced the first three chapters of the first of three major drafts. He worked on and off on it after that until 2010, when he began the 2nd draft and completed it one year later.

Changes in the way people prefer to read books, led to a major revision as the 3rd draft, which was completed with the help of a couple of professional editors early in 2015. After a break of several months to create the book website, Mark began proofreading this past summer, with the help of two proofreaders.

All together, he estimates he has devoted over 2,000 hours to the writing project, and many more to the website and the fundraising campaign.

In what formats will the book be published?

The book will be released in paperback and digital (e-book) editions.  Hardcovers require a different printing process from paperbacks and expensive warehouse storage of copies, so hardcovers will not be available at this time.

How many copies will be printed?

Individual copies will be printed when ordered. This "print on demand" method reduces the cost of publishing, so that Mark doesn't have to pay to store a lot of copies in a warehouse. Whenever you order a book from a retailer, a copy will be specially printed for you at the printing company, and usually shipped within one day.

If you would like to own copies of the first-run edition of the paperback, you need to pre-order copies during this campaign. First run copies will not be available after the 40-day campaign ends!

Why would I buy a book I haven't seen?

We don't expect you to! At the book website, DrivingThroughHeaven.com, you can read everything you would if you were holding a copy in your hand or "looking inside" at Amazon.com:

  • Read the same information you would find on the back cover
  • See endorsements for the book (they're also on this page)
  • Read the Table of Contents, Introduction, and 7 full chapters.

Plus, you can ask the author questions about the book using the forms at the bottom of the book website home page, or through the contact information at this site.

Are contributions tax-deductible?

Sorry, no. Mark’s ministry is not an incorporated non-profit, and therefore does not qualify for tax-deductible contributions. The process to obtain non-profit status is complicated, expensive (legal and filing fees), and requires the ability to prove the way contributions are spent over a period of time. God has never led Mark to raise the hundreds of dollars required to incorporate at all, including as a not-for-profit organization.

If I change my mind, can I upgrade to a different perk after I've already contributed?

Sure. Log in to your Indiegogo account and click to view your perk order. Select the perk you originally chose, then click "Upgrade" to select a new one.

Will this Indiegogo site be available for contributions after the campaign ends on Nov. 25, 2015?

If the Minimum Goal of $7,000 is not reached by Nov. 25, then the site will no longer accept contributions. However, if the Minimum Goal is reached, then the site will continue to be open. Please help us reach that goal by contributing today.

What if the minimum goal is not reached? Will I still get my books?

All books and coaching hours pre-ordered will be delivered as soon as possible after publication.

We believe that God will raise the money needed to publish the book he told Mark to write, and that if those funds do not come through this campaign, that he will be provide them through other sources. Mark and Christie have funds saved for their retirement that God may ask them to use if needed.

What if there’s money left over after publishing? Or,what if more than the minimum amount of $7,000 is raised?

Any funds remaining after the book is published will be used for promoting the book to pastors, churches, and readers so that book can become known. This marketing work will include purchasing paperback copies to send to people in positions to be able to recommend to others that they buy the book.

If Mark’s Hope Goal of $12,000 is reached, some of the funds will be used for Mark to travel in the U.S. on book tours to promote the book.

Any funds raised toward the Dream Goal of $17,000 (above the $12,000 Hope Goal) will be used for living expenses so that Mark can devote more time to book promotion.

Will any of the money raised be used by Mark for living expenses?

All funds contributed toward the minimum goal of $7,000 will be used to purchase the services to publish the book and get it into distribution to online and physical bookstores. Above the minimum goal, all money contributed toward Mark’s Hope Goal of $12,000 will go toward promoting the book so that as many people as possible may hear about it.

Only if contributions exceed $12,000, will any funds be used for living expenses, which will allow Mark to devote more time to book promotion and sharing his disciple making mission work with others.

Has Mark contributed any of his own money to this project?

Yes. He spent about $2,500 to pay professional editors and over $100 for printer paper and ink. He will continue to support this project, as God directs, to help see that it succeeds.

Won’t Mark receive royalties from books he sells once it’s published?

Mark does not expect to receive any personal income from book sales for the first year, or more.

Income from book sales must exceed publishing and promotion costs for Mark to receive any personal income, which would then be applied to the professional costs of his self-employed ministry. Only when total income from his ministry, including book sales, exceeds his ministry expenses, will Mark benefit from book sales.

To keep the book available for printing and distribution requires annual fees of about $500, plus the annual costs associated with bookstores returning unsold paperbacks of at least $199. These costs must be deducted from the estimated gross profit of $2.50 per paperback sold.

Fortunately, the royalties from digital book sales are higher, with lower annual costs, so that e-book sales will help subsidize keeping the paperback version available. However, the typical book without promotion marketing sells less than 100 copies! So, Mark will need to devote time and approximately $5,000 per year to promotion just to cover the annual publishing expenses.

Therefore, Mark will need to sell about 1,340 books per year to cover his costs (i.e., break even). This is why the Hope Goal of $12,000 is so important, because it will provide Mark with $5,000 above the publishing expenses to jump start book promotion to the pastors, churches, and people, like you, who will benefit from this amazing handbook of Christian living.

Where will I be able to purchase copies?

During this fundraising project to publish the book, copies of the book are available to pre-order, allowing you to be among the first to own Driving Through Heaven. After the book is released, online retailers like Christian Book Distributors, Amazon, Barnes & Noble, and others will carry both editions. Bookstores everywhere will be able to order paperback copies on request.

How much will the book cost once it's published?

The final cost is not yet set, but is expected to be around $19.97 for the approximately 370 page paperback and $9.99 for the e-book. We'll update this answer as soon as we know, later this fall or early winter.

 

If you have a question for Mark, please contact him. You’ll receive a personal reply and your question may be added to this list.


Learn more about the book

at the book website

DrivingThroughHeaven.com


TO PRE-ORDER OR CONTRIBUTE:

Click a perk on the right to pre-order books, life skills coaching, or organizational training. Or, to contribute without a perk, enter an amount at the top right and click "Contribute."

Thanks for your contribution.

It is the most comprehensive how-to book on Christian Living ever published. It is based on the premise that if we could go to heaven and see how they live there, then we could live that way on earth.
The good news is that God teaches us in the New Testament how to live like they do in heaven. Because life here is not perfect like heaven, we still have stress and pain, but God has given us all of the spiritual blessings of heaven to enjoy now through a relationship with Jesus Christ (Ephesians 1:3).
Applying God's principles and skills to life can greatly reduce earthly suffering, and increase our experience of the fruit of God's Spirit: love, joy, peace, patience, rest, etc. (see Galatians 5:22-23 for the full list). For more about the book, visit the book website at DrivingThroughHeaven.com.

Why did Mark write it?
Mark's answer: "The original reason was that I was searching for a way to help my clients more quickly learn what they needed. But I couldn't find a book to give my clients that included all of God's New Testament principles and skills for living, which is what I was teaching them. So God told me to write it. Many excellent books on Christian living are based on just one area of God's design for living, like prayer, communications, or dealing with depression.  I've concisely included in one guidebook everything that you need to know to experience more of God in your life and more of the fruit of his Holy Spirit."
"The second reason is that the lack of skills training in churches means that Christ followers do not have the skills to reach out to the unchurched, invite them to become part of God's family, and train them to follow Jesus.  This lack of skills training is the primary cause for the closing of 7,000 churches annually in the U.S, and why researcher George Barna reported that only 1% of Americans experience the most fulfilling life God offers."

What topics are included?
The book is divided into seven parts: you can live in God’s kingdom on earth and experience the Abundant Life Jesus promised, on part on each of the five dimensions of life (spiritual, intellectual, emotional, relational, and physical), how to integrate life, and how to live life to the fullest. The actual Table of Contents from the book is included at the book website on the Sample Chapters page.

Can I read some sample chapters?
Sure. Several sample chapters are included at the book website on the Sample Chapters page, including the Introduction, titled What You Will Learn.

When will the book be published?
Mark will independently publish Driving Through Heaven. First, Mark must raise the funds to hire a company to design and publish the book in paperback and digital (e-book) formats. Once the minimum amount of $7,000 is raised, it will be 4-6 months until you can buy a copy. 
But those who financially partner with Mark to make this book available, will receive a free copy of the book.  Mark hopes the book will be available in both formats by May 1, 2016.

How many pages will it have?
The manuscript has 451 pages, but the actual count for the print editions won't be known until after the interior is designed and "typeset." We're guessing the paperback edition will be about 370 pages, but this answer will be updated as soon as we know, later this fall. Will it include questions for discussion?Each chapter ends with Questions for Meditation or Discussion.
How long did it take Mark to write it?
In December, 1995, God called Mark to write the book, and he began work shortly thereafter, but it wasn’t until 2000 that he produced the first three chapters of the first of three major drafts. He worked on and off on it after that until 2010, when he began the 2nd draft and completed it one year later. 
Changes in the way people prefer to read books, led to a major revision as the 3rd draft, which was completed with the help of a couple of professional editors early in 2015. After a break of several months to create the book website, Mark began proofreading this past summer, with the help of two proofreaders.
All together, he estimates he has devoted over 2,000 hours to the writing project, and many more to the website and the fundraising campaign.
In what formats will the book be published?
The book will be released in paperback and digital (e-book) editions.  Hardcovers require a different printing process from paperbacks and expensive warehouse storage of copies, so hardcovers will not be available at this time.

How many copies will be printed?
Individual copies will be printed when ordered. This "print on demand" method reduces the cost of publishing, so that Mark doesn't have to pay to store a lot of copies in a warehouse. Whenever you order a book from a retailer, a copy will be specially printed for you at the printing company, and usually shipped within one day.
If you would like to own copies of the first-run edition of the paperback, you need to pre-order copies during this campaign. First run copies will not be available after the 40-day campaign ends! Why would I buy a book I haven't seen?We don't expect you to! At the book website, DrivingThroughHeaven.com, you can read everything you would if you were holding a copy in your hand or "looking inside" at Amazon.com:
Read the same information you would find on the back cover
See endorsements for the book (they're also on this page)
Read the Table of Contents, Introduction, and 7 full chapters.
Plus, you can ask the author questions about the book using the forms at the bottom of the book website home page, or through the contact information at this site.Are contributions tax-deductible?
Sorry, no. Mark’s ministry is not an incorporated non-profit, and therefore does not qualify for tax-deductible contributions. The process to obtain non-profit status is complicated, expensive (legal and filing fees), and requires the ability to prove the way contributions are spent over a period of time. God has never led Mark to raise the hundreds of dollars required to incorporate at all, including as a not-for-profit organization. If I change my mind, can I upgrade to a different perk after I've already contributed?Sure. Log in to your Indiegogo account and click to view your perk order. Select the perk you originally chose, then click "Upgrade" to select a new one.Will this Indiegogo site be available for contributions after the campaign ends on Nov. 25, 2015?If the Minimum Goal of $7,000 is not reached by Nov. 25, then the site will no longer accept contributions. However, if the Minimum Goal is reached, then the site will continue to be open. Please help us reach that goal by contributing today.
What if the minimum goal is not reached? Will I still get my books?
All books and coaching hours pre-ordered will be delivered as soon as possible after publication.
We believe that God will raise the money needed to publish the book he told Mark to write, and that if those funds do not come through this campaign, that he will be provide them through other sources. Mark and Christie have funds saved for their retirement that God may ask them to use if needed.

What if there’s money left over after publishing? Or,what if more than the minimum amount of $7,000 is raised?
Any funds remaining after the book is published will be used for promoting the book to pastors, churches, and readers so that book can become known. This marketing work will include purchasing paperback copies to send to people in positions to be able to recommend to others that they buy the book.
If Mark’s Hope Goal of $12,000 is reached, some of the funds will be used for Mark to travel in the U.S. on book tours to promote the book.
Any funds raised toward the Dream Goal of $17,000 (above the $12,000 Hope Goal) will be used for living expenses so that Mark can devote more time to book promotion. 

Will any of the money raised be used by Mark for living expenses?
All funds contributed toward the minimum goal of $7,000 will be used to purchase the services to publish the book and get it into distribution to online and physical bookstores. Above the minimum goal, all money contributed toward Mark’s Hope Goal of $12,000 will go toward promoting the book so that as many people as possible may hear about it. 
Only if contributions exceed $12,000, will any funds be used for living expenses, which will allow Mark to devote more time to book promotion and sharing his disciple making mission work with others. 
Has Mark contributed any of his own money to this project?
Yes. He spent about $2,500 to pay professional editors and over $100 for printer paper and ink. He will continue to support this project, as God directs, to help see that it succeeds.Won’t Mark receive royalties from books he sells once it’s published?
Mark does not expect to receive any personal income from book sales for the first year, or more.
Income from book sales must exceed publishing and promotion costs for Mark to receive any personal income, which would then be applied to the professional costs of his self-employed ministry. Only when total income from his ministry, including book sales, exceeds his ministry expenses, will Mark benefit from book sales.
To keep the book available for printing and distribution requires annual fees of about $500, plus the annual costs associated with bookstores returning unsold paperbacks of at least $199. These costs must be deducted from the estimated gross profit of $2.50 per paperback sold.
Fortunately, the royalties from digital book sales are higher, with lower annual costs, so that e-book sales will help subsidize keeping the paperback version available. However, the typical book without promotion marketing sells less than 100 copies! So, Mark will need to devote time and approximately $5,000 per year to promotion just to cover the annual publishing expenses.
Therefore, Mark will need to sell about 1,340 books per year to cover his costs (i.e., break even). This is why the Hope Goal of $12,000 is so important, because it will provide Mark with $5,000 above the publishing expenses to jump start book promotion to the pastors, churches, and people, like you, who will benefit from this amazing handbook of Christian living.
Where will I be able to purchase copies?
During this fundraising project to publish the book, copies of the book are available to pre-order, allowing you to be among the first to own Driving Through Heaven. After the book is released, online retailers like Christian Book Distributors, Amazon, Barnes & Noble, and others will carry both editions. Bookstores everywhere will be able to order paperback copies on request.
How much will the book cost once it's published?
The final cost is not yet set, but is expected to be around $19.97 for the approximately 370 page paperback and $9.99 for the e-book. We'll update this answer as soon as we know, later this fall or early winter.

  If you have a question for Mark, please contact him. You’ll receive a personal reply and your question may be added to this list.
Learn more about the book
at the book website

DrivingThroughHeaven.com

TO PRE-ORDER OR CONTRIBUTE:
Click a perk on the right to pre-order books, life skills coaching, or organizational training. Or, to contribute without a perk, enter an amount at the top right and click "Contribute."
Thanks for your contribution.

Founded in April 2001 as a premium press release distribution service, WireNews (https://www.wirenews.org) has successfully charged companies for unlimited press release distribution and its been doing this for more than 14 years. Branding itself as "The Affordable Business Wire", the company also offers registered journalists a globally recognised press card (press credential) at an affordable price (http://www.presscards.org).

But the press release distribution industry is ever-changing and WireNews has changed with it. Today, WireNews has plans to relocate its headquarters to Tel Aviv, Israel.

WireNews offers the following:

1. Unlimited Press Release Distribution - £49.99 per month or £499.99 per year;

2. Annual Press Card (Press Credentials) - £49.99 per year;

3. One-Off Press Release Distribution - £1 each

4. Free Blog Space

story:
Dan Joyce is a resident artist of Fullerton, Ca. His works can often be found at the Magoski Arts Colony during the downtown Art Walk. With three college degrees including study abroad in Italy and several published art/poetic novels, he has made himself one of Fullerton’s most known fine artists. You can find his art and more books on his facebook page, his website danjoyce.com or his youtube and vimeo channels for videos and music.

After losing my temper and throwing a brick through my mother’s sliding glass door, I was arrested and charged with one felony count of making my momma mad at me! In the Orange County Jail, I was to regroup and rededicate my life to God as so many do. This humorous loosely illustrated jailhouse journal and joke book tells my testimony.

“A good thing about jail is there is a lot of time for reflection and redirection. You think about what you did wrong. Then about what you’ll do differently when you get out. Then you think about how to get out. Then you try to jump the wall.”

“My third week here in jail, I almost started a race riot accidentally. Half the inmates hated me for almost starting the fight. The other half hated me cause I was white!!!”

“Crime is bad. One short scenario and your whole life can turn upside down. You gotta think before you get stupid, ‘cause when you’re stupid you’re not gonna think.”

But the JKAT is wise 
the JKAT writes
the JKAT makes jail
the best days of his life. 
Shove that up your ass district attorney!!!


What We Need & What You Get

To make this a successful release and book signing this New Years Eve, I am raising $500 to print and self-publish roughly 40 books to be made available in downtown Fullerton and at the Fullerton Art Walk New Years Day.

The Impact

There is much unknown about our country and our country's legal system, a cold insensitive political machine designed  to process and prosecute mainly our impoverished populations. The right to a fair trial, our right to counsel are often denied in this process forcing the accused to plea deals with the courts that are not only unfair, but extremely unconstitutional. If we are to fight wars for our freedoms, then we must go to great lengths to guarantee that we actually have these freedoms we are fighting for! JKAT is a personal eye witness testimony of our political legal system stating that we do not! How can we claim a free country when we have one of the largest prison populations in the world? Please take the time to take a look at this book to see what I am saying!

Risks & Challenges

The only real risk is the blatant challenge to free speech and freedom of the press that this book creates. Designed to question nearly half our Bill of Rights, JKAT is a bold daring book that challenges our freedom to write what we choose in a way that these constitutional rights may not have be contested since the days of Lenny Bruce. Vulgar, bold, opinionated and at times offensive, this book may set forth a new wave of American authors.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share and advertise this message as well as links to the book JKAT on your social media and web pages, so that a true American message in this word can get out there!

story:
Fantasy, but Everywhere

Hey! I'm Elle, a genre-defying writer who loves finding unique ideas and turning them into fantasy worlds. I'm so excited to bring you my first book.

Seastrider is a Frankenstein of genres: gothic horror, coming-of-age fantasy, literary fiction. Literature readers love it. Fantasy readers are intrigued by its unique style. It's unlike anything you've read before.

That's exactly what my writing is: Fantasy, but everywhere.

Here's the summary:

A footprint on a Sea. A curse, a devil, and an apocalypse. A queen who does not know she is a queen—or a warrior.

She begins as a frayling—a creature torn from life itself by grief and guilt.

Her relentless, desperate quest to find the soul of a forgotten Starchild thrusts her into life. But a frayling does not know how to be alive—and she is haunted by a curse she cannot shake: every Starchild she loves will die.

Yet destiny, too, follows her—the legend of a queen that shall return to reclaim the Anonyma, the kingdom that was taken from her. To be worthy of her throne, she must break curses, shatter silence, and learn again and again how to live.

And with the coming of an apocalypse, she must cross an impossible Sea.

But should she fail to break the curse of circles...she will descend once more into darkness and lose everything she fought for.

Told in a gothic style, Seastrider is the coming-of-age story of a young warrior queen’s journey from death to life—and the war to discover herself.

But this book is not just my first brainchild — it's me.

(That's me in my favorite place in Washington)

The writing of Seastrider spans a time of my life when I experienced crushing grief, raw despair, and brilliant triumph. This book is my journey from death to life, set in a fantasy world.

When first I began, I wrote it for myself. Then, as I awoke to the world around me, I learned that words are powerful. Stories can save lives. They saved mine.

So I decided to give my story away. Maybe it could help someone else, too.

I'm a lifetime writer. I've been told I have a rare, unique voice and great ideas — I know my worth. Still, I'm a first-time author. I can't do this alone. Without you, no one will see my book, and I will fail. That's why I need your help.

What I Need

For the entire month of April, you get to join me as I promote and raise funds for my book. To cover the costs of marketing and design, I need to raise $899 (yes, $899).

Believe it or not, people DO judge a book by its cover — so I've spent $450 on a beautiful, professional cover design. In other words, I'm serious about this.

Here's a breakdown of the costs:

  • Cover design: $450
  • Copyright: $45
  • Website: $144
  • Book trailer: $150
  • BookFunnel: $20
  • Indiegogo fees: 5% + (2.9% +.30 per transaction) = ~$80-90 depending on funding and who contributes what)

Total: ~889-899

What You Get

There are three tiers of giving based on contribution amount, plus an Early Bird perk. Make sure and claim your perk when you contribute, as they are not automatically applied.

All backers get:

  • Discount on Seastrider
  • Thank you by name in book's credits and all my platforms
  • Invite to my launch party on May 1!

Early Birds (Contribute between Apr 1-10)

  • A private, live reading of Seastrider

Now for the tiers of giving!

Tier 1: $1

  • Limited eBook edition of Seastrider

Tier 2: $5

  • Limited paperback edition of Seastrider

Tier 3: $25

  • Tier 1 or 2 rewards + a 30-minute call with me to chat about writing, book ideas, author advice, or just life (because we all know how 2021 is, y'all).

And at certain milestones, everyone gets something:

40% funded - Two (2!) raw, unedited copies of Lily’s Song from “the devil that haunts me."

100% funded - A random backer gets a character named after them in my next book.

All extra funds go toward an audiobook version of Seastrider and/or my next book.

Most importantly, you get to join me on this amazing journey. Come sail with me. If I don't reach my goal, I'm still publishing the book (duh) — and you still get your rewards. I'm taking this to the end.

Speaking of the end...

If you're outside the U.S., I'll be hosting a giveaway just for you to get a limited edition paperback for a reasonable price. On me. To enter, just give $5. I'll draw one name out of a hat at the end of the campaign.

How It Works

To get your perks, simply select the one(s) you want on this page. Indiegogo will automatically apply the dollar amount you want to give.

Risks & Challenges

Since the book is finished, there are very few risks involved in funding me. You put in $, you get a book! Here are a few challenges:

  1. I'm using Amazon, Book Depository, and BookFunnel for distribution, so there could be delays in getting your book.
  2. There's a chance I won't raise $899. That doesn't mean you don't get your rewards. The professional work is already done, meaning the content is completely written. You'll get your book.
  3. If you preorder a signed paperback, there's a (marginally) higher risk of COVID. Thus, I'll sanitize each one before I send it (also I'm a hermit and never leave the apartment. Low risk there).
  4. International shipping is super expensive, so I'll do a giveaway for people outside the U.S. who want a limited edition paperback but aren't okay with paying a higher price.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't support me financially, DON'T WORRY! There are plenty of ways to help.

  1. If you have social media, Tweet, share, and repost this campaign and tag me:
    Instagram: @elle.tarragan
    Twitter: @ElleTarragan
    Goodreads: Elle J. Tarragan
  2. If you have a phone (ha!), call or text people who might be interested.
  3. Talk to your friends. Tell your kids. Tell your wife. More than funding, I need EYES! Make me known!

You can share this campaign using the Indiegogo share tools.

For everyone contributing in ANY way — thank you!! I am so excited to make this real.

 

Your writer friend,

Elle J. Tarragan

story:
Summary

Moon Jelly House is a partnership publishing house based out of Edmonton, Alberta. At Moon Jelly House our goal is to publish diverse, emergent, marginalized writers in short-run chapbooks. We pride ourselves on gathering diverse perspectives and giving a platform to writers who have had to fight, push, and breathe heavy to make space for their essential stories. 

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to launch our press! Rest assured, our authors will still be published but we wanted to give you the opportunity to show your support of the behind-the-scenes effort being taken on by our BIPOC team here at Moon Jelly House. 

  • Our goal is to raise $5000.00.
  • You will have the opportunity to receive chapbooks, e-books, membership, and editing.
  • All funds, big or small, will contribute to funding our press in the short and long-term. Funds will go to our artists, designers, and media team to get the word out and get our books into bookstores and into your hands. 

Challenges

Our press was founded by three BIPOC individuals: Nisha Patel, Matthew James Weigel, and Katherine Abbass, and all of our efforts have been contributed for free because we truly believe uplifting BIPOC voices starts here, at the chapbook level. Our press is self-funded, but as we continue to publish we need a little help getting off the ground. 

Other Ways You Can Help

You can help us, without donations, by sharing our page with others who might have the means to contribute, and passing along word that there's a new publishing house in town!

Summary
Moon Jelly House is a partnership publishing house based out of Edmonton, Alberta. At Moon Jelly House our goal is to publish diverse, emergent, marginalized writers in short-run chapbooks. We pride ourselves on gathering diverse perspectives and giving a platform to writers who have had to fight, push, and breathe heavy to make space for their essential stories. 

What We Need & What You Get
We are looking to launch our press! Rest assured, our authors will still be published but we wanted to give you the opportunity to show your support of the behind-the-scenes effort being taken on by our BIPOC team here at Moon Jelly House. 

Our goal is to raise $5000.00.

You will have the opportunity to receive chapbooks, e-books, membership, and editing.

All funds, big or small, will contribute to funding our press in the short and long-term. Funds will go to our artists, designers, and media team to get the word out and get our books into bookstores and into your hands.

story:
What WE'RE ON Needs & How You Benefit

A generous donor has offered to match all gifts for this project up to $2500, so we really need you now. Every dollar contributed to WE'RE ON will be doubled up to $2500, so please help us maximize this gift by giving as generously as you can. 

Funding will be used for printing, promotional, and distribution costs. For an average AJB book, the total cost of publication can be in the tens of thousands of dollars, so please give knowing that your contribution is hard a work delivering the work of June Jordan to readers nationwide.

Contributors to this project will get shout outs on social media when they back A June Jordan Reader. Depending on the level of your gift, you may also receive a limited run JJ postcard pack; a 1st edition copy of We're On: A June Jordan Reader; an exclusive, a limited run of JJ's play The Issue; ebook codes from AJB; a broadside featuring exclusive work by 2017 Whiting Award winner Phillip B. Williams; or whole year of AJB books.

We have big goals, and we'll work hard to meet them. If we can't make the level of funding we're hoping for, we'll pour everything we get into We're On: A June Jordan Reader.

It's All About June Jordan (maybe a little about AJB)

She is among the bravest of us, the most outraged. She feels for us all. She is the universal poet. –Alice Walker

June Jordan (1936–2002) was an award-winning writer and social and political activist. Hers was the voice of liberation in the civil rights, feminist, antiwar, and gay and lesbian rights movements. June Jordan published more than 25 works  literature in may genres, including poetry, fiction, and nonfiction. She was also a journalist of global reputation and a playwright, librettist, and lyricist. We're On: A June Jordan Reader celebrates this American master's life, work, and legacy. It includes poetry, essays, correspondence with Adrienne Rich, part of The Issue, an unpublished play, and so much more. 

Contributors to this momentous project will give an invaluable gift to American letters by bringing June Jordan to readers everywhere in a time when we all really, really need June Jordan! Backing the Reader means giving people the opportunity to connect with Jordan's work, to read and understand the importance, magnitude, and lasting power of her words. Partners give access and help Alice James share June Jordan's  with the world.  

Alice James Books is an independent press that's been publishing poetry since the early 1970's. The press is a nonprofit entity and serves readers by connecting them with important works of poetry by new and established writers.

 

This Project Means a Lot to Us All

We’re On: A June Jordan Reader maps a voice of resistance to navigate history in the making through the heart and soul of a natural seer. This poet-writer returns in full force at a troubling time, as if on cue, and she never backs down. Yes, indeed, we need a voice of inquiry with us at today’s juncture, holding this hefty compendium that critiques the hard realities of freedom in a society that equates ideals of democracy with capitalism. The urgency of poetry is threaded through everything June Jordan laments and praises. —Yusef Komunyakaa

Her lifelong devotion to justice, equality and radical democracy seemed to revolve around the pleasure she felt in hurling beautiful words at a world full of racism, poverty, homophobia and inane politicians determined to present this awful state of affairs. There was always joy in her rage. —Angela Davis

When I’m asked if I think poetry can really do something, really matter, I think of June Jordan. When I’m asked if poetry can truly change things, change a person, I think of June Jordan. And now, when someone is on the brink of giving up on poetry because they think language has no power anymore, no guts anymore, I will give them this brilliant new June Jordan Reader and they will, no doubt, find their faith and courage again. —Ada Límon

The size and scope of this project is a first for AJB, and is a major step for the press. The volume is roughly five times the size of a typical AJ book, and it's multi-genre format marks it a milestone for the press. It's one,however, that we've spent 44 years preparing for. Our passion is building beautiful books. We're On: A June Jordan Reader is the one we've been waiting for.

Other Ways You Can Chip In

If you can't contribute monetarily, that doesn't mean you can't help We're On! Spread the word to your friends and family via email and social media. Indiegogo has share tools! Tell them about the book and why it matters, invite them to give or keep spreading the word. You can also read, teach, review, share, or openly praise June Jordan and this book once it's out in the world. Amplify up her voice, honor her legacy, pass it all on.

story:
Read Our Review at www.underratedreads.com

Posted on November 29, 2016 by J D Jung

(Reviewed by Pat Luboff)

I have a confession to make.  I finished reading this book a while ago.  I was stunned into silence, unable to approach writing the review. The book has haunted me since.

My father went the usual route of people diagnosed with ALS. The doctor says, “You have ALS (amyotrophic lateral sclerosis, aka Lou Gehrig’s Disease), you will die in two years.” Patient dies in two years, or, in the case of my father, less.  Joseph Wions traveled the road less taken. He decided that the usual medical model should be ignored because it offered no hope.  Instead, he explored a wide, I would say dazzling, and sometimes to me, confusing variety of alternative approaches to healing his body from the disease.

In this book, he describes this journey in intimate details.  He takes us from the first twinges that signaled something was wrong with his body to his ultimate spiritual triumph over the terror the disease inflicts on its victims.  Sidebars give us insights from his family and friends.  Excerpts from emails Wions broadcasted to family, friends and co-workers show his public persona, while his own journal writing takes us to the depths of his heart, mind and soul as he faces increasing physical limitations.  What emerges is a portrait of a human being of great intelligence and wisdom and love.

I’m still a little baffled as to how to tackle this review. I think it’s best to just give you a few quotations.  While he says these things in reference to his struggle with ALS, they ring true for me, and I bet they do for you:

”I learned that I had become addicted to a thought process that was not supportive of healing.  The conscious choice that I made to change it has pitted me against all conventional wisdom, which insists that escaping death from ALS is not only unrealistic, but impossible.”

“It takes considerable diligence to stay on the productive side of that fine line between surrender and resignation.  To effectively surrender, I must stay in the moment and abandon all judgments and projections that will invariably generate fear and doubt.  The minute a connection is made between the current circumstances and past experience or future expectations, the moment opens up to a frightening array of negative emotions, which limits me physically and further fuels the fears I have created.”

“When my muscles atrophied to the point that a motorized vehicle was required, I had to find new ways to have fun.”

”I can tell myself over and over again that I am going to beat this disease, but my gut is quick to remind me that I have not yet overcome my addiction to the fear of failure.”

“It took me a while to realize that letting others help me do things that I could no longer do myself was a way of helping them.”

“I have emerged from the nightmare of belief that a horrible and untimely death was rapidly approaching.  Several years after I was expected to be gone, I am still here and have enjoyed miraculous enhancements in my psychological, emotional, spiritual, and physical health.”

This is a must-read book for anyone who has a family member or friend diagnosed with ALS.  In addition to his incredible personal story, Wions offers an appendix of advice and resources on the services and equipment needed by a person who has ALS.  I also highly recommend it for anyone who is facing any physical or emotional challenge.  And who isn’t?

(Editor’s note: For more information on More Time to Love, go to www.moretimetolove.com)

 

How and why did More Time to Love come to exist?

Joe's writing began as a journal of emotions during a dark time. With a diagnosis of ALS, he had little clarity as to how to move forward. What inspired this book was the journal's transformation from an outlet of despair into an inspiring journey of gratitude and love, which gave birth to the initial working title, From Nightmares to Miracles.  In his proposal to publishers, Joe stated:

"My purpose in writing this book is to share my story about the impact of ALS, how I have grown from the experience, and what I have learned as a result. It is my fondest wish that this story will provide hope and inspiration to others who are fighting this devastating disease, and to anyone who is facing a formidable challenge."

When we look back on his writing, his growth and transformation, while extraordinary, are not the only engaging aspects of this book. Just as astonishing is how his community rose to the challenge of support, and embraced the Wions family's cause as their own. Joe's ability to motivate, teach, and enlist help from the people around him was just as impressive as what he was able to accomplish with regard to ALS. The more love and value he created around himself, the more he inspired and helped others. And so this book became not only about the extension and improvement of the life of an ALS patient, but about amplifying the love, and sharing his strategies for dealing with hardship with all who could benefit.

How is this book different from other books about ALS patients? How was Joe Wions' approach unique?

Joe was a tireless data collector and motivator, and an active member of a support group of ALS patients called Healers with ALS (HALS), many of whom are living 10-30 years beyond their prognosis. A few members from this community are in the process of writing their own books—some offering nutritional regimens through which they received positive results, others sharing their experience in an attempt to raise awareness and money for research. While Joe does both of these things, More Time to Love is not just about dealing with ALS; it offers insight and inspiration to anyone faced with overwhelming challenge or hardship. Joe's book is designed to help people put their problems in perspective, give them hope, focus their energies on the good in their lives and the choices they have the power to make, and motivate them to act on those choices to live healthier, more deliberate and satisfying lives. Tuesdays With Morrie, by Mitch Album, inspired millions to make the most of each day through Morrie's example of appreciating the beauty and love in his life as he accepted his demise. However, while Morrie's story is about making peace with dying, Joe (with similar dignity, humor, wisdom, and grace) fought for his life, and fought to find a cure for the disease. The Joe Wions story has the potential to inspire and empower anyone struggling with chronic illness, by modeling an indefatigable intention to live fully, and an unwavering determination to do what it takes to beat the odds.

Why we need your help

  • The good news is that we have a finished book, a wonderful book, a beautiful book. However, we need your support to help publicize and promote this work.
  • Our goal is to sell 1000 copies of More Time to Love in the first year, making a splash in the publishing world so that this book can take root and grow wings to become a widely read and valued contribution to the way the world seeks healing.
  • We need help getting Joe's story out there to those who it may benefit. To do this, quantity of book sales matter more than profits. Your donations will count as book sales that will ultimately help us to reach these goals.
  • ALS continues to diminish lives. The support needed by those who suffer it will continue until a cure is found. A portion of proceeds from More Time to Love  will always be donated to the ALS association, so that they may continue to use their resources to help families like ours.

The perks you've all been waiting for

  • Digital copy of More time to Love
  • Soft cover copy of More Time to Love
  • Hand written and signed thank you letter from the Wions family
  • mp3 recording of From Nightmares to Miracles, piano piece by Dan Wions (excerpts can be heard in the video)
  • Note cards and full-size prints from Creations by Julie (please see options below)
  • Copy of one of Joe's favorite healing guides, mentioned in More Time to Love
  • Front row seats to SerenAIDe + SerenAIDe T-Shirts
  • $100 Massage Envy gift certificate
  • Live performance by Dan Wions

Creations by Julie perk options:

Please review the following note card and full-size print options—mentioned above, and in the packages along the right hand side of this page.  We will follow up with you throughout and after the campaign to inquire about your preferences.

Pack of note cards:

Hummingbird Note Card Set (envelopes included)

Orchid Note Card Set (envelopes included)

 

Full-Size Print Options:

             

 

Other Ways You Can Help

For more information about ALS and links to more ways to contribute, please visit the links page on the More Time to Love website, or contact us at info@moretimetolove.com.

 

Please share so that our father's words will continue to help those in need!
